original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: stong pa nyid bdun cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bdun cu pa'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: He who knows dependent originationüîΩTo be unborn taught it

original: skye ba med par mkhyen nas bstan //üîΩthugs rje che mnga'i rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: skye ba med par mkhyen nas bstan // thugs rje che mnga'i rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: To be selfless,üîΩTo be peace.üîΩI bow to that perfect Buddha,üîΩThe great compassionate one,

original: 'gro ba'i bla ma de la 'dud //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bla ma de la 'dud //
translated: The teacher of the world.

original: yid kyi mun la nyi ma'i lta'i //
analyzed: yid kyi mun la nyi ma'i lta'i //
translated: The sun that dispels the darkness of the mind,

original: 'phags pa klu sgrub la btud nas //üîΩde yi stong nyid bdun cu pa'i //
analyzed: 'phags pa klu sgrub la btud nas // de yi stong nyid bdun cu pa'i //
translated: I bow to the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjunaüîΩAnd will explain the meaning

original: don ni rnam par dbye bar bya //
analyzed: don ni rnam par dbye bar bya //
translated: Of his Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness.

original: sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam bzhin //
analyzed: sgyu ma ji bzhin rmi lam bzhin //
translated: Like an illusion, like a dream,

original: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ji bzhin du //
translated: Like a city of the gandharvas,

original: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin skye dang de bzhin gnas //
translated: So is arising, so is enduring,

original: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni 'jig pa gsungs //
translated: So is disintegration taught.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbu ma'i lhag mar gyur pa nyid kyis de'i brgal ba'i lan btab pa gtso bo nyid du brtsams par 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rang rgyud pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbu ma'i lhag mar gyur pa nyid kyis de'i brgal ba'i lan btab pa gtso bo nyid du brtsams par 'dod pa'i phyir rab tu byed pa 'di rang rgyud pa nyid spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he wishes to compose the reply to the objections of the remainder of the Madhyamaka, namely, the one who is the chief proponent of the self, he abandons the nature of an independent treatise.

original: bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba ma brjod par thog mar 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi /
analyzed: bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba ma brjod par thog mar 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi /
translated: Without stating praise and homage, he first states the following of noble Nagarjuna:

original: gnas pa'am skye 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas pa'am skye 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAbiding, arising, and ceasing‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni 'di ltar 'jug par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar 'jug par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is how it should be engaged.

original: bskal par mi nyung bar goms pas brnyes pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du mdzad pas rnam par 'khrul pa mtha' dag bsal zhing thugs rje chen pos khyab pa'i thugs mnga' bas slu bar mi mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na /
analyzed: bskal par mi nyung bar goms pas brnyes pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du mdzad pas rnam par 'khrul pa mtha' dag bsal zhing thugs rje chen pos khyab pa'i thugs mnga' bas slu bar mi mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na /
translated: The Bhagavan, who has actualized reality that is attained through familiarization for many eons, who has dispelled all error, and whose mind is pervaded by great compassion, does not deceive. When he turned the wheel of dharma,

original: sgrib pa thams cad sbyangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad sbyangs pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to purify all obscurations,

original: chos thams cad bdag med par bstan pa'i yan lag nyid du sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dag gis skye ba la sogs pa mi bden par gyur pa gang bstan pa de nyid gzhan gyi tshe rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa sel ba
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med par bstan pa'i yan lag nyid du sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe dag gis skye ba la sogs pa mi bden par gyur pa gang bstan pa de nyid gzhan gyi tshe rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa sel ba
translated: But how can that same teaching be otherwise at another time?

original: lhur len pa nyid du 'di bstan to //
analyzed: lhur len pa nyid du 'di bstan to //
translated: This is taught in order to remove that doubt.

original: skyob pa'i bstan pa ni dad pa dang nges pa'i don gyi dbye ba las rnam pa gnyis so ;
analyzed: skyob pa'i bstan pa ni dad pa dang nges pa'i don gyi dbye ba las rnam pa gnyis so ;
translated: The teaching of the Protector is twofold, according to its division into that of the Disciples and that of the Great Vehicle.

original: / de la dang po ni rab tu 'bar ba'i khyim na gnas pa'i byis pa dag 'don pa'i thabs su chang ba stong pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: / de la dang po ni rab tu 'bar ba'i khyim na gnas pa'i byis pa dag 'don pa'i thabs su chang ba stong pa bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Of these, the first is like the teaching of an empty vessel to children who are living in a burning house, as a means of getting them out.

original: mi bden du zin kyang bden pa nyid du bstan pas don bya ba can ni dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: mi bden du zin kyang bden pa nyid du bstan pas don bya ba can ni dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: Although it is not true, it is taught as if it were true, and so it serves a purpose. It is of indirect meaning.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩAlthough it is not true,

original: mi bden na yang thugs rje yis//
analyzed: mi bden na yang thugs rje yis//
translated: through compassion

original: @337b bdag yod ces ni gsungs pa ltar //
analyzed: @337b bdag yod ces ni gsungs pa ltar //
translated: the Lord has said that the self exists

original: nyan thos rnams ni 'jug bya'i phyir //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni 'jug bya'i phyir //
translated: in order to introduce the Disciples.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa gsungs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa gsungs //
translated: The truths of suffering and so on were taught.üîΩ

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: The truths of suffering, etc. are taught.

original: dman pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can dag la ni de kho na nyid zab mo bstan par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dman pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can dag la ni de kho na nyid zab mo bstan par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not proper to teach the profound reality to those who are of the lineage of the inferior enlightenment,

original: de dag ni nges don ma byas pa slar skrag pa rnams de spangs pa'i las chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las nye bar sog cing /
analyzed: de dag ni nges don ma byas pa slar skrag pa rnams de spangs pa'i las chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las nye bar sog cing /
translated: because they are frightened by the definitive meaning, and they accumulate the karma of rejecting it, the karma that leads to destitution of the Dharma,

original: ngan song gi sdug bsngal yang so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song gi sdug bsngal yang so sor nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they experience the suffering of the miserable destinies.

original: gnyis pa ni de kho na can te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de kho na can te /
translated: The second is the reality,

original: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reality that is engaged in just as it is.

original: 'dir yang 'jig rten bsnyad pa'i sgra ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'jig rten bsnyad pa'i sgra ni /
translated: Here, the words of mundane convention

original: dang po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: are not contradictory at all, because they are accepted at first.

original: kha cig na re skye ba las dus phyis nyid du gnas pa yin yang dang por brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa sdeb pa'i ngor yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re skye ba las dus phyis nyid du gnas pa yin yang dang por brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa sdeb pa'i ngor yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that it is later than arising, but it is stated first for the sake of metrical form.

original: gzhan dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa yang dag par bstan pa'i don du'ang zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa yang dag par bstan pa'i don du'ang zhe'o //
translated: Others say that it is in order to teach the process of dependent origination.

original: 'di ltar skye ba ni 'dod rgyal mi srid la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba ni 'dod rgyal mi srid la /
translated: Thus, arising is not possible by chance,

original: dbang phyug gi rgyu can yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi rgyu can yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang nyon mongs pa dang las kyi rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: nor is it caused by God, but rather it is caused by the signs of afflictions and actions.

original: de yang byed pa po gnas na ni de'i 'bras bu longs spyod par rigs kyi mi gnas na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po gnas na ni de'i 'bras bu longs spyod par rigs kyi mi gnas na ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the experiencer of the result existed, it would be logical that the result would be experienced, but if it did not exist, it would not be logical.

original: byas pa chud zos shing ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa chud zos shing ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the error of the destruction of karma that has been done and the error of encountering that which has not been done would ensue.

original: gnas pa yang mu stegs bye brag pa rnams ni snga ma'i ngo bo ma dor ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yang mu stegs bye brag pa rnams ni snga ma'i ngo bo ma dor ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes smra'o //
translated: Moreover, the tƒ´rthikas say that endurance is the intrinsic reality of not discarding the former state.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dag ni de yang byed pa po'i gnas skabs bzhin du za ba po'i gnas skabs su yang za ba po ma yin par thal bas mi 'thad pas na de ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba nyid do zhe'o
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dag ni de yang byed pa po'i gnas skabs bzhin du za ba po'i gnas skabs su yang za ba po ma yin par thal bas mi 'thad pas na de ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa'i 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba nyid do zhe'o
translated: The Sugata has said that just as the agent does not exist in the state of the agent, so too the experiencer does not exist in the state of the experiencer. Therefore, it is the arising of other and other similarities that belong to a single continuum.

original: // de lta bu'i ngo bo gnas pa de yang /
analyzed: // de lta bu'i ngo bo gnas pa de yang /
translated: The abiding of such a nature is taught to be the characteristic of the links that are stated in the sutra:

original: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs sngon gnas skabs //
translated: Ignorance is the state of affliction in the past.

original: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni sngon las kyi //
translated: Formation is past karma.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yan lag dag gis /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi yan lag dag gis /
translated: The links that are stated in the sutra:

original: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
analyzed: rnam shes mtshams sbyor phung po yin //
translated: Consciousness is the appropriator of the aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyis mtshon pa'i skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams kyis mtshon pa'i skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: and so on are taught to be the characteristics of the causes of birth.

original: rgyu mtshan yang rgyu mtshan can las snga ma kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang rgyu mtshan can las snga ma kho na yin no //
translated: The cause is the prior state of the one who has the cause.

original: skye ba yang 'jig pa'i mtha' can yin no zhes @338a * //
analyzed: skye ba yang 'jig pa'i mtha' can yin no zhes @338a * //
translated: And birth has the characteristic of destruction.

original: mtshon pa'i don du tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin zhes phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rga shi'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: mtshon pa'i don du tshor ba'i bar ni rga shi yin zhes phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rga shi'i sgras bstan to //
translated: and up to feeling is old age and death, which is the affliction of birth in the future.

original: de lta ba yin pa des na /
analyzed: de lta ba yin pa des na /
translated: Thus,

original: gnas pa'am skye 'jig ces bya ba'i tshig gis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa'am skye 'jig ces bya ba'i tshig gis 'dir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: the twelve members of dependent origination are taught in order by the words ‚Äúenduring, arising, and passing away.‚Äù

original: yod med dam zhes bya ba la kye bram ze 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yod med dam zhes bya ba la kye bram ze 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚Äú Existence and nonexistence‚Äù means, ‚ÄúO Brahmin, it is like this:

original: thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad dag go //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po lnga dang skye mched bcu gnyis dang khams bco brgyad dag go //
translated: all of all‚Äù refers to the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, and the eighteen elements.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni yod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir phung po dang skye mched dang khams zhes bya ba'i dngos po ni yod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the things called ‚Äúaggregates,‚Äù ‚Äúsense spheres,‚Äù and ‚Äúelements‚Äù exist,

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are perceived by mundane valid cognition.

original: rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa ni med pa ste tshad ma med pa de'i phyir dang tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na yod pa ni myong ba yin la /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dang las la sogs pa ni med pa ste tshad ma med pa de'i phyir dang tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro // yang na yod pa ni myong ba yin la /
translated: Substance, quality, action, etc. do not exist because there is no valid cognition of them and because they are contradicted by valid cognition.

original: med pa ni de las cig shos te /üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: med pa ni de las cig shos te / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, existence is experience and nonexistence is the opposite of that.

original: khams gsum po 'di dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum po 'di dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, existence is the three realms and nonexistence is the opposite of that.üîΩOr, existence is the three realms and nonexistence is the opposite of that.

original: yang na yod med kyi sgras ni gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po brjod do //üîΩgang phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing /
analyzed: yang na yod med kyi sgras ni gang zag ces bya ba'i dngos po brjod do // gang phung po 'di dag 'dor zhing /
translated: Or, the words existence and nonexistence refer to the thing called the person.

original: phung po gzhan nye bar len pa khur khyer ba'i gang zag ni yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: phung po gzhan nye bar len pa khur khyer ba'i gang zag ni yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de ni yod pa'o //
translated: The person who abandons these aggregates and appropriates other aggregates is said to exist because it is said, ‚ÄúThe person who carries the burden takes up the burden.‚Äù

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir med pa ste /
translated: It does not exist because it cannot be said to be the same or different.

original: de dag brjod du med pa ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag brjod du med pa ni med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is said that it does not exist because it cannot be said to exist or not to exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: med phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog / de nyid gzhan du ma gsungs so //
analyzed: med phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis srog / de nyid gzhan du ma gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn did not say that life is the same as or different from the body.

original: zhes bya ba dang / dngos po yod pa ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / dngos po yod pa ni de nyid dam gzhan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bshad do //
translated: An existent thing does not pass beyond identity and difference.

original: da 'o na ni ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: da 'o na ni ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it exist?

original: phung po'i rgyun nyid la de ltar tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun nyid la de ltar tha snyad btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is designated in that way with regard to the continuum of the aggregates.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags dag gis gang zhing khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dag tu skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags dag gis gang zhing khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dag tu skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang /
translated: Thus, the person is that which is filled with the latent proclivities of the afflictions and karma, and which is born in the realms, destinies, and forms of life, and which is subject to aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag gis zag cing 'grib pa'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dag gis zag cing 'grib pa'am /
translated: suffering, unhappiness, and anxiety.

original: zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi chu bzhin du zag cing rgyun du 'byung ba ni gang zag go //
analyzed: zo chun gyi 'khrul 'khor gyi chu bzhin du zag cing rgyun du 'byung ba ni gang zag go //
translated: Or, the person is that which is filled and flows like the water in a waterwheel.

original: don 'di yang phung po'i rgyun @338b las gzhan ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yang phung po'i rgyun @338b las gzhan ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This meaning is not reasonable apart from the continuum of the aggregates.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: btags pa'ang med du 'gyur 'ong bas //
analyzed: btags pa'ang med du 'gyur 'ong bas //
translated: If it were a mere designation, it would not exist.

original: med do zhes kyang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: med do zhes kyang ma gsungs so //
translated: But it is not said that it does not exist.

original: phung po'i rgyun ni gang la dge / mi dge'i 'bras bu yod pa nyid //
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun ni gang la dge / mi dge'i 'bras bu yod pa nyid //
translated: What is the continuum of the aggregates, which is the basis of the results of virtue and nonvirtue?

original: de la srog ces bya ste de //üîΩsrog med bstan pas med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la srog ces bya ste de // srog med bstan pas med par 'gyur //
translated: That is called ‚Äúlife force.‚Äù

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it is taught that there is no life force, it does not exist.

original: dman pa'am zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dman pa'am zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Inferior‚Äù refers to contaminated things.üîΩ‚Äú

original: khyad par can ni zag pa med pa'o //üîΩmnyam pa nyid ni gnyi ga ltar yang /
analyzed: khyad par can ni zag pa med pa'o // mnyam pa nyid ni gnyi ga ltar yang /
translated: Superior‚Äù refers to uncontaminated things.üîΩ‚ÄúüîΩEquality‚Äù refers to both.

original: rigs mthun pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa la ltos nas so //
translated: This is in terms of their similarity of type.

original: bstan pa 'di kho na nyid du ci ltar ma rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di kho na nyid du ci ltar ma rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this teaching not ignorance?

original: bdag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is not the self, etc.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du yod pa min zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du yod pa min zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not exist in reality‚Äù is implied.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: gal te bdag de kho na nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe gnas pa yang de'i ngo bor rtag par brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ni de lta bu yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: gal te bdag de kho na nyid du gyur pa yin na de'i tshe gnas pa yang de'i ngo bor rtag par brjod par 'gyur ba zhig na 'di ni de lta bu yang ma yin te ;
translated: If the self existed in reality, then its nature would be described as permanent and enduring. But this is not the case.

original: tshad ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of valid cognition and because it is undermined by valid cognition.

original: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i ngo bo yin yang nye bar btags pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i ngo bo yin yang nye bar btags pa nyid do //
translated: Even though the nature of things is to arise as one similar thing after another, it is still merely a designation.

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa'i ngo bo phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bdag med pa dang / bdag dang bdag med kyi ngo bo'i gang zag de kho na nyid can yin na ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i tha snyad kyang dngos po pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa'i ngo bo phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams dang / rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bdag med pa dang / bdag dang bdag med kyi ngo bo'i gang zag de kho na nyid can yin na ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra'i tha snyad kyang dngos po pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, if the aggregates, elements, and media, which are the nature of selflessness, and the selflessness of mere consciousness, and the person, which is the nature of both self and selflessness, were reality, then the terms ‚Äúarising,‚Äù ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù ‚Äúexistence,‚Äù and so on would be only real.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: But when

original: gzugs ni dbu ba ltar shes shing //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba ltar shes shing //
translated: Form is known to be like foam,

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur bzhin //
translated: Feelings are like water bubbles,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu 'dra ba ste //
translated: Perceptions are like mirages,

original: 'du byed dag ni chu shing bzhin //
analyzed: 'du byed dag ni chu shing bzhin //
translated: Formations are like plantain trees,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu zhes //
translated: And consciousness is like an illusion,

original: de ltar phung po bstan pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar phung po bstan pa yin //
translated: Thus the aggregates are taught.

original: zhes gzhan du 'phags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rigs pas 'di dag de kho na nyid can ma yin pa de'i tshe der skye ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi tha snyad ji ltar na de kho na nyid can du 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes gzhan du 'phags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'i phyir dang / 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rigs pas 'di dag de kho na nyid can ma yin pa de'i tshe der skye ba la sogs pa'i chos kyi tha snyad ji ltar na de kho na nyid can du 'gyur /
translated: and because these are not reality through the reasoning to be explained, then how could the conventions of phenomena such as arising be reality?

original: de lta bas na pha rol pos kun brtags pa'i bdag dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i bdag med pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi gang zag tu zhen pa'i @339a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na pha rol pos kun brtags pa'i bdag dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i lhag par zhen pa'i bdag med pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang / de nyid kyi gang zag tu zhen pa'i @339a * //
translated: Therefore, the self imputed by the opponent and the aggregates imputed by the self-habits of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are not the self and aggregates that are reality.

original: bdag dang bdag med pa ni gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa'i tha snyad de kho na nyid du cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa ni gang gi phyir de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gnas pa la sogs pa'i brjod pa'i tha snyad de kho na nyid du cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: The self that is the self-habit of the person and the selflessness that is the selflessness of the person are not reality. Therefore it is untenable that the conventions expressed by the terms ‚Äúenduring,‚Äù etc., are reality in the least.

original: 'o na ni chos 'di dag de kho na nyid du ji ltar brjod par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni chos 'di dag de kho na nyid du ji ltar brjod par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how are these phenomena to be expressed as reality?

original: chos kun mya ngan 'das pa dang // mtshungs par brjod bya dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos kun mya ngan 'das pa dang // mtshungs par brjod bya dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: All phenomena are said to be similar to nirvana.

original: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba 'brel to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú And‚Äù connects this to the previous line.

original: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / spros pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams thams cad ci ltar mtshungs te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa dang / spros pa'i bdag nyid can gyi chos rnams thams cad ci ltar mtshungs te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: How can nirvana, which is the pacification of all elaborations, be similar to phenomena, which are by nature elaborations? Because they are contradictory.

original: rang bzhin stong zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs su bkod pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin stong zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par gyi sgo nas gtan tshigs su bkod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Empty of intrinsic nature‚Äù is also stated as a reason from the perspective of a distinction.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is as follows.

original: ci ltar rab rib can gyis skra shad dang sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa mi bden pa nyid kyis spros pa'i bdag nyid can yin du zin kyang ji ltar snang ba bzhin de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar rab rib can gyis skra shad dang sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sbrang bu la sogs pa mi bden pa nyid kyis spros pa'i bdag nyid can yin du zin kyang ji ltar snang ba bzhin de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as those with diseased vision see hairs, flies, and so on, which are unreal and by nature elaborations, but they do not exist as they appear, they are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar rtogs pa med kyang de med pa dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bden pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags las yang dag par 'byung bar snang ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams kyi
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med kyang de med pa dang mtshungs pa de bzhin du 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas bden pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags las yang dag par 'byung bar snang ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa chos rnams kyi
translated: Just as it is not realized that the nature of things is like nirvana, in the same way, the collection of things such as form, which appear to arise from the latent propensities of the manifest clinging to true existence since beginningless cyclic existence,

original: tshogs kyang yin pa'i phyir 'di mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: tshogs kyang yin pa'i phyir 'di mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa la 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: is similar to nirvana. There is not the slightest contradiction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang de kho na nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang de kho na nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the conventions of ‚Äúinferior,‚Äù ‚Äúequal,‚Äù and ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù are also not tenable in reality.

original: de ltar yang /üîΩji ltar gos bzhin dngos po rnams //
analyzed: de ltar yang / ji ltar gos bzhin dngos po rnams //
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩJust as clothes,

original: du ma'i rnam pa tha dad kyang //
analyzed: du ma'i rnam pa tha dad kyang //
translated: although they have many different forms,

original: stong nyid me yis bsregs rnams kyi //üîΩthal ba tha dad cung zad med //
analyzed: stong nyid me yis bsregs rnams kyi // thal ba tha dad cung zad med //
translated: when burned by the fire of emptiness,

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: their ashes are not the slightest bit different.

original: 'dir 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i grangs can pa dang / de las gzhan 'bras bu med par smra ba dag / gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i grangs can pa dang / de las gzhan 'bras bu med par smra ba dag / gtan tshigs 'di ma grub bo zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Here, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya who advocates the existence of effects and those others who advocate the nonexistence of effects say, ‚ÄúThis reason is not established.‚Äù

original: de dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du /
translated: They say this:

original: gang zhig gang las skye ba de la ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu ni rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las skye ba de la ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rgyu ni rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which arises from something is said to be the nature of that, because the cause is expressed by the term ‚Äònature.‚Äô

original: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs can no//
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs can no//
translated: It is an entity that has the nature of gold.

original: @339b der yang dngos po 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin te med pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du de las skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @339b der yang dngos po 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du yod pa yin te med pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du de las skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, an entity that exists in the nature of an effect is not nonexistent, because it is not tenable that what is nonexistent, like the horn of an ass, arises from that.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams ni rgyu'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams ni rgyu'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the nature of effects exists in the nature of the cause,

original: ji ltar na rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin /
translated: how can it be empty of intrinsic nature?

original: yang na rang gi ngo bo rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na rang gi ngo bo rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Or, the intrinsic nature is expressed by the term ‚Äònature‚Äô as its essence.

original: dper na sa'i khams sra ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa'i khams sra ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the earth element has the nature of solidity.

original: rgyu las skye bzhin pa'i dngos po de'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid du yang de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu las skye bzhin pa'i dngos po de'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid du yang de lta ma yin te /
translated: Things that are in the process of arising from causes do not exist in their own nature, but they are not non-existent in their own nature,

original: de dag ni rang rang gi ngo bo dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa dag kho na skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni rang rang gi ngo bo dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa dag kho na skye ba'i phyir /
translated: because they are born with their own individual natures.

original: dper na lus kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i 'byung ba bzhi las 'byung ba dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang dri dang ro lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lus kyi dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i 'byung ba bzhi las 'byung ba dbang po tha dad pas gzung bar bya ba'i gzugs dang dri dang ro lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the four elements that are apprehended by the body faculty are form, smell, and taste that are apprehended by different faculties.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni rgyu las rang bzhin stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni rgyu las rang bzhin stong pa nyid ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, they say that things are not empty of intrinsic reality in terms of causes.

original: 'dir lan ni /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni /
translated: Here is the response:üîΩBecause all things

original: gang phyir dngos po thams cad kyi //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs so //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos po thams cad kyi // zhes bya ba la sogs so //
translated: are empty of intrinsic reality,üîΩthey are not empty of their intrinsic reality.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa'am med par khas blangs ba rnams ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu'i bdag nyid yod pa'am med par khas blangs ba rnams ni /
translated: Because things that are accepted as existent or nonexistent in the nature of causes

original: skye dgu'am de las gzhan pa thams cad la de ma thag tu 'tshang  par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo //üîΩrgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so'i dngos po rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skye dgu'am de las gzhan pa thams cad la de ma thag tu 'tshang  par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo // rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so'i dngos po rnams zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dir bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not reasonable that it would immediately pervade all things, or anything other than that, therefore intrinsic reality is established as emptiness.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúall things‚Äù is explained by the words ‚Äúthe collection of causes and conditions or the individual entities.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / so so'i dngos po nyid ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa dang / so so'i dngos po nyid ces bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe collection of causes and conditions or the individual entities‚Äù is to be applied to the words ‚Äúall things.‚Äù

original: rgyu ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: A cause is that which appropriates.

original: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: rkyen ni lhan cig byed pa rnams so //
translated: Conditions are the co-arising factors.

original: tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshang ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni rgyu dang rkyen tshang ba'o //
translated: A collection is the completeness of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las phyi rol du gyur pa ni so so'i dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las phyi rol du gyur pa ni so so'i dngos po nyid do //
translated: That which is external to causes and conditions is an individual entity.

original: de la rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid du sems pa gang yin pa de dag la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu las rnam pa gsum du brtags nas de dang bral ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid du sems pa gang yin pa de dag la rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i dbye bas rgyu las rnam pa gsum du brtags nas de dang bral ba bstan to //
translated: For those who think that the effect exists in the nature of the cause, three kinds of causes are distinguished by the division of the collection of causes and conditions, and they are refuted.

original: 'bras bu med par smra ba la yang rgyu las gzhan du 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas len pa de bsal ba'i phyir so so'i dngos po bsnyad do //üîΩgang yang gang la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig par mngon pa de ji ltar @340a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par smra ba la yang rgyu las gzhan du 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas len pa de bsal ba'i phyir so so'i dngos po bsnyad do // gang yang gang la skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig par mngon pa de ji ltar @340a * //
translated: And for those who maintain that the effect does not exist, the intrinsic reality of the effect is accepted as being other than the cause, and that is refuted by the expression ‚Äúintrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin stong pa pa yin snyam du sems pa de la skye ba bkag pa'i sgo gnas pa dang 'gag pa yang bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa pa yin snyam du sems pa de la skye ba bkag pa'i sgo gnas pa dang 'gag pa yang bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And for those who think that whatever is manifest as arising, enduring, and ceasing cannot be empty of intrinsic reality, in order to refute arising, and to show that enduring and ceasing are also refuted,

original: yod pa yod phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yod pa yod phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause existence exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows.

original: re zhig skye ba 'di ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
analyzed: re zhig skye ba 'di ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
translated: First, this arising is causeless.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis de ni khyed nyid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid kyis de ni khyed nyid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sometimes, you yourself have accepted that it has a cause.

original: 'di rgyu las byung na yang rang ngam gzhan nam de gnyi ga las 'gyur zhes brtag ste /
analyzed: 'di rgyu las byung na yang rang ngam gzhan nam de gnyi ga las 'gyur zhes brtag ste /
translated: If it arises from a cause, then it must be examined whether it arises from itself, from another, or from both.

original: phyogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other alternative.

original: de la re zhig rang las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rang las ni ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, it does not arise from itself,

original: 'di ni skye ba'i snga rol du rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod par khas blangs na 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba'i snga rol du rgyu'i bdag nyid la 'bras bu'i rang bzhin yod par khas blangs na 'gyur te /
translated: because if you accept that the nature of the effect exists in the nature of the cause prior to arising,

original: med la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: med la 'byung ba yod ma yin //
translated: then arising would not exist.

original: zhes bya ba gang smras pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang smras pa yin no //
translated: This is what you said in the statement, ‚ÄúThere is no arising of what exists.‚Äù

original: yod pa ni skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ni skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not tenable that what exists arises,

original: yod pa'i phyir gsal ba'i bum pa de dang skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir gsal ba'i bum pa de dang skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: because it exists, like a manifest pot or a manifest person.

original: ji ste nus pa'i bdag nyid yod pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste nus pa'i bdag nyid yod pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you assert that what exists in the nature of potentiality arises in the nature of manifestation,

original: de ltar na ni 'o na bdag nyid gang gis yod pa des ni mi skye zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'o na bdag nyid gang gis yod pa des ni mi skye zhing /
translated: then in that case, it does not arise by the very nature of what exists.

original: gang gis skye ba des ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par smra bar gsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis skye ba des ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu med par smra bar gsal bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, it is clear that the one who is born accepts that the effect does not exist.

original: de bas na rang las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na rang las skye bar rigs pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that it arises from itself.

original: / gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: / gzhan las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it logical that it arises from another.

original: gang gi phyir 'di gzhan las 'dod pa na 'bras bu med par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di gzhan las 'dod pa na 'bras bu med par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: Because if one asserts that it arises from another, one asserts that the effect does not exist.

original: med par yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med par yang skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that what does not exist arises.

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar sems pa yin te /üîΩskye ba ni bya ba yin la de la yang byed pa po med par yang mi rigs la tha dad pa'i byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pa yin te / skye ba ni bya ba yin la de la yang byed pa po med par yang mi rigs la tha dad pa'i byed pa ma yin te /
translated: This is the thought:

original: las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Arising is an action. It is not logical that it exists without an agent. Nor is it logical that it is an action of something different from it, because there is no different action.

original: las tha dad pa dang bcas pa nyid la ni byed pa po tha dad pa srid pa yin te /
analyzed: las tha dad pa dang bcas pa nyid la ni byed pa po tha dad pa srid pa yin te /
translated: If it has a different action, it is possible that it has a different agent,

original: byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like ‚Äúhe cooks‚Äù and so on.

original: tha mi dad pa skye ba'i snga rol du med pa ni nus pa'i byed pa po'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa skye ba'i snga rol du med pa ni nus pa'i byed pa po'i phyogs sam /
translated: If it is not different, it is not possible that it exists prior to arising, because it is not logical that it exists without an agent.

original: rdzas kyi byed pa po'i phyogs yin yang sla ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi byed pa po'i phyogs yin yang sla ste /
translated: Even if it is the side of the substantial agent,

original: byed pa po nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir gang zhig skye ba yin /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir gang zhig skye ba yin /
translated: since it is not logical that it is the agent, what is it that arises?

original: ci ste 'di brda sprod pa pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kyi rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ste 'di brda sprod pa pa rnams kyi gzhung lugs kyi rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: But if this is the reasoning of the grammatical tradition,

original: kho bo cag rkyen nyid 'di btsam  du smra ba rnams kyis bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag rkyen nyid 'di btsam  du smra ba rnams kyis bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not something to be taught by us who advocate mere conditions.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: @340b 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: @340b 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are momentary.

original: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod //
analyzed: mi gnas bya ba ga la yod //
translated: How could they be impermanent?

original: de dag 'byung gang de nyid ni //
analyzed: de dag 'byung gang de nyid ni //
translated: That which arises from them

original: bya ba de nyid byed par brjod //
analyzed: bya ba de nyid byed par brjod //
translated: is said to be the activity of that.

original: ces kho bo cag ni de skad du smra'o //
analyzed: ces kho bo cag ni de skad du smra'o //
translated: We say this.

original: de'i phyir na skye ba ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na skye ba ni rgyu yod na 'byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore arising is said to occur when a cause exists.

original: 'bras bu med du zin kyang rgyu'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i dang tshul can du 'byung ba de nyid la de skad du bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa cung zad kyang med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu med du zin kyang rgyu'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i dang tshul can du 'byung ba de nyid la de skad du bstan pa'i phyir nyes pa cung zad kyang med do zhe na /
translated: Even if the effect does not exist, it arises in the manner of arising in the presence of the cause. Since that is taught, there is not the slightest fault.

original: 'dir yang bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa /
translated: Here, in response to that, it is said:

original: 'bras bu med pa la rgyu gang yin pa de la rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa po zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzhan las de'i med par skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'dir med pa nyid sgrub par byed paüîΩgsungs so // 'o na ni de gnyis ka las 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa la rgyu gang yin pa de la rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa po zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas gzhan las de'i med par skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dgongs pas 'dir med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa gsungs so // 'o na ni de gnyis ka las 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: the intended meaning of this passage is to prove nonexistence.üîΩIf you say that it arises from both,

original: chos mi mthun phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: chos mi mthun phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: then it would arise from each individually.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: gal te rgyu'i bdag nyid la skye ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa cig car 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i bdag nyid la skye ba'i snga rol du 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa cig car 'gyur ba /
translated: If the effect existed or did not exist in the nature of the cause prior to arising,

original: de'i tshe gnyi ga las shes bya ba'i phyogs kyi skabs yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyi ga las shes bya ba'i phyogs kyi skabs yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be possible to say that it arises from both.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par nye bar phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la cig car rigs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa skye ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par nye bar phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig la cig car rigs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa skye ba ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: But it is illogical for both existence and nonexistence, which are mutually exclusive, to be present in one thing at the same time.üîΩTherefore it is taught that it is illogical for an existent or nonexistent thing to arise.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gang la yod pa de ni chos mi mthun pa ste /
translated: That which has contradictory properties is a dissimilar instance.

original: 'di'i dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i dngos po ni chos mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Its entity is the state of being a dissimilar instance.

original: des na 'gal ba'i chos dang 'dre ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba'i chos dang 'dre ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúbecause it is mixed with contradictory properties‚Äù is that.

original: de ltar skye ba spangs pa na gnas pa dang dgag pa dag kyang spangs par rig par bya ste /üîΩde dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba spangs pa na gnas pa dang dgag pa dag kyang spangs par rig par bya ste / de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, when arising is refuted, endurance and cessation are also refuted, because they are rooted in that.

original: gnas 'gag med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas 'gag med ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the line ‚ÄúBecause there is no arising, there is no endurance and no cessation.‚ÄùüîΩMoreover, if arising were tenable, then it would be possible to conceive of something that is to be arisen.

original: gzhan yang skye bar 'os pa la skye bar brtag na skye bar 'os pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar skyes pa'am /üîΩma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bar 'os pa la skye bar brtag na skye bar 'os pa ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no // 'di ltar skyes pa'am / ma skyes pa'am /
translated: But nothing whatsoever that is to be arisen exists.üîΩIn this way, if you analyze whether that which has arisen,

original: skye bzhin pa zhig skye bar rung bar 'gyur zhes rnam par brtag na /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa zhig skye bar rung bar 'gyur zhes rnam par brtag na /
translated: that which has not arisen, or that which is in the process of arising arises,üîΩnone of them is in the least bit tenable.

original: de dag la yang cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de dag la yang cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained in the following:

original: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning of the above is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir gang las skye ba'i bya ba grub pa de ni skyes pa zhes bya bar @341a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang las skye ba'i bya ba grub pa de ni skyes pa zhes bya bar @341a * //
translated: That which is established as the activity of arising is called ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: brjod la de lta bu gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'os pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod la de lta bu gang yin pa de ni skye bar 'os pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is such is not suitable to arise again,

original: byas zin pa la byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas zin pa la byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is illogical for that which has already been done to be done again.

original: gang zhig ri bong gi rva ltar skye ba'i bya ba dang bral bar grub pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig ri bong gi rva ltar skye ba'i bya ba dang bral bar grub pa de ni /
translated: That which is established as being devoid of the activity of arising, like the horn of a rabbit, is unarisen.

original: ma skyes pa yin na gang zhig de ltar nye bar brjod pa med par de ji ltar na skye bar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yin na gang zhig de ltar nye bar brjod pa med par de ji ltar na skye bar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is described in this way arise, when it is not described as such?

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa nyid kyis de las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa na de gnyi ga'i ngo bo kho nar skye bzhin par 'dus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa nyid kyis de las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa na de gnyi ga'i ngo bo kho nar skye bzhin par 'dus par 'gyur te /
translated: Since that which has arisen and that which has not arisen are mutually exclusive, there is no other alternative apart from those two. Therefore, that which is in the process of arising would be the entity of both.

original: de ltar yang brtsams la yongs su ma rdzogs par bya ba'i dngos po kho na la da ltar ba zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang brtsams la yongs su ma rdzogs par bya ba'i dngos po kho na la da ltar ba zhes smra'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that only that entity which is being produced but is not yet completed is present.

original: de la yang sngar bstan pa'i nyes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang sngar bstan pa'i nyes pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: And since it is connected with the faults already mentioned,

original: skye bar rung ba nyid ni med de /
analyzed: skye bar rung ba nyid ni med de /
translated: it is not tenable that it is fit to be produced.

original: de lta bas na skye bar 'os pa nyid cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na skye bar 'os pa nyid cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is not fit to be produced in the least.

original: da ni dus gsum du 'jug pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa ni yod pa'i 'bras bu la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni dus gsum du 'jug pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa ni yod pa'i 'bras bu la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is not tenable that the cause of the effect is posited as the cause of that which is being engaged in the three times, he says, ‚ÄúNor is it tenable that the effect exists in the cause,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di na gang gi phyir rgyur gyur pa na yod pa 'byung bzhin pa dang da ltar ba'i 'bras bu la yin nam /
analyzed: 'di na gang gi phyir rgyur gyur pa na yod pa 'byung bzhin pa dang da ltar ba'i 'bras bu la yin nam /
translated: Here, if the cause exists, is it the effect that is present and is arising,

original: med pa ma byung ba ma 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: med pa ma byung ba ma 'ongs pa'am /
translated: or is it the effect that is nonexistent and has not arisen,

original: yod min med pa'ang sngar yod la phyis med pa 'das pa la yin zhes rnam par brtag grang na /
analyzed: yod min med pa'ang sngar yod la phyis med pa 'das pa la yin zhes rnam par brtag grang na /
translated: or is it the effect that is both existent and nonexistent, that is, that existed previously but later does not exist?

original: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: First, the first position is not so.

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga yang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang bcas ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pas /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyi ga yang dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dang bcas ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos po med pas /
translated: Like the right and left horns of an ox, both the cause and effect are simultaneous, and the cause is endowed with the effect. Therefore, since there is no entity that is benefited or that benefits,

original: 'di rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not a cause, because it is not distinguished.

original: gnyis pa la yang sun dbyung ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang sun dbyung ba ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: In the second case, the refutation is that it is similar to what is not a cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang gi sgras gnyis nye bar gzung ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang gi sgras gnyis nye bar gzung ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa nyid du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes two things, because it goes to being endowed with the effect.

original: 'dir ji ltar rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how is it similar to what is not a cause?

original: yi ge aa dang 'brel par byas pas 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa nyid ni 'dir gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang 'brel par byas pas 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa nyid ni 'dir gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere connection with the letter ‚Äúa‚Äù is the reason for being without an effect.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this.

original: de ji @341b ltar rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin pa la med pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: de ji @341b ltar rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa ma yin pa la med pa ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu dang mi ldan pa de bzhin du rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa la yang yin no //
translated: Just as it is not tenable that a cause that is not asserted to be a cause has a result that is not asserted to be a result, so too it is not tenable that a cause that is asserted to be a cause has a result that is asserted to be a result.

original: 'on te de dang rgyu mngon bar 'dod pa la /
analyzed: 'on te de dang rgyu mngon bar 'dod pa la /
translated: But if you assert that a cause that is asserted to be a cause

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i ldan pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i ldan pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: does not have a result that is asserted to be a result,üîΩthen how is that?

original: de nyid ji ltar yin zhes kho bo cag gi mi shes so //
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar yin zhes kho bo cag gi mi shes so //
translated: We do not understand that.

original: de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause it exists when it exists,‚Äù

original: gnyis ka la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then that is the same for both.

original: ldog pa na mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ldog pa na mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not the same when it ceases,‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rgyu dang dus mtshungs pa'i rgyu ma min par mngon bar 'dod pa ni skad cig ma nyid du khyad par med pas rgyu bzhin du nges par ldog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu dang dus mtshungs pa'i rgyu ma min par mngon bar 'dod pa ni skad cig ma nyid du khyad par med pas rgyu bzhin du nges par ldog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a cause that is not asserted to be a cause at the same time as the cause is not different from the cause in terms of momentariness, it definitely ceases like the cause.

original: de ldog pa na yang 'bras bu yang nges par ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ldog pa na yang 'bras bu yang nges par ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it ceases, the result definitely ceases.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu gang kho na rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ldog pa na ldog pa de nyid de'i dus su rgyu ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ldog pa na sdod pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu gang kho na rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po ldog pa na ldog pa de nyid de'i dus su rgyu ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ldog pa na sdod pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: Because when the thing that is asserted to be the cause of a particular effect ceases, it is just that which is asserted to be the cause that ceases, not the thing that is asserted to be the noncause.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is not momentary, and if it is not arisen, then it is arisen from something else, and the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is momentary, and if it is arisen, then the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.

original: / ci ste rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po skad cig gzhan nye bar len pa can skye ba med pa na de las gzhan skye ba yin na yang 'bras bur mngon bar 'dod pa'i rigs 'dra'i skad cig gzhan mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa yinüîΩno zhe na /üîΩ'o na ni gzhi gcig pa can gyi gzhi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag ma yin te /
analyzed: / ci ste rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dngos po skad cig gzhan nye bar len pa can skye ba med pa na de las gzhan skye ba yin na yang 'bras bur mngon bar 'dod pa'i rigs 'dra'i skad cig gzhan mi skye ba'i ngo bo nyid ldog pa yin no zhe na / 'o na ni gzhi gcig pa can gyi gzhi rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dag ma yin te /
translated: But if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is not momentary, and if it is not arisen, then it is arisen from something else, and the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is momentary, and if it is arisen, then the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is not momentary, and if it is not arisen, then it is arisen from something else, and the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is momentary, and if it is arisen, then the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.üîΩBut if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is not momentary, and if it is not arisen, then it is arisen from something else, and the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.

original: de'i phyir gcig la yang de dag gi rgyu mtshan can gyi rgyu nyid dam 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la yang de dag gi rgyu mtshan can gyi rgyu nyid dam 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the thing that is asserted to be the cause is momentary, and if it is arisen, then the thing that is asserted to be the effect is not arisen from it.

original: rtogs pa po'i zhen pa'i dbang gis rgyun la gcig nyid du nye bar bzung nas nyes pa de dang rjes su 'brel ba med na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho nar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i zhen pa'i dbang gis rgyun la gcig nyid du nye bar bzung nas nyes pa de dang rjes su 'brel ba med na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa kho nar khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no connection with that fault, by the power of the conceiver‚Äôs clinging to the continuum as a single thing, then it would follow that the relation of cause and effect would be accepted only conventionally.

original: der ni theg pa 'dir yang ma spangs pa'i phyir dngos po'i 'jug pa la ltos nas rgyu ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs par sgrub pa la 'dir 'bras bu dang 'brel par med pa sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni theg pa 'dir yang ma spangs pa'i phyir dngos po'i 'jug pa la ltos nas rgyu ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs par sgrub pa la 'dir 'bras bu dang 'brel par med pa sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: In that case, since it is not abandoned in this vehicle, the establishment of the cause as not being a cause in dependence on the engagement of entities is taught here as the establishment of the absence of a relation with an effect.

original: yod med kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs pa la rgyur brtag pa ni 'gal te 'gal bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod med kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu nyid du khas blangs pa la rgyur brtag pa ni 'gal te 'gal bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The examination of a cause in regard to an effect that is accepted as having the nature of existence and nonexistence is contradictory, meaning that it is contradictory to be an object.

original: rigs pa khas blangs pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rigs pa khas blangs pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is ‚Äúby those who accept reasoning.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir da ltar ba ni 'das pa skyes shing 'gag pa nyid du khas blangs par skyed par byed pa nyid du rigs pa'am @342a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar ba ni 'das pa skyes shing 'gag pa nyid du khas blangs par skyed par byed pa nyid du rigs pa'am @342a * //
translated: Because the present is accepted as arisen and ceased in the past, it is not tenable that it is a cause.

original: 'ba' zhig gis khas blangs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis khas blangs pa ni med do //
translated: It is not accepted as a cause by mere words alone.

original: de'i phyir khong nas phyung nas dus gsum rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khong nas phyung nas dus gsum rnams su zhes bya ba la sogs pa des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, having extracted that, he says, ‚ÄúIn the three times,‚Äù and so on. The meaning of that is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du rnam par brtag pa'i 'bras bu la da ltar ba'i rgyu ni rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar ba'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum du rnam par brtag pa'i 'bras bu la da ltar ba'i rgyu ni rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because in that case, it is not tenable that the present cause of the effect that is categorized as past, present, and future in three ways is a cause, therefore,

original: dus gsum rnams su'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gsum rnams su'ang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not tenable in the three times.

original: de dag nyid dus zhes 'byung bas dus kyi sgras ni 'dir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus zhes 'byung bas dus kyi sgras ni 'dir 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said that ‚Äújust those are time,‚Äù the term time should be understood here to refer to the nature of the effect.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan nas rgyu'i bdag nyid rnams der nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po rnams rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan nas rgyu'i bdag nyid rnams der nye bar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa na /
translated: Therefore, since things are shown to be empty of intrinsic reality by way of their effect, in order to show them to be so by way of their cause, it is said:

original: gcig med pa ni mang po dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar nye bar len pa'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa gcig med par ni /
analyzed: gcig med pa ni mang po dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa gcig med par ni /
translated: Without a plurality of causes,üîΩA single effect does not arise.üîΩThus, without a plurality of cooperative conditions,

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mang po de dag nyid med par sa bon la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig pu myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen mang po de dag nyid med par sa bon la sogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu gcig pu myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'jug go //
translated: a single cause of appropriation, such as a seed, does not engage in producing a single effect, such as a sprout.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni gang dag yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba de'i phyir dngos po ste rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa de dag skyed par byed pa nyid du 'byung ba la brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams ni gang dag yod na 'bras bu 'byung ba de'i phyir dngos po ste rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa de dag skyed par byed pa nyid du 'byung ba la brten nas yin gyi ma brten par ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since things arise in dependence on those that are asserted to be things or causes, in virtue of which an effect occurs, they are not independent.

original: phan tshun yod pa la ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: phan tshun yod pa la ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is that they exist in mutual dependence,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not that they arise from their own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ni rgyu mtshan med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the sign is without a sign,

original: rgyu rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is that the cause is established as emptiness of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu zhes bya bar brjod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu zhes bya bar brjod la /
translated: That intrinsic reality which generates the effect is called the cause.

original: de yang de'i rang bzhin du rang nyid las grub par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de'i rang bzhin du rang nyid las grub par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that it is established from itself as its intrinsic reality.

original: ltos pa med par 'byung ba ni res 'ga' 'byung par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ltos pa med par 'byung ba ni res 'ga' 'byung par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because if it arose without depending on another, it would not sometimes arise,

original: rtag tu yod par thal ba'i phyir dang / rgyu'i rgyu snga ma rnams nyid med par thal bas de rjes su tshol ba'i 'bad pa don med par thal ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod par thal ba'i phyir dang / rgyu'i rgyu snga ma rnams nyid med par thal bas de rjes su tshol ba'i 'bad pa don med par thal ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: and it would absurdly follow that it would always exist, and because it would absurdly follow that the prior causes would not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ni de ltar ltos pa med par yod pa ma yin pas sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skyes pa'i phyir @342b de kho na nyid du skye ba med pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de ltar ltos pa med par yod pa ma yin pas sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skyes pa'i phyir @342b de kho na nyid du skye ba med pas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist without depending on that, like an illusion and so on, it is born in dependence. Since it is not born in reality, it is established as empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams bshad zin pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rnams bshad zin pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: If things that are causes and effects are empty of intrinsic reality by the reasoning already explained,

original: 'o na ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can nyid du bstan /
analyzed: 'o na ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can nyid du bstan /
translated: then how did the Lord teach that dependent origination has the nature of the effect of suffering?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin med pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can du rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du rang bzhin med pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can du rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable that what is empty of intrinsic reality as cause and effect has the nature of the effect of suffering.

original: de yang de kho na nyid du ma yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de yang de kho na nyid du ma yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: That is explained as not being in reality:

original: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
analyzed: rten 'brel yan lag bcu gnyis gang //
translated: The twelve factors of dependent origination

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: and so on.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis gang sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis gang sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can te /
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination, beginning with the condition of ignorance and ending with the condition of birth, are the result of suffering, because they are associated with the three kinds of suffering.üîΩThe seven members that are the result of suffering are those that exist in the result of suffering. The Blessed One taught that they are the result of suffering because they are associated with the three kinds of suffering.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse is supplied to show that the members of dependent origination are not the result of the self.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yan lag bdun 'bras bu gang la yod pa'i zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can nyid du gsungs pa de ma skyes pa ste de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩ'di nyid la 'thad pa bstan pa ni sems gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yan lag bdun 'bras bu gang la yod pa'i zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can nyid du gsungs pa de ma skyes pa ste de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // 'di nyid la 'thad pa bstan pa ni sems gcig la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'di ltar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.

original: bdag med phung po tsam nyid do //üîΩnyon mongs las kyis mngon 'dus byas //üîΩsrid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ni //
analyzed: bdag med phung po tsam nyid do // nyon mongs las kyis mngon 'dus byas // srid pa bar ma'i rgyun gyis ni //
translated: The members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.üîΩThe members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and conditions.

original: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mngal du 'jug / ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The members of dependent origination are not the result of a self, because they are produced by the power of causes and

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten nyid du phung po tsam brjod pas ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa nyid kyis khyad par gzhan du mi 'thad pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'iüîΩrgyun la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rten nyid du phung po tsam brjod pas ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa nyid kyis khyad par gzhan du mi 'thad pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun la mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The mere aggregates are described as the basis of dependent arising because the continuum of mind and mental factors, which is the nature of the four nonphysical aggregates, is manifestly formed by affliction and karma.

original: rgyun zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i skad cig ma brgyud pa las tha dad par dngos por yod pa ma yin pas skad cig ma nyid dngos po ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gi rten can yin nam /
