analyzed: rgyun zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i skad cig ma brgyud pa las tha dad par dngos por yod pa ma yin pas skad cig ma nyid dngos po ma yin te / de'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba de sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gi rten can yin nam /
translated: A continuum is not a different thing from a succession of moments of mind and mental factors. Therefore, a continuum is not a real thing.

original: sems kyi skad cig du ma'i rten can yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad pa na /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig du ma'i rten can yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad pa na /
translated: Thus, when you analyze whether dependent arising is based on a single moment of mind or it is based on many moments of mind,

original: gnyi ga ltar yang 'thad pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di @343a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang 'thad pa ni ma yin no // 'di @343a * //
translated: it is not tenable in either case.

original: ltar sems gcig la 'thad pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: ltar sems gcig la 'thad pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is tenable that dependent arising is based on a single moment of mind,üîΩthen it would be tenable that dependent arising is based on a single moment of form.

original: cig car 'byung bar thal bar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste /
analyzed: cig car 'byung bar thal bar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that the simultaneity of cause and effect is the state of being cause and effect,

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin no //
translated: like the right and left horns of a cow.

original: sems dum la brten pa nyid yin na yang nyes pa 'di nyid yin te /üîΩyod pa'i 'bras bu la'ang 'bras ldan rgyu //
analyzed: sems dum la brten pa nyid yin na yang nyes pa 'di nyid yin te / yod pa'i 'bras bu la'ang 'bras ldan rgyu //
translated: If the mind were to depend on a part of itself, this error would still occur.üîΩThe reason that has been explained, ‚ÄúThe effect that exists is endowed with a cause,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i rigs pa dus gsum pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid kyis rgyu ni rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i rigs pa dus gsum pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa nyid kyis rgyu ni rgyu nyid du 'thad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so on, is that it is not tenable that a cause is a cause in reliance on an effect that exists in the three temporal periods.

original: 'di ji tsam gyis skye ba'i rim pa la ltos nas de sun dbyung ba'i dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ji tsam gyis skye ba'i rim pa la ltos nas de sun dbyung ba'i dgongs pa gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: This is the point of the refutation, which depends on the order of arising.

original: yang na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa lhur len pa nyid du sems gcig la yang zhes pa la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa lhur len pa nyid du sems gcig la yang zhes pa la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: Or else, the point of this statement, ‚ÄúIf one thinks that even a single . . . ,‚Äù is to demonstrate that there is no valid cognition that establishes dependent arising.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is this.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tshad mas rtogs na ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po tshad mas rtogs na ni /
translated: If the state of being cause and effect is understood through valid cognition,

original: de brgyud pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang 'thad ba zhig na /
analyzed: de brgyud pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di yang 'thad ba zhig na /
translated: This dependent origination, which is the nature of that, is tenable.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni cung zad kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not at all reasonable to posit a valid cognition that establishes it.

original: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtog pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtog pa na /
translated: When one conceives of positive and negative concomitance,

original: de rtogs par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: de rtogs par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: if one wishes to understand it,

original: rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs par byed pa po'i mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa yang shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i dngos po gzhan dmigs par byed pa po'i mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: the proof of positive concomitance is the direct perception that observes the entity that is mixed with a single cognition.üîΩWhen it exists, it exists; when it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: de yod pa nyid na yod pa dang / de med na med pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi ngo bo yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo la yongs su gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na yod pa dang / de med na med pa nyid du zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi ngo bo yin pa de lta bu'i ngo bo can gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo la yongs su gcad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The nature of positive and negative concomitance is such that in order to eliminate the nature of positive and negative concomitance,

original: mngon sum gcig gam du ma 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gcig gam du ma 'jug pa yang ma yin no //
translated: one must engage in either a single direct perception or many.

original: de ltar re zhig gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, it is not a single [direct perception].

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dag gcig par ma yin pas de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa dag kyang de yin pas rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dag gcig par ma yin pas de 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa dag kyang de yin pas rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that apprehends the thing held to be the cause does not apprehend the thing held to be the effect,

original: 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa de gcig gis 'bras bur mngon bar 'dod pa dang / rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo yang mi 'dzin na /
analyzed: 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'dzin par byed pa de gcig gis 'bras bur mngon bar 'dod pa dang / rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo yang mi 'dzin na /
translated: and the consciousness that apprehends the thing held to be the effect does not apprehend the thing held to be the cause.

original: de'i khyad par gyi ngo bo 'bras bu nyid dam rgyu nyid kyis rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyi ngo bo 'bras bu nyid dam rgyu nyid kyis rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it does not apprehend the entity of the thing held to be the cause or the entity of the thing held to be the effect, then what need is there to speak of its understanding the difference between them, that is, the effect or the cause?

original: shes @343b pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang / rang gi yul yongs su gcod pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i bya ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes @343b pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang / rang gi yul yongs su gcod pa tsam gyis mthar thug pa'i bya ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the function of consciousness is complete with the mere apprehension of its own entity and its own object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gcig gis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gcig gis ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not by one,

original: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag la yang der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa dag la yang der thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would also be so for a pot, a cloth, and so on.

original: 'di dang 'di'o zhes rtogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dang 'di'o zhes rtogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The understanding of this and that is not the understanding of the universal.

original: 'on kyang 'di yod na 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di yod na 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But when this exists, that comes to be.

original: 'dir ni gcig gam gnyi gas kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni gcig gam gnyi gas kyang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, neither one nor both are understood.

original: rjes su 'gro ba khong du chud pa med do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba khong du chud pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not comprehended.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba gnyis kyi 'og tu snga rol gyi dus su 'byung ba'i lhag par zhen pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba gnyis kyi 'og tu snga rol gyi dus su 'byung ba'i lhag par zhen pas rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that the universal is understood after the two experiences, prior to the time of the two experiences,

original: ma yin te nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin yin pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba de ltar 'jug pa yang da gzod nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin yin pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba de ltar 'jug pa yang da gzod nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: no, because the experience is just as it is, and because the experience is just as it is, it is clear at that time.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa khongs su chud pa med pa yang nges par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa khongs su chud pa med pa yang nges par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should understand that the exclusion is not comprehended.

original: de bas na sems gcig la yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de bas na sems gcig la yang mi 'thad la /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable in one consciousness,

original: du ma la yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma la yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it tenable in many.

original: 'di'i phyir yang rigs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa yin no zhes 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang rigs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa yin no zhes 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: For this reason, it is also tenable to state that dependent origination is non-arisen.

original: mi rtag rtag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: mi rtag rtag min zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smos so //
translated: To demonstrate another form of tenability, the two ƒÅrya verses beginning with ‚Äúimpermanent, not impermanent‚Äù are stated.

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /üîΩma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag nyid thob pa rnams 'bras bu phyi ma skyed bar byed pa la rkyen nyid du 'dod la de dag gi bdag nyid thob pa de yang rgyu snga ma snga ma la rag las pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te / ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag nyid thob pa rnams 'bras bu phyi ma skyed bar byed pa la rkyen nyid du 'dod la de dag gi bdag nyid thob pa de yang rgyu snga ma snga ma la rag las pa'i phyir /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.üîΩThe attainment of the status of the factors such as ignorance is asserted to be the condition that gives rise to the subsequent effect.

original: ma rig pa la rgyur 'gyur ba'i yan lag gzhan snga ma nyid 'dod par bya dgos shing /
analyzed: ma rig pa la rgyur 'gyur ba'i yan lag gzhan snga ma nyid 'dod par bya dgos shing /
translated: The attainment of their status must be asserted to be the prior factor that is the cause of ignorance.

original: de'i yang gzhan yin zhing de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan yin zhing de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that attainment also has another prior cause, and that also has another prior cause,

original: thug pa med pa'i phyir du thal bar 'gyur pa spang bar bzhed pas chos mngon pa la sogs par de'i rgyu rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can gyi phyin ci log yin par bstan to //
analyzed: thug pa med pa'i phyir du thal bar 'gyur pa spang bar bzhed pas chos mngon pa la sogs par de'i rgyu rigs mthun pa snga ma snga ma'i rgyu can gyi phyin ci log yin par bstan to //
translated: In order to avoid the fallacy of an infinite regress, the Abhidharma and so on teach that the error has as its cause the prior similar type.

original: de yang yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And that is not another member.

original: de yang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de kho na'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs mthun pa nyid kyis de kho na'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: And that is included in just that, by the same type, like another defilement.

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis /
translated: This very intention is stated in the following verse:

original: ma rig nyon mongs @344a * //
analyzed: ma rig nyon mongs @344a * //
translated: Ignorance is the defilement

original: sngon gnas skabs //
analyzed: sngon gnas skabs //
translated: in the prior state.

original: zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag la nyon mongs pa'i sgra ci'i tshig tu nye bar gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag la nyon mongs pa'i sgra ci'i tshig tu nye bar gzung ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúdefilement‚Äù is applied to the statement of the characteristic of ignorance.

original: de yang mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du byed thams cad la /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i bdag nyid can gyi 'du byed thams cad la /
translated: And that is in regard to all the formations that have the nature of impermanence, selflessness, impurity, and suffering.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhir 'dod do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhir 'dod do //
translated: They assert that it has four types, in terms of engaging in the aspect of permanent, self, pure, and blissful.

original: de ltar ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po'i chos nyid du grub pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams dngos po'i chos nyid du grub pa yin na /
translated: If impermanent and so on are established as the nature of things,

original: de'i tshe de las phyin ci log gi rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de las phyin ci log gi rnam par zhen pa'i shes pa phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then consciousness that conceives the opposite of that would be the nature of error.

original: de nyid ni grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not established.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis gdod mnas zhi ba nyid du bsgrub pas na dngos po cung zad kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rim pas dngos po thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis gdod mnas zhi ba nyid du bsgrub pas na dngos po cung zad kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as previously explained, all things are established as primordially peaceful through emptiness of essence, not even the slightest thing is established.

original: chos can yin na ni chos dpyad par rigs te ;üîΩchos can yod na 'jig rten na //üîΩchos rnams dpyad pa 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: chos can yin na ni chos dpyad par rigs te ; chos can yod na 'jig rten na // chos rnams dpyad pa 'jug pa yin //
translated: If it is a phenomenon, it is suitable to analyze its attributes,

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: because it is said,üîΩIf the phenomenon is existent,üîΩThe analysis of its attributes is engaged.

original: de lta bas na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag dang med pa nyid du khyad par med pa dag yin pa de'i phyir gnyi ga spangs pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log spangs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams ni rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag dang med pa nyid du khyad par med pa dag yin pa de'i phyir gnyi ga spangs pa'i sgo nas phyin ci log spangs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanence and so on are not different from permanence and so on, and nonexistence and so on. Therefore the treatise explains that the abandonment of error is by way of abandoning both.

original: des na de ltar ma rig pa'i rgyu mtshan phyin ci log tu ma grub pas ma rig pa ma grub la /
analyzed: des na de ltar ma rig pa'i rgyu mtshan phyin ci log tu ma grub pas ma rig pa ma grub la /
translated: Thus, since the evidence of ignorance is not established as erroneous, ignorance is not established.

original: de ma grub na 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis yan lag snga ma snga ma rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa ma grub pa na /
analyzed: de ma grub na 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'dis yan lag snga ma snga ma rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa ma grub pa na /
translated: Since that is not established, the formations and so on are not established. Since the earlier members that are asserted as causes are not established by this process,

original: 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag phyi ma phyi ma rnams ma grub par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dag skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag phyi ma phyi ma rnams ma grub par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dag skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the later members that are asserted as effects are not established. Since this is taught, the entire dependent origination is taught to be unarisen.

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag ni sems las byung ba nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa dang 'du byed dag ni sems las byung ba nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, ignorance and the formations are asserted to be mental factors.

original: 'di ltar / rmongs dang bag med le lo dang// ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rmongs dang bag med le lo dang// ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
translated: lack of faith, lethargy, and agitation

original: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung //
translated: always occur in those with afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because these are the words of the great grounds of affliction,

original: rmongs pa'i sgras ma rig pa sems las byung ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sgras ma rig pa sems las byung ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: the term ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù teaches that ignorance is a mental factor.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang las kyi bdag nyid rnams te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang las kyi bdag nyid rnams te /
translated: Also, formations are of the nature of karma.

original: de ni @344b sems pa dang des byas zhes 'byung ba las kyang mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni @344b sems pa dang des byas zhes 'byung ba las kyang mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis kho na'o //
translated: Since it is said that ‚Äúit is intention and what is done by that,‚Äù in brief, there are only two types.

original: der yang thar pa /
analyzed: der yang thar pa /
translated: Also, there is liberation

original: dam pa'i don du dge rtsa ba //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du dge rtsa ba //
translated: and the root of virtue in the ultimate.

original: ngo tsha khrel yod bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: ngo tsha khrel yod bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The nature of shame and embarrassment

original: bya ba la sogs kun slong bas //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs kun slong bas //
translated: motivates all actions and so on.

original: zhes 'byung bas sems pa'i dbang gis des byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas sems pa'i dbang gis des byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is said that virtue and so on are the virtuous karma of body and speech that is done by the power of intention,

original: sems pa'i ngo bo las ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: sems pa'i ngo bo las ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: the nature of intention is primary.

original: sems pa yang sems las byung ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: sems pa yang sems las byung ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: and thought is also mental activity.

original: de yang dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyis mang po thams cad pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyis mang po thams cad pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: It is taught that it is common to all minds, because it is associated with all minds, whether virtuous, afflicted, and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩSensation, thought, conception,

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
translated: volition, contact, understanding, memory,üîΩattention, resolution,

original: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la // zhes bshad do //
translated: meditative concentration, and aspiration are in all minds.

original: de ltar na gnyi ga dag ni sems las byung ba nyid du rnam par gnas pa na ;
analyzed: de ltar na gnyi ga dag ni sems las byung ba nyid du rnam par gnas pa na ;
translated: Thus both are established as mental factors.

original: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: Those that arise simultaneously are mutually resultant,

original: 'byung ba bzhin sems rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhin sems rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
translated: like the primary elements, or like mind and those that accompany mind,üîΩor like the characteristics of the characterized.üîΩMental factors, the two restraints,

original: sems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
analyzed: sems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
translated: mind, and their characteristics,

original: sems kyi rjes 'jug dus dang ni //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'jug dus dang ni //
translated: those that accompany mind, time,

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
translated: and result and so on are virtuous and so forth.

original: zhes 'byung bas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis phan tshun 'bras bu nyid bstan pas phan tshun brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir gcig kyang grub pa yin pa ma yin pas ma rig pa ma grub pa na 'du byed rnams kyi ma grub pa la /
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid kyis phan tshun 'bras bu nyid bstan pas phan tshun brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir gcig kyang grub pa yin pa ma yin pas ma rig pa ma grub pa na 'du byed rnams kyi ma grub pa la /
translated: Since the root text states that they are mutually results by being coemergent causes, they are mutually dependent. Therefore, since neither is established, when ignorance is not established, formations are not established.

original: gzhan las ma grub pa de dag las kyang rnam par shes pa grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las ma grub pa de dag las kyang rnam par shes pa grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not established from those that are not established from another.

original: de ltar na brgyud nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dag skye ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
analyzed: de ltar na brgyud nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mtha' dag skye ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
translated: In order to demonstrate that in this way the entire dependent origination is devoid of arising,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis smras so //
translated: the two ƒÅrya verses, ‚ÄúIf ignorance does not exist, formations do not occur,‚Äù and so on, are stated.

original: 'du byed mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir zhes khong nas dbyung ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i de ma thag tu gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir zhes khong nas dbyung ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif formations do not occur‚Äù should be supplied from the immediately preceding passage.

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: Because they are co-emergent causes.

original: 'du byed med na ma rig pa dang / de med na 'du byed @345a * //
analyzed: 'du byed med na ma rig pa dang / de med na 'du byed @345a * //
translated: If there is no formation, there is no ignorance, and if there is no ignorance, there is no formation.

original: mi 'byung ba de bas phan tshun rgyu nyid de phan tshun brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i yan lag de gnyis kyang rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa ste rang gi ngo bo las kyang ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba de bas phan tshun rgyu nyid de phan tshun brten pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir ma rig pa dang / 'du byed ces bya ba'i yan lag de gnyis kyang rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa ste rang gi ngo bo las kyang ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, they are mutually causal, and they are mutually dependent. Therefore, those two members called ‚Äúignorance‚Äù and ‚Äúformation‚Äù are not established by intrinsic reality, and are not established by their own entities.

original: kyang gi sgra ni sun 'byin pa gzhan sdud pa la smos so //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni sun 'byin pa gzhan sdud pa la smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes other refutations.

original: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa na yang nyes pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa na yang nyes pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the faults that occur when the intrinsic reality of ignorance is not established, he says:

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is dependent origination‚Äù and so on.

original: spyir brjod pa yin du zin kyang skabs su bab pas khyad par can gyi don rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig gi sgras ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag brjod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir brjod pa yin du zin kyang skabs su bab pas khyad par can gyi don rtogs pa yin pa de'i phyir gang zhig gi sgras ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag brjod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Although this is a general statement, since it is the present context, the meaning of the specific term is understood. Therefore, one should understand that the term ‚Äúignorance‚Äù refers to a link.üîΩThe meaning is as follows: The link called ‚Äúignorance‚Äù and so on is not established by itself, that is, by its own nature, without depending on the formations.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yan lag gang zhig rang nyid kyis 'du byed la mi ltos pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis ma grub cing rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa de 'du byed ces bya ba'i
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te ma rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yan lag gang zhig rang nyid kyis 'du byed la mi ltos pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis ma grub cing rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa de 'du byed ces bya ba'i
translated: How could it be that something that is not established by its own nature and is not established by its own essence

original: yan lag gzhan rnams la 'ga' zhig gis dang ji ltar bskyed de /
analyzed: yan lag gzhan rnams la 'ga' zhig gis dang ji ltar bskyed de /
translated: generate other links called ‚Äúformations‚Äù and so on?

original: ji ltar yang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is impossible.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de lta bas na ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag gi pha rol las rang gi ngo bo ma skyes shing ma grub pa 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i rkyen gzhan rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par byed
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de lta bas na ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i yan lag gi pha rol las rang gi ngo bo ma skyes shing ma grub pa 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i rkyen gzhan rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par byed
translated: Because it is so, therefore the part called ignorance, which is not produced and not established from the side of another part, does not produce the conditions called formations, which are other than itself, such as consciousness, etc.

original: pa ma yin te dngos dang brgyud pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pa ma yin te dngos dang brgyud pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it does not do so directly or indirectly.

original: don 'di nyid 'jig rten pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir pha bu ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid 'jig rten pa'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir pha bu ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the acceptability of this meaning to the world, he says, ‚ÄúA father is not a son, etc.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten na gang la ltos nas pha yin gang pha yin pa de ni /üîΩde nyid la ltos pa kho nas bu ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang la ltos nas pha yin gang pha yin pa de ni / de nyid la ltos pa kho nas bu ma yin zhing /
translated: In the world, one is a father in dependence on another, and one is a son in dependence on another.üîΩThat very one who is a father in dependence on that very one is not a son.

original: gang la ltos nas bu yin pa de ni de nyid la ltos pa kho nas pha ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas bu yin pa de ni de nyid la ltos pa kho nas pha ma yin no //
translated: That very one who is a son in dependence on that very one is not a father.

original: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes dogs par byas nas nyes pa gang yin pa de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes dogs par byas nas nyes pa gang yin pa de bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is so, then what is the fault?

original: de gnyis phan tshun med min la //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun med min la //
translated: Those two are not mutually absent.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste /
translated: the term ‚Äúarise‚Äù is a remainder.

original: de gnyis phan tshun brten pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun brten pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: those two are mutually dependent.üîΩIf that is so, what is the fault? That is stated:

original: de yin na skyon gang zhig yin pa de bstan pa ni de gnyis cig car yang min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yin na skyon gang zhig yin pa de bstan pa ni de gnyis cig car yang min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose two are not simultaneous.‚Äù

original: gcig kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang grub pa ma yin no zhes @345b bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang grub pa ma yin no zhes @345b bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: even one is not established at any time.

original: don 'di yang gnyis dper bya ba'i phyir ltar zhes par nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: don 'di yang gnyis dper bya ba'i phyir ltar zhes par nye bar bkod do //
translated: In order to illustrate this meaning with an example, he cites ‚Äúlike a lamp.‚Äù

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyus ma nyid ces nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyus ma nyid ces nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe twelve limbs‚Äù and so on is a summary.

original: 'dir yang mthar thug pa'i dgongs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mthar thug pa'i dgongs pa bstan te /
translated: Here, the ultimate intention is also taught.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na yan lag gnyis phan tshun brten pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa sun 'byin pa'i skabs su rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtha' dag yongs su bzung nas 'di nye bar bsdu bar ji ltar rigs /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na yan lag gnyis phan tshun brten pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa sun 'byin pa'i skabs su rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mtha' dag yongs su bzung nas 'di nye bar bsdu bar ji ltar rigs /
translated: This is the context of the refutation, so how could it be appropriate to include all dependently arisen things?

original: 'di dag tsam gyis ni gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag tsam gyis ni gnas pa dang skye ba dang 'jig pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyis gsungs kyi yang dag pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: By this much, it is established that endurance, arising, and destruction are taught by the Buddha in terms of worldly convention, not in terms of reality.

original: da ni yod pa dang med pa zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
analyzed: da ni yod pa dang med pa zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the position that includes the statement ‚Äúexistence and nonexistence,‚Äù

original: bdag dang bdag med min zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gang zag gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs pa mi srid pa bstan pa na /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med min zhes bya ba'i tshig gis gang zag gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs pa mi srid pa bstan pa na /
translated: the phrase ‚Äúneither self nor selflessness‚Äù teaches that it is impossible to accept the person as having the nature of both.

original: sngar drang ba'i don nyid du gtan la phab tu zin kyang /
analyzed: sngar drang ba'i don nyid du gtan la phab tu zin kyang /
translated: This was already determined to be provisional in meaning.

original: yang so so'i phyogs yongs su bzung nas gtan la phab pa'i phyir /üîΩji ltar rmi lam yul brten nas //
analyzed: yang so so'i phyogs yongs su bzung nas gtan la phab pa'i phyir / ji ltar rmi lam yul brten nas //
translated: Moreover, since the two sides are completely taken into account, it isüîΩestablished.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúJust as in a dream, based on objects . . . ‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf you think, ‚ÄúWhatever is directly experienced as arising in dependenceüîΩon something else, and whatever exists as an observed object, but is not

original: gang yang 'di snyam du gang la brten nas gang zhig 'byung bzhin par mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba dang / gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba yod pa na nyams su ma myong ba de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid du tshad mas khong du chud pa nye bar bstan pa de kho na nyid du ji ltar yang spang
analyzed: gang yang 'di snyam du gang la brten nas gang zhig 'byung bzhin par mngon sum gyis nyams su myong ba dang / gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba yod pa na nyams su ma myong ba de dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang med pa nyid du tshad mas khong du chud pa nye bar bstan pa de kho na nyid du ji ltar yang spang
translated: experienced, are understood by valid cognition to be existent and nonexistent, respectively, and so should not be rejected in any way in reality,‚Äù

original: bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: bar bya ba yin /
translated: you should be told the following.

original: nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po ni sus kyang bsnyon par nus pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de ni 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas grub pa'i dngos po ni sus kyang bsnyon par nus pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de ni 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: You cannot deny that things are established by experience.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa dang sprul dang tsher ma la sogs pa gnod par yul gyi dngos po la brten nas de ltos nas nyams su myong bzhin pa yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na phreng ba dang tsandan la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa dang sprul dang tsher ma la sogs pa gnod par yul gyi dngos po la brten nas de ltos nas nyams su myong bzhin pa yin yang /
translated: Just as in a dream, a garland, sandalwood, etc., which are helpful, and a snake, a thorn, etc., which are harmful, are based on the things of the objective realm, and while they are being experienced in dependence on them,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang de'i yul med pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang de'i yul med pa ste /
translated: happiness and suffering and their objects do not exist in reality.

original: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is ‚Äúin reality.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du don gyis sad pa'i gnas skabs na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang zhig la brten nas de ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyis sad pa'i gnas skabs na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang zhig la brten nas de ltos pa'o //
translated: In the same way, in the waking state, whatever things are asserted to be causes are based on whatever is asserted to be effects.

original: 'bras bur mngon par @346a * //
analyzed: 'bras bur mngon par @346a * //
translated: They are dependently arisen.

original: 'dod pa gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de 'di gnyi ga yang kun rdzob pa'i tshad mas nyams su myong du zin kyang med pa de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de 'di gnyi ga yang kun rdzob pa'i tshad mas nyams su myong du zin kyang med pa de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Although both of these are experienced by the valid cognition of the superficial, they do not exist in reality.

original: ji skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is how it is taught.

original: rmi lam gyi snang ba las sad pa'i shes pa la ni khyad par cung zad kyang mi mngon pa'i phyir ji ltar na gcig ni bden pa'i don can nyid yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi snang ba las sad pa'i shes pa la ni khyad par cung zad kyang mi mngon pa'i phyir ji ltar na gcig ni bden pa'i don can nyid yin la /
translated: Because not the slightest difference is seen between the consciousness in a dream and the consciousness upon awakening, how could one be true and the other not true?

original: de las gzhan sad pa'i shes pa ni bden pa'i don can nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rgyas par gzhan du dpyad zin to //
analyzed: de las gzhan sad pa'i shes pa ni bden pa'i don can nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rgyas par gzhan du dpyad zin to //
translated: This has been extensively analyzed elsewhere.

original: de lta bas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis thams cad dngos po pa nyid du med pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis thams cad dngos po pa nyid du med pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, since all things are nonexistent due to the emptiness of intrinsic nature,üîΩthe teaching of the distinction between existence and nonexistence is an intentional statement.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa ni dgongs pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa ni dgongs pas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: 'di'i 'og rol du ngag dang por kun rdzob nyid du mdor bstan pa'i dman pa dang / mnyam pa dang khyad par can du bstan pa'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i 'og rol du ngag dang por kun rdzob nyid du mdor bstan pa'i dman pa dang / mnyam pa dang khyad par can du bstan pa'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: After this, in order to explain the inferior, middling, and superior teachings of the relative in the first chapter, he says, ‚ÄúIf things existed by their own intrinsic nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir phyed snga mas ni phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir phyed snga mas ni phyogs snga ma rjes su brjod pa yin la /
translated: The first half of this verse restates the opponent‚Äôs position,

original: phyed phyi mas ni lan sgrub pa'i /
analyzed: phyed phyi mas ni lan sgrub pa'i /
translated: and the second half presents the response.

original: 'dir phyogs snga ma smra ba'i bsam pa 'di yin te /üîΩgal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin med na ni dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad 'phags nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di dag ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dir phyogs snga ma smra ba'i bsam pa 'di yin te / gal te dngos po rnams rang bzhin med na ni dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad 'phags nyid du mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'di dag ni de'i tshe zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: Here is the thought of the opponent who presents this position:üîΩIf things do not have essence, then they would not have inferiority, equality, and superiority.

original: de ni yod pa yang yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni yod pa yang yin te de'i phyir /
translated: But they do have these, so it is not the case that they do not have essence.

original: de rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas dngos po rnams ni rang bzhin dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not tenable that they have these properties in any other way, things do have essence.

original: lan smras pa'i sems pa ni dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can gyi dbye ba sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa de nga la ma grub
analyzed: lan smras pa'i sems pa ni dman pa dang mnyam pa dang khyad par can gyi dbye ba sna tshogs pa nyid dngos po rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa de nga la ma grub
translated: The thought of the response is this: The various types of things, such as inferior, equal, and superior, which you have presented as the reason proving that things have essence, are not established for me.

original: pa yin te stong pa nyid du smra ba ni de lta bu'i rnam par dbye ba yang dag pa nyid du khas len par ni mi byed do ;
analyzed: pa yin te stong pa nyid du smra ba ni de lta bu'i rnam par dbye ba yang dag pa nyid du khas len par ni mi byed do ;
translated: For the proponent of emptiness does not accept such a classification as real.

original: / sgrub par byed pa gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: / sgrub par byed pa gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa yang sgrub par byed pa yin pa kho na'o //
translated: And the reason is not established for either party.

original: yang na gnyi ga la yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar /üîΩrgyu las kyang ni mngon grub med //
analyzed: yang na gnyi ga la yang ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar / rgyu las kyang ni mngon grub med //
translated: Or else, both are not established.

original: ces bya ba gang yin pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gang yin pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, it is said:üîΩThings are not established from causes.

original: gal te rgyu las dang kyang gi sgras rgyu med par rang kho na @346b las dngos po rnams mngon par grub cing /
analyzed: gal te rgyu las dang kyang gi sgras rgyu med par rang kho na @346b las dngos po rnams mngon par grub cing /
translated: If things are established from causes, and from themselves alone without causes,

original: rang gi ngo bo grub pa yin na ni rnam par dbye ba 'di de la brten pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo grub pa yin na ni rnam par dbye ba 'di de la brten pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid can du 'gyur la /
translated: then this classification would be reality, since it would depend on that.

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ltar yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa brgyud pa des rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'di khyed la yang grub pa yin te de bas na gnyi ga la ma grub pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga ltar yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pa brgyud pa des rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na 'di khyed la yang grub pa yin te de bas na gnyi ga la ma grub pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since neither is tenable by the previously explained reasoning, how could this be established for you? Therefore, since neither is established,

original: ji ltar 'di las bsgrub bya grub //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di las bsgrub bya grub //
translated: how could the probandum be established from that?

original: ces bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ces bstan par 'gyur /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: gnyi ga'i rnam pas mngon par ma grub pa 'di nyid sngar nye bar bstan pa la mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rnam pas mngon par ma grub pa 'di nyid sngar nye bar bstan pa la mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to conclude the previous teaching that neither is established by way of the two, ‚ÄúThus‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: gang gi phyir ;üîΩji ltar rmi lam yul brten nas //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gis brten nas skyes pa de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa de lta bas na brten 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ; ji ltar rmi lam yul brten nas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag gis brten nas skyes pa de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa de lta bas na brten 'byung la /
translated: Since

original: rang bzhin grub pa ga la yod de rnam pa ji ltar yang med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin grub pa ga la yod de rnam pa ji ltar yang med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the statement ‚ÄúJust as, in dependence on the objects of a dream‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on teaches that dependent arising is in reality non-arisen, thus how could that which originates in dependence be established with essence? In no way whatsoever. This is the meaning.

original: 'on te rang bzhin grub pa'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir mi brten par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin grub pa'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir mi brten par 'byung ba ste /
translated: Or, if it is maintained that it arises without depending on anything, because it has an established nature,

original: rang kho na las skye ba'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa der yang rang bzhin med mi 'byung ste nam yang zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rang kho na las skye ba'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa der yang rang bzhin med mi 'byung ste nam yang zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: then in that case, too, it would be without intrinsic nature, because it would arise from itself alone.üîΩThe word ‚Äúever‚Äù is supplied.

original: grub pa'i snga rol lam phyis kyi dus su rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing rtag tu kho nar yod pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dir yang / yod pa yod phyir skye ba yin //
analyzed: grub pa'i snga rol lam phyis kyi dus su rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du mi 'gyur zhing rtag tu kho nar yod pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro // 'dir yang / yod pa yod phyir skye ba yin //
translated: It would not be devoid of intrinsic nature either before or after, but would always exist as a real entity.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir yod phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir yod phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs smos pas ston par byed do //
translated: Here, too, the word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is supplied in the phrase ‚Äúbecause it exists, it arises.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid la 'thad pa bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyi yang med pa gang la med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'thad pa bstan pa ni rang bzhin gyi yang med pa gang la med ces bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of the logical argument is as follows: ‚ÄúIf it is nonexistent, what could arise?‚Äù

original: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don la ste /
analyzed: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don la ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rang nyid las 'byung ba gang la yod pa de'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa med pa ni dngos po dang bral zhing log pa'i rnam pa la ste gang na yang med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang nyid las 'byung ba gang la yod pa de'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa med pa ni dngos po dang bral zhing log pa'i rnam pa la ste gang na yang med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because whatever arises from itself would not depend on another cause, it would be devoid of entity and would not exist anywhere in the aspect of cessation.

original: gang zhig ltos pa med pa de ni rtag tu kho na yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig ltos pa med pa de ni rtag tu kho na yod pa yin te /
translated: That which does not depend on another is always just existent.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid res 'gar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni rgyu med gzhan la ltos med phyir //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid res 'gar 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de ni rgyu med gzhan la ltos med phyir //
translated: Because that which depends on another would sometimes arise.

original: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa'am med par 'gyur //
translated: That which does not depend on another cause is either always existent or always nonexistent.

original: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni res 'ga' zhig /'byung ba ltos pa las yin no //
translated: Things sometimes arise in dependence on another.

original: zhes bstan to //üîΩgang yang 'di snyam du gal te ma grub pa'i rang @347a * //
analyzed: zhes bstan to // gang yang 'di snyam du gal te ma grub pa'i rang @347a * //
translated: This is taught.

original: bzhin kun gyi dngos po yin na /
analyzed: bzhin kun gyi dngos po yin na /
translated: If you think that if the nature of nonestablishment is the entity of all things,

original: 'o na ni 'dir ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin la /üîΩyod pa ma yin pa'ang dngos po zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'dir ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa ma yin la / yod pa ma yin pa'ang dngos po zhes bya ba'am /
translated: then like the horn of a rabbit, it does not exist.üîΩThat which does not exist is called an entity.

original: gzhan dngos zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan dngos zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or it is called ‚Äúother entity.‚Äù

original: dngos med ces bya ba'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'jug par byed /
analyzed: dngos med ces bya ba'i tha snyad du ji ltar 'jug par byed /
translated: How could the term ‚Äúnonthing‚Äù be used?

original: de'i phyir de dag gi tha snyad 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas de grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi tha snyad 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas de grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that their conventions apply elsewhere, if you think that they are established as entities,

original: de la gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that the reason is not established,üîΩit is said, ‚ÄúIn the nonexistence of that, of what would there be its own entity?‚Äù

original: med la rang gi dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med la rang gi dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gang zhig sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas skye ba med pa de'i med pa la rang gi dngos po la sogs pa gang la yin te de dag gi tha snyad ni rmi lam bzhin du brdzun pa yin no zhes phyed phyi mas ston par byed de /
analyzed: gang zhig sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas skye ba med pa de'i med pa la rang gi dngos po la sogs pa gang la yin te de dag gi tha snyad ni rmi lam bzhin du brdzun pa yin no zhes phyed phyi mas ston par byed de /
translated: The latter half demonstrates that since that which is devoid of arising is not established by reasoning as previously explained, in the nonexistence of that, of what would there be its own entity and so on? Their conventions are false, like a dream.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi dngos po la sogs pa rnams de kho na nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir de de dag gi tha snyad brdzun pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi dngos po la sogs pa rnams de kho na nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir de de dag gi tha snyad brdzun pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù and so on. ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means that because it is impossible that its own entity and so on exist in reality, their conventions are false.

original: yang gang gis skye ba dang 'gag pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du rab tu ston pa de'i yang gtan tshigs snga mas ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su brjod nas phyed phyi mas gtan tshigs go bar bya ba la ma grub pa nyid
analyzed: yang gang gis skye ba dang 'gag pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du rab tu ston pa de'i yang gtan tshigs snga mas ldog pa'i sgo nas rjes su brjod nas phyed phyi mas gtan tshigs go bar bya ba la ma grub pa nyid
translated: Moreover, since arising and ceasing are untenable, the reason is stated in the first half of the verse, and the meaning of the reason is stated in the second half of the verse.

original: du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is not established, he says:

original: gal te dngos po stong yin na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po stong yin na //
translated: If things are empty

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'phags pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i don can nyid du zad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di ni rtogs pa'i don can nyid du zad do //
translated: This is just the meaning of the term ‚Äúnoble.‚Äù

original: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
translated: Simultaneously, there is neither a thing nor a nonthing

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gnyis kyis de lta ba'i ral ga la rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs 'di nyid go bar byed pa la ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gnyis kyis de lta ba'i ral ga la rjes su 'jug pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs 'di nyid go bar byed pa la ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa ni /
translated: and so on. The two noble ones teach this reason to be not established by way of engaging in the garments of those who hold that view.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni 'di ltar bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni 'di ltar bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is how it should be taught:

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu bshad la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu bshad la /
translated: Arising and ceasing are explained as things and nonthings.

original: de dag kyang khyod kyis 'dus byas su 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang khyod kyis 'dus byas su 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, you assert that they are conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not unconditioned phenomena.

original: de la yang de dag rim pa ma yin pa'am rim gyis yin /
analyzed: de la yang de dag rim pa ma yin pa'am rim gyis yin /
translated: Moreover, are they not sequential or sequential?

original: re zhig rim pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rim pa ma yin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not not sequential.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med cig car med //
translated: An entity and a nonentity do not occur simultaneously.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is because

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: they are contradictory.

original: de'i phyir don ni 'di yin te /üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa ni cig car te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don ni 'di yin te / dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni cig car te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is this:üîΩAn entity and a nonentity do not occur simultaneously,

original: @347b dus gcig tu yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: @347b dus gcig tu yod par mi rigs te /
translated: that is, at one time, because

original: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are essentially mutually exclusive.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po'i med pa ma spangs sngon po gnas pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po'i med pa ma spangs sngon po gnas pa ni med do //
translated: Because without abandoning blue, blue does not endure.

original: rim gyis kyang ma yin te gang gi phyir /üîΩdngos med med na dngos po med //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang ma yin te gang gi phyir / dngos med med na dngos po med //
translated: They are also not sequential, because:

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: Without a nonentity, an entity does not exist.üîΩThis is because

original: khyod kyi 'dod pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: you assert that.

original: khyod kyis ni 'di 'dus byas nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni 'di 'dus byas nyid du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: You maintain that it is a conditioned phenomenon.

original: 'dus byas nyid kyang ji srid du de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas nyid kyang ji srid du de'i mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa de srid du 'dus byas nyid ma yin no //
translated: But as long as it does not possess the characteristics of a conditioned phenomenon, it is not a conditioned phenomenon.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid ni so so'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid ni so so'i mtshan nyid du gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating are not established as the characteristics of a conditioned phenomenon.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la yang gnas pa nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la yang gnas pa nyid khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dus byas nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is accepted that space and so on endure, it follows that they are conditioned phenomena.

original: bsdus pa rnams de'i mtshan nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa dang ldan pa gzhan 'jig pa'i rnam grangs can dngos po med na med pa na ste skye ba dang ldan pa'i skye ba'i dngos po med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsdus pa rnams de'i mtshan nyid yin na yang mi rtag pa dang ldan pa gzhan 'jig pa'i rnam grangs can dngos po med na med pa na ste skye ba dang ldan pa'i skye ba'i dngos po med par 'gyur te /
translated: If the characteristics of the conditioned are included in the characteristics of the conditioned, then the impermanent would be another synonym for disintegration, and the nonexistence of things would be the nonexistence of the thing that arises, which possesses arising.

original: de dag 'dus byas la lhan cig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag 'dus byas la lhan cig pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they would be only simultaneous with the conditioned.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What would follow from that?

original: rtag tu dngos po yang dngos med 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu dngos po yang dngos med 'gyur //
translated: Things would always be nonthings.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: dngos po'ang ste 'dus byas nyid rtag tu ste skye ba dang gnas pa'i dus dag tu yang dngos po med ste yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'ang ste 'dus byas nyid rtag tu ste skye ba dang gnas pa'i dus dag tu yang dngos po med ste yod pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd also the thing itself‚Äù means that the produced itself is always, that is, at the time of arising and at the time of enduring, ‚Äúnon-thing,‚Äù that is, it is not existent.

original: 'on te skye ba'i dus nyid ni rang gi byed pa med par mi rtag pa nyid dngos po la gnas pa yin la gnas pa las phyis kyi dus kho nar de'i 'jig pa sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba'i dus nyid ni rang gi byed pa med par mi rtag pa nyid dngos po la gnas pa yin la gnas pa las phyis kyi dus kho nar de'i 'jig pa sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that at the time of arising, impermanence abides in the thing itself without its own activity, and later, after enduring, its disintegration is established, then this error does not arise.

original: skyon med pa yin no zhes /
analyzed: skyon med pa yin no zhes /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no error‚Äù means:

original: dngos med med na med mi 'byung //
analyzed: dngos med med na med mi 'byung //
translated: If there were no non-thing, there would be no thing.

original: zhes bya ba smos te dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa ste /üîΩde las med na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa ste / de las med na ste /
translated: A non-thing is a non-thing.

original: mi rtag pas sgrub pa'i 'jig pa med na'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pas sgrub pa'i 'jig pa med na'o //
translated: If that did not exist, that is, if impermanence, which establishes disintegration, did not exist,

original: 'di yod na dngos po mi 'gyur pas dngos po med pa ste mi rtag pa nyid yin la de yod na dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yod na dngos po mi 'gyur pas dngos po med pa ste mi rtag pa nyid yin la de yod na dngos por mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then this thing would not change, and so it would be a non-thing, that is, impermanence. If that existed, the thing would not change.

original: de mi 'byung zhing mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de mi 'byung zhing mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is impossible for it not to occur.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gi tshe gang zhig rang gi bya ba byed pa de'i tshe de yod pa yin no zhes smra bar rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang zhig rang gi bya ba byed pa de'i tshe de yod pa yin no zhes smra bar rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to say that when something performs its own function, it exists at that time,

original: yod pa ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin @348a * //
analyzed: yod pa ni don bya ba byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin @348a * //
translated: because existence is characterized by the performance of a function,

original: pa'i phyir dang / med pa ni de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / med pa ni de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and nonexistence is characterized by the opposite of that.

original: ji skad du nus pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du nus pa ni dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe capacity of a thing is the characteristic of a thing.

original: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nus pa thams cad dang bral ba ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The absence of all capacity is the characteristic of a nonthing.‚Äù

original: gal te mi rtag pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid grub pa'i dus na rang gi 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'jig pa sgrub par mi byed pa de'i phyir rgyu mtshan du yod pa 'di la de'i tshe yod do zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa ni dngos po'i bdag nyid grub pa'i dus na rang gi 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'jig pa sgrub par mi byed pa de'i phyir rgyu mtshan du yod pa 'di la de'i tshe yod do zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
translated: If impermanence does not produce its effect, destruction, when the nature of a thing is established, then how can it be said that it exists at that time, since it is a reason for that?

original: de'i phyir / rtag tu dngos po'ang dngos med 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rtag tu dngos po'ang dngos med 'gyur //
translated: Things would always be non-things.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa las mi 'da' ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis brjod pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba 'jug pa las mi 'da' ba nyid do //
translated: This is the unavoidable reductio argument.

original: 'on te dang po dngos po med pa nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dang po dngos po med pa nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that originally there is non-existence,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya bar /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin zhes bya bar /
translated: then this is not reasonable, as is said:üîΩThere is no non-existence without existence.üîΩHere, non-existence is asserted to be the absence of calm, not the prior non-existence, etc. ,üîΩbecause that is the very context.

original: dngos po med par dngos med med //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dir dngos med ni zhi gnas med pa la mngon par 'dod kyi snga na med pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang sngar byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo med par med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med par dngos med med // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dir dngos med ni zhi gnas med pa la mngon par 'dod kyi snga na med pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin te / de nyid kyi skabs su bab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de yang sngar byung ba'i dngos po'i ngo bo med par med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, non-existence is not without the nature of a previously existent thing,

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po'i gzhan dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po'i gzhan dbang nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because destruction is dependent on the thing.üîΩImmediately after ‚Äúnon-existence,‚Äù the remainder of the verse is to be supplied:üîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is not

original: med ces bya ba'i de ma thag tu de yang zhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i de ma thag tu de yang zhes bya ba'i /
translated: The self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is not

original: lhag ma khong nas dbyung la bdag nyid ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma khong nas dbyung la bdag nyid ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gdon par bya'o //
translated: The self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is notüîΩThe self is not

original: des na don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is as follows:üîΩThat thing without which another thing is not tenable does not exist

original: dngos po gang zhig med na dngos po med par mi rigs par 'gyur ba de yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang las ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig med na dngos po med par mi rigs par 'gyur ba de yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang las ma yin /
translated: through its own nature, as was previously explained.

original: gzhan las grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor does it exist through the nature of another.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is this?

original: de lta bas na de med na //
analyzed: de lta bas na de med na //
translated: Therefore, if that does not exist,

original: dngos po med cing dngos med med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing dngos med med //
translated: this thing does not exist, and that nonthing does not exist.üîΩThis is the conclusion of the two positions that are based on the position of reasoning.

original: 'di ni rigs pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyogs gnyis su mjug sdud par byed de 'di ltar dang po ni sde ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i phyogs gnyis su mjug sdud par byed de 'di ltar dang po ni sde ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin la /
translated: Thus, the first is the position that things have the nature of arising, and the second is the position that things have the nature of cessation.

original: phyi nas ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gcig po de yang gal te khyod kyis khas blangs kyi dngos po skye ba dang 'brel ba'i dus na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel
analyzed: phyi nas ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gcig po de yang gal te khyod kyis khas blangs kyi dngos po skye ba dang 'brel ba'i dus na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel
translated: If you accept that position, then at the time when a thing is related to arising, it is not related to impermanence, which is a characteristic of conditioned phenomena.

original: pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par gnas par 'gyur na 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa de'i tshe rnam par gnas par 'gyur na 'di yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then it would be tenable. But this is not the case.

original: de lta @348b bas na de med na skye ba'i dus kho nas dngos po de'i mi rtag pas byas pa'i 'jig pa 'byung ba na dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de lta @348b bas na de med na skye ba'i dus kho nas dngos po de'i mi rtag pas byas pa'i 'jig pa 'byung ba na dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, if it does not exist, then at the time of its arising, the thing‚Äôs impermanence would be produced by arising itself.

original: dngos po ni ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po ni ma byung ba las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba yin la /
translated: A thing is that which arises from what has not yet arisen.

original: med pa ni mi srid pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med pa ni mi srid pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nonexistence is impossible.üîΩIn the same way, the first is the nonexistence of a thing that has the nature of destruction, and the second is the existence of a thing that has the nature of arising.

original: de bzhin du dang po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa yan la phyi nas ni skye ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa de yang gang gi tshe dngos po la mi ltos par 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i
analyzed: de bzhin du dang po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med pa yan la phyi nas ni skye ba'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis pa de yang gang gi tshe dngos po la mi ltos par 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i
translated: When destruction occurs without depending on a thing,

original: tshe rigs pa yin gyi 'jig par bya ba med par ni 'jig par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe rigs pa yin gyi 'jig par bya ba med par ni 'jig par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is reasonable. But it is not reasonable that destruction occurs without something to be destroyed.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig bya mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de yang rang las sam gzhan las mi 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig bya mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de yang rang las sam gzhan las mi 'grub pa ste /
translated: Because the thing that is to be destroyed is not established either from itself or from another.

original: de lta bas na de med na ste 'jig byar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de ma grub na dngos med med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na de med na ste 'jig byar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de ma grub na dngos med med de /
translated: Thus, if that does not exist, if the thing that is the object of the desire to be destroyed does not exist, then non-thing does not exist.

original: 'jig pa 'ba' zhig mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'ba' zhig mi srid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that mere destruction is impossible.

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag rim pa ma yin pa'am rim pa yin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid bsgrub par bya ba la skye ba dang 'jig pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa dag rim pa ma yin pa'am rim pa yin par mi 'gyur bar bstan pas dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid bsgrub par bya ba la skye ba dang 'jig pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba'i
translated: Thus, since it has been shown that arising and destruction are not sequential, or that they are not sequential, the argument that ‚Äúarising and destruction are not tenable as different things in the proof of the intrinsic reality of things‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs kho nar go bar byed pa la ma grub pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kho nar go bar byed pa la ma grub pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: is understood to be a reason that is not established.

original: 'jig rten mtha' dag gis khas blangs pa'i dngos po yang khyod kyis kyang skyon mthong ba med par khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dag gis khas blangs pa'i dngos po yang khyod kyis kyang skyon mthong ba med par khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is it not the case that you also should accept things that are accepted by all the world without seeing any fault in them?

original: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid bstan pa la 'bad pas ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i stong pa nyid bstan pa la 'bad pas ci dgos /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of striving to teach their emptiness?

original: 'on te de khas blangs pa la skyon cung zad yod na /
analyzed: 'on te de khas blangs pa la skyon cung zad yod na /
translated: But if there is some fault in accepting them,

original: 'o na ni de brjod par bya dgos so snyam du dgongs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ni de brjod par bya dgos so snyam du dgongs pa la /
translated: To this, the root text says,

original: yod pa nyid dam rtag pa nyid ;
analyzed: yod pa nyid dam rtag pa nyid ;
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù or ‚Äúeternality‚Äù

original: / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩyang dag pa dngos po khas len pa na byas pa'am /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / yang dag pa dngos po khas len pa na byas pa'am /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: ma byas pa khas len pa yin grang na /
analyzed: ma byas pa khas len pa yin grang na /
translated: When you accept that things exist in reality, do you accept that they are created or that they are not created?

original: de la re zhig byas pa ni khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig byas pa ni khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not reasonable to accept that they are created.

original: de na khyod 'dod pa nyid kyis skye ba'i dus kyi tshe mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis skad cig tu yang yod par ma grub pa da gzod nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na khyod 'dod pa nyid kyis skye ba'i dus kyi tshe mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa'i dbang gis skad cig tu yang yod par ma grub pa da gzod nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you yourself accept that at the time of origination, they are related to the characteristics of conditioned phenomena, such as impermanence, and therefore they are not established as existing even for an instant.

original: 'on te ma byas pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma byas pa yin na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you accept that they are not created, that also is not reasonable.

original: de ni yod pa nyid na de khas len pa na rtag pa nyid de rtag pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i @349a * //
analyzed: de ni yod pa nyid na de khas len pa na rtag pa nyid de rtag pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i @349a * //
translated: Because if they exist, then when you accept that they exist, they are eternal, and the term ‚Äúeternality‚Äù is applied to them.

original: rgyu mtshan 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa mtha' dag gi gleng gzhi bstan pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can rtag par lta ba'i nyes pa'i rgyu dngos por thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa mtha' dag gi gleng gzhi bstan pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can rtag par lta ba'i nyes pa'i rgyu dngos por thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
