translated: The reason is that the cause of the fault of the view of permanence, which has the characteristic of manifest adherence to the entity that is taught as the basis of all faults such as attachment, would be the entity that is the consequence.

original: 'on te gang gi tshe skyon 'di spong bar 'dod nas de yang yod do zhes khas mi len pa de'i tshe de yang med na nges par te gdon mi za bar 'chad pa yin te shin tu med par chad par lta ba rgyur thal bar 'gyur te zhesüîΩsbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe skyon 'di spong bar 'dod nas de yang yod do zhes khas mi len pa de'i tshe de yang med na nges par te gdon mi za bar 'chad pa yin te shin tu med par chad par lta ba rgyur thal bar 'gyur te zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: But when one does not accept that entity, wishing to avoid that fault, then that is also nonexistent, and it is definitely, without a doubt, nihilism. One should add, ‚Äúthe cause of the view of nihilism would be the entity that is the consequence.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa nyid du khas len pa na dngos po yin pa de gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa nyid du khas len pa na dngos po yin pa de gnyis yin te /
translated: Because of that, when one accepts existence and nonexistence, those two are entities.

original: skyon gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po ni kho bo cag gis khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon gnyis su thal bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir dngos po ni kho bo cag gis khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because of the consequence of the two faults, therefore, an entity is not to be accepted by us.

original: 'di gal te ji skad bstan pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pas bye brag tu smra ba'i lta ba'am /

original: dang ldan pas mjug 'dus byas su 'dod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang skad cig snga mas bsdus pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dag las snga ma byung ba las skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang ldan pas mjug 'dus byas su 'dod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang skad cig snga mas bsdus pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dag las snga ma byung ba las skye ba gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas zhes bya ste /
translated: If you do not accept real things as they are described due to the fear of the faults entailed,

original: de ltar yang rgyu dang rkyen dag kyang yang dag par tshogs shing 'dus pa las byung ba rnams ni 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba dang / rang gi ngo bo grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i dngos po ni byas pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyu dang rkyen dag kyang yang dag par tshogs shing 'dus pa las byung ba rnams ni 'dus byas rnams zhes bya ba dang / rang gi ngo bo grub par bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa'i dngos po ni byas pa zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúconditioned phenomena‚Äù are those that arise from the assembly and aggregation of causes and conditions, and ‚Äúproduced phenomena‚Äù are those that depend on other factors to establish their own nature.

original: de yang de ltar skyes pa ni skad cig gnyis pa na nye bar len pa can skye ba na rang gi ngang gis ldog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang de ltar skyes pa ni skad cig gnyis pa na nye bar len pa can skye ba na rang gi ngang gis ldog par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, that which arises in this way is naturally destroyed in the second moment when it arises with appropriation.

original: de bzhin du de'i nye bar len pa can yang skad cig gsum pa la zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rgyun gyi ngo bo yang dag pa'i dngos po khas len na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i nye bar len pa can yang skad cig gsum pa la zhes bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa skad cig gzhan dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid rgyun gyi ngo bo yang dag pa'i dngos po khas len na /
translated: Likewise, its appropriation is also in the third moment. If one accepts that the nature of the continuum is a different cause and effect in each moment,

original: sngar bstan pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de rgyun 'di la dngos po'i ngo bo khas len pa na med pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de rgyun 'di la dngos po'i ngo bo khas len pa na med pa ste /
translated: then the faults previously explained do not exist in this continuum when one accepts the nature of things.

original: de khas len pa po nyes pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de khas len pa po nyes pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the one who accepts it does not have a fault.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig @349b gnyis pa la skad cig gsum pa la 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyu byin nas ni dngos po 'gag ste rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig @349b gnyis pa la skad cig gsum pa la 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyu byin nas ni dngos po 'gag ste rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because, having given the cause of the effect that will arise in the second moment to the third moment, the entity ceases, the meaning is that it is destroyed by its own nature.

original: 'dir yang skad cig gcig la bya ba gnyis yod pa'i phyir snga phyi'i dngos po med kyang kha gdangs nas nyal lo zhes bya ba bzhin du ka'i rkyen mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'dir yang skad cig gcig la bya ba gnyis yod pa'i phyir snga phyi'i dngos po med kyang kha gdangs nas nyal lo zhes bya ba bzhin du ka'i rkyen mi 'gal lo //
translated: And here, because there are two actions in one moment, even though there is no prior or subsequent entity, like saying ‚ÄúI slept with my mouth open,‚Äù the present tense is not contradictory.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed phyi mas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyed phyi mas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The second half of the verse beginning with ‚Äúas before‚Äù gives the answer.

original: ji ltar gong du med de de la yang rgyu min mtshungs zhes smos pas bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du 'dir de'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba rgyun du mngon
analyzed: ji ltar gong du med de de la yang rgyu min mtshungs zhes smos pas bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du 'dir de'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba rgyun du mngon
translated: Just as it was said above that the cause is not established in dependence on the effect, since it is similar to what is not a cause, the cause that is manifestly asserted in dependence on the future effect is not established.

original: par 'dod pa'i rgyun nyid 'di ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: par 'dod pa'i rgyun nyid 'di ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, in this context, the continuum that is manifestly asserted in dependence on that is not established.

original: slar rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs par gyur pas 'ga' dang 'ga'i rgyur med pa nyid do zhes rgyun chad par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: slar rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs par gyur pas 'ga' dang 'ga'i rgyur med pa nyid do zhes rgyun chad par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Since it is similar to what is not a cause, it is difficult to reverse the consequence of nihilism, that it is not the cause of some and some are not its effects.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa ji ltar yang dngos por khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa ji ltar yang dngos por khas blang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to accept things in any way.

original: gal te de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pa med na de ma mthong ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan pa 'bras bu dang ldan par ci ltar rigs zhes phyogs snga mar bya ba'i phyir /

translated: If arising and disintegration do not exist in that way, how could it be tenable that the transcendent path taught by the Transcendent Lord has a result, since it is not seen?

analyzed: skye 'jig mthong phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

translated: no,üîΩbecause of the intrinsic reality of all things, etc.üîΩThe intrinsic reality, the reality that is not a superimposition, reality, and intrinsic reality are equivalent.

analyzed: // 'di nyid khyod kyis kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig 'gog las te /

analyzed: 'on te mi 'gog pa las zhes bya ba ni cig shos ltar gyi sgra'i don yin te /
translated: Or else, the meaning of the term ‚Äúfrom noncessation‚Äù is the opposite of the former.

original: de'i tshe rtag pa ni dngos po'i rang @350b gi ngo bo brtan pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag pa ni dngos po'i rang @350b gi ngo bo brtan pa kho na ste /
translated: In that case, permanence is just the stability of the intrinsic reality of things.

original: mya ngan las 'das par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de lta bu yang mi rigs shing khyod kyis kyang khas ma blangs te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'gog pa yin na yang de'i bag chags ni mi 'gog pas skye ba rnam par chad pa ma grub pa'i phyir te /

original: de phyir dngos po dngos med min //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de phyir dngos po dngos med min // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is neither a thing nor a nonthing.

original: thar pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: The term ‚Äúit‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: skye ba med dang 'gag med yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba med dang 'gag med yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is nonarising and unceasing.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid thar pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid thar pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Liberation is the primordial peace itself.

original: 'on te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni thar pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ni thar pa yin te /
translated: Or, if you think that cessation through analysis is liberation,

original: de yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pas rtag tu yod pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dus ma byas pa nyid du 'dod pas rtag tu yod pa nyid du gnas pa yin no //
translated: and that since it is asserted to be unconditioned, it must exist permanently,

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: then the treatise speaks of this:

original: 'dus ma byas rnams gsum yang ste //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams gsum yang ste //
translated: The unconditioned is also threefold:

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: space and the two cessations.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'gog par bya ba ma yin pas ji ltar de yang bkag pa las thar bar bya zhes bya snyam du dogs pa la gal te 'gog pa 'gal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'gog par bya ba ma yin pas ji ltar de yang bkag pa las thar bar bya zhes bya snyam du dogs pa la gal te 'gog pa 'gal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since this is not to be refuted, how can liberation be attained by refuting it?

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.üîΩThis cessation, which is asserted to be a permanent state, is such that its nature is not understood by anyone.

original: gnas pa nyid du 'dod pa'i 'gog pa 'di ni re zhig gang gis kyang mi rtogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo de lta bu yin yang gal te yod do zhes kha cig sems pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gnas pa nyid du 'dod pa'i 'gog pa 'di ni re zhig gang gis kyang mi rtogs pa nyid kyi ngo bo de lta bu yin yang gal te yod do zhes kha cig sems pa de'i tshe /
translated: If someone thinks that it exists,

original: lam gang zhig yod pa na'am /
analyzed: lam gang zhig yod pa na'am /
translated: then what path is there for them?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i ldan pa'i rdzas gang yin pa 'di ni 'di yod na 'byung bar 'gyur bas sam /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i ldan pa'i rdzas gang yin pa 'di ni 'di yod na 'byung bar 'gyur bas sam /
translated: That which is the substance of the entity of attachment, etc., is called a thing because it is produced when it exists or it produces it.

original: 'byung bar byed pa yin pas dngos po zhes bsgrub pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de gnyi ga'i ngo bo de med par yang der 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa yin pas dngos po zhes bsgrub pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de gnyi ga'i ngo bo de med par yang der 'gyur te /
translated: That which is the nature of both of those is not nonexistent, because it is established by the classification of its own nature.üîΩBecause it is not tenable that it is established by the nature of another.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa la gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo 'grub pa la gzhan la ltos pa dang bcas pa ni /
translated: It is not tenable that it is established by the nature of another, because it is not tenable that that which is established by its own nature is dependent on another.

original: 'dus ma byas su rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is not established by its own nature, because it is not tenable that an unconditioned phenomenon is established by its own nature.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.

original: mi ltos par khas blangs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ltos par khas blangs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.üîΩIt is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.

original: so sor brtags pa ni de'i lam nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa bral bar bya ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ni de'i lam nyid du khas len pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa bral bar bya ba nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that it is established by its own nature and also not established by its own nature, because of the error that it would both exist and not exist.

original: de ltar yang /üîΩso sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //üîΩbral ba so so so so yin //üîΩzhes bstan @351a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang /üîΩso sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //üîΩbral ba so so so so yin //üîΩzhes bstan @351a * //
translated: It is not tenable that it is established

original: to ; / gal te gzhan yang de dag so sor brtags pa ni 'gog pa thob pa'i yan lag nyid du 'dod na de lta yang thob pa ni skye ba las tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dpyad pa'i zhar la gzhan du
analyzed: to ; / gal te gzhan yang de dag so sor brtags pa ni 'gog pa thob pa'i yan lag nyid du 'dod na de lta yang thob pa ni skye ba las tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no zhes mi ldan pa'i 'du byed dpyad pa'i zhar la gzhan du
translated: If you assert that the branches of the path that is the ƒÅrya‚Äôs path of seeing are the attainment of cessation that is individually discerned, then even in that case it is illogical that attainment is different from arising.

original: gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: gtan la phab zin to //
translated: This was established in the context of the analysis of nonassociated formative factors elsewhere.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'gog pa de med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'gog pa de med de /
translated: Therefore cessation that has the nature of endurance does not exist.

original: de yod pa nyid du khas len pa na bye brag tu sgrub pa'i dbye bas sngar brjod pa'i dngos po so sor brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam ni ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ni des thob par bya ba'i bral ba'i rten nyid du mi rigs pas yod kyang ni /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid du khas len pa na bye brag tu sgrub pa'i dbye bas sngar brjod pa'i dngos po so sor brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lam ni ltos par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ni des thob par bya ba'i bral ba'i rten nyid du mi rigs pas yod kyang ni /
translated: If you assert that it exists, then because it is not tenable that the path that has the characteristic of individually discerning the previously mentioned things is something to be relied on and because it is not tenable that the afflictions such as attachment are the basis of the freedom that is attained by it, then even though it exists,

original: med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir dngos po med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be just like a nonexistent thing because it would be indistinguishable from a nonexistent thing.

original: 'on te gal te de'i lam dang de'i byed pa'i rten du gyur pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ltos par bya ba yin pa de nyid du khas blangs pa de'i tshe de dag la mi ltos pa'i bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'on te gal te de'i lam dang de'i byed pa'i rten du gyur pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ltos par bya ba yin pa de nyid du khas blangs pa de'i tshe de dag la mi ltos pa'i bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa med pa'i phyir
translated: But if you accept that the path of that and the basis of the activity of that are the dependent afflictions, then because the nature of separation that does not depend on them does not exist,

original: yang gnas pa'i 'gog pa med do //
analyzed: yang gnas pa'i 'gog pa med do //
translated: cessation as abiding does not exist.

original: de'i phyir sngar brjod pa kho na thar pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar brjod pa kho na thar pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: Therefore, as was said before, that alone is the supreme liberation.

original: gang yang ji ltar dngos po rnams kyi skye ba med pa nyid thar pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang ji ltar dngos po rnams kyi skye ba med pa nyid thar pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, how could the nonexistence of the arising of things be liberation?

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid yod pa nyid kyis de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid yod pa nyid kyis de nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams skye ba med pa yin na gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnams skye ba med pa yin na gzugs su rung ba dang / nyams su myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de la /
translated: You say, ‚ÄúIf form and so on do not arise, it is illogical that they have the characteristics of being suitable as form, being experienced, and being apprehended as signs.‚Äù

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid ma grub par bstan par 'dod nas mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid ma grub par bstan par 'dod nas mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid grub ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Wishing to teach that the exemplification and the definition are not established, he says, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:üîΩSince the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚ÄùüîΩSince the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚ÄùüîΩSince the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚ÄùüîΩSince the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa gang zhig rang nyid grub pa'i khang bzangs kyi steng du 'dzegs nas de nyid gzhan ma grub pa sgrub par byed par nus pa yin gyi 'di dngos po rnams skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub
translated: Since the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚ÄùüîΩSince the proof that things are produced is not established, it is not tenable to state, ‚ÄúThe definition is established from the exemplification.‚Äù

original: de gzhan nyid yin na ji ltar 'di dag @351b de dag gi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gzhan 'dod pa gzhan yin la de la yang 'di'i don gzhan nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: de gzhan nyid yin na ji ltar 'di dag @351b de dag gi zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa gzhan 'dod pa gzhan yin la de la yang 'di'i don gzhan nyid du khas len na /
translated: If they are different, then how could they be related?

original: ji ltar de dang de dag 'brel pa yin zhes de la yang de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar de dang de dag 'brel pa yin zhes de la yang de ltar /
translated: If you accept that the meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is different, then how could they be related?

original: de kho na yod pa nyid du rtog pa na thug pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de kho na yod pa nyid du rtog pa na thug pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: If you imagine that they exist in reality, then it follows that they are not cognized because there would be an infinite regress.

original: de dag kyang rang las grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rang las grub pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not established from themselves.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩmtshan gzhi las mtshan grub mtshan las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / mtshan gzhi las mtshan grub mtshan las //
translated: Why is it so?üîΩThe characteristic is not established from the characterized.

original: mtshan gzhi grub ste zhes bya bar sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi grub ste zhes bya bar sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The characterized is not established from the characteristic.üîΩWhy is it so?

original: gang gi phyir gang gis mtshan gzhi mtshon par byed pa de ni mtshan nyid ces bya ba yin gyi mtshan gzhi la mtshan gzhi nyid du mtshon par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid de mtshan gzhi nyid du mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis mtshan gzhi mtshon par byed pa de ni mtshan nyid ces bya ba yin gyi mtshan gzhi la mtshan gzhi nyid du mtshon par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid de mtshan gzhi nyid du mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That by which the characterized is characterized is called a characteristic. The characterized is not characterized as the characterized by a characteristic that does not characterize the characterized.

original: de ltar re zhig mtshan gzhi la rag las nas mtshan nyid grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mtshan gzhi la rag las nas mtshan nyid grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the definition is established in reliance on the definiendum.

original: mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid la ltos nas grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi yang mtshan nyid la ltos nas grub pa yin te /
translated: The definiendum is also established in reliance on the definition.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig mtshan nyid kyis mtshan par bya ba de ni mtshan gzhi zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig mtshan nyid kyis mtshan par bya ba de ni mtshan gzhi zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, that which is defined by a definition is called the definiendum.

original: mtshan nyid de lta bus nye bar mtshon pa ni mtshan gzhi de'i mtshan gzhi nyid du nye bar mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lta bus nye bar mtshon pa ni mtshan gzhi de'i mtshan gzhi nyid du nye bar mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is illustrated by that definition is not illustrated as the definiendum of that definition.

original: de lta bas na de dag rang nyid las grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag rang nyid las grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, they are not established from themselves.

original: 'on te de dag rang las grub par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: 'on te de dag rang las grub par ma gyur mod /
translated: But if they are not established from themselves,

original: 'on kyang phan tshun ltos pa nyid las grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang phan tshun ltos pa nyid las grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then they are established from each other.

original: gcig las gcig kyang ma grub ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gcig las gcig kyang ma grub ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: But even one is not established from the other.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma grub ma grub grub byed yin te /
analyzed: ma grub ma grub grub byed yin te /
translated: Because that which is not established establishes that which is not established.

original: gang gi phyir phan tshun ltos pa na gnyis po dag grub par 'dod na gcig kyang grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan tshun ltos pa na gnyis po dag grub par 'dod na gcig kyang grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Because if they are established from each other, then both are asserted to be established, but one is not established.

original: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi ma grub pa ni mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa la mtshan nyid ma grub pa yang mtshan gzhi ma grub pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan gzhi ma grub pa ni mtshan nyid ma grub pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa la mtshan nyid ma grub pa yang mtshan gzhi ma grub pa'i ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-establishment of the characterized is not the proof of the non-establishment of the characteristic, nor is the non-establishment of the characteristic the proof of the non-establishment of the characterized.

original: de lta bas na ci las kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ci las kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, neither the characterized nor the characteristic are established from anything.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhes dgongs pa las ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa skabs kyi don la sbyar ba'i phyir yang gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhes dgongs pa las ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa skabs kyi don la sbyar ba'i phyir yang gdon par bya'o //
translated: What is the point of this? The point is that the words ‚Äúnon-established‚Äù and so on are to be applied to the context.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /üîΩma grub pa'i mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa'i skye ba dang ldan pa'i grub byed nges pa skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te / ma grub pa'i mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang ma grub pa'i skye ba dang ldan pa'i grub byed nges pa skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The point of this is as follows:üîΩThat which is the non-established characterized and characteristic is not the producer of the ascertainment of the established that possesses the non-established arising.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid rgyu dang @352a * //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid rgyu dang @352a * //
translated: This very argument is also the reason why the characteristic is not established from the characterized.

original: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang dngos po rnams skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub byed nyid du gzhan dag gis nyes par sbyar ba dag ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa gzhan dag kyang dngos po rnams skye ba dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la sgrub byed nyid du gzhan dag gis nyes par sbyar ba dag ma grub pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Other things, such as the effect, etc., are also not established as the proof in the proof of the possession of production of things, because others have wrongly applied them.

original: gzhan la bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan la bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the extension to others,

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHere, the effect, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: With regard to that, first, the effect and cause are not external to the things that are asserted as the effect and cause,

original: snga ma thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to avert the consequence of an infinite regress.

original: dngos po de dag kyang de nyid du rang las grub pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir rgyur grub pa ni 'bras bu las yin la /
analyzed: dngos po de dag kyang de nyid du rang las grub pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir rgyur grub pa ni 'bras bu las yin la /
translated: Also, those things are not established from themselves in reality,üîΩbecause the establishment of the cause is from the effect,

original: 'bras bu'i yang rgyu las yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i yang rgyu las yin no //
translated: and the establishment of the effect is from the cause.

original: gang gi 'bras bu byed pa de ni rgyu zhes bya ba yin gyis 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du ma rtogs na rgyu de nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu byed pa de ni rgyu zhes bya ba yin gyis 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du ma rtogs na rgyu de nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: That which is the effect of that is called the cause. But if the effect is not ascertained as an effect, it is not ascertained as that very cause.

original: de bzhin du rgyus bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu las yin gyi rgyu la rgyu nyid du nye bar ma mtshon pa na 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyus bskyed par bya ba 'bras bu las yin gyi rgyu la rgyu nyid du nye bar ma mtshon pa na 'bras bu la 'bras bu nyid du yongs su gcod par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the effect is the effect of the cause that generates it. But if the cause is not indicated as the cause of the effect, the effect is not ascertained as an effect.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pas gnyis po dag gi rgyu 'bras nyid rtogs par bya ba yin gyi phan tshun ltos pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pas gnyis po dag gi rgyu 'bras nyid rtogs par bya ba yin gyi phan tshun ltos pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the cause and effect of the two are ascertained by the realization of concomitance and reversal, not by mutual dependence, that is not so.

original: rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa dang ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni gcig gam du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba sgrub par byed pa dang ldog pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni gcig gam du ma mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible that the valid knowledge that proves concomitance and the valid knowledge that proves reversal are either the same or different.

original: ji ltar yang de mi srid pa de ltar sems gcig la yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang de mi srid pa de ltar sems gcig la yang mi 'thad la /
translated: Just as it is impossible that they are either the same or different, it is also untenable that they are in the same mind.

original: du ma la yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i nad 'dir bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: du ma la yang mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i nad 'dir bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is also not tenable for many.

original: de'i phyir de dag grub pa la phan tshun ltos pa srid pa'i phyir rang las grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag grub pa la phan tshun ltos pa srid pa'i phyir rang las grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since mutual dependence is possible for those that are established, they are not established from themselves.

original: 'o na ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni phan tshun ltos pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then they would be mutually dependent.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not reasonable.

original: de nyid du gcig kyang ma grub pa yin na /
analyzed: de nyid du gcig kyang ma grub pa yin na /
translated: If they are not established as one in reality,

original: de las gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is impossible for them to be established as different from that.

original: de lta bas na rang dang / phan tshun las ma grub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid 'di ni gzhan gyi skye ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang dang / phan tshun las ma grub pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid 'di ni gzhan gyi skye ba dang ldan pa nyid ma grub pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since cause and effect are not established from themselves or from each other, this is the position that the possession of arising from another is not established, and it is not established by the proof statements.

original: de ltar bya ba dang byed pa po nyid dang byed pa po dang las nyid kyang 'di la sgrub @352b par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba dang byed pa po nyid dang byed pa po dang las nyid kyang 'di la sgrub @352b par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is taught that the status of object and agent and the status of agent and action are not established by this.

original: tshor ba tshor ba po sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshor ba tshor ba po sogs dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe feeler, the feeler of feeling, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te yang tshor ba las tha dad par bdag la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i tshor ba po ni shin tu med pa de lta na yang nag pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu der khas blangs nas gtan tshigs su bstan pa 'di la bsgre
analyzed: gal te yang tshor ba las tha dad par bdag la sogs pa gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa'i tshor ba po ni shin tu med pa de lta na yang nag pa la sogs pa kun rdzob tu der khas blangs nas gtan tshigs su bstan pa 'di la bsgre
translated: If the feeler of feeling is completely nonexistent, imagined to be different from feeling, etc., then the self, etc., are also like that.

original: bar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The example is stated in the verse:üîΩ‚ÄúJust as feeling is not found, neither is the feeler.‚Äù

original: 'di dag rang rig pa dang dbang po'i mngon sum dag gis yang dag par khong du chud pa'i ngo bo dag yin yang bya ba dang byed pa po nyid du tshad med pa de dag gis rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag rang rig pa dang dbang po'i mngon sum dag gis yang dag par khong du chud pa'i ngo bo dag yin yang bya ba dang byed pa po nyid du tshad med pa de dag gis rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Although these are established as the nature of the direct perception of the sense faculties and self-awareness, they are not to be understood by valid cognition as action and agent.

original: de ni phan tshun ltos pa kho nas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun ltos pa kho nas rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are to be understood only through mutual dependence.

original: byed pa pos bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa pos bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo bya ba yin te /
translated: Action is the nature of what is to be accomplished by the agent.

original: de yang byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa la byed pa po nyid du ma rtogs na rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa la byed pa po nyid du ma rtogs na rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if the one who is asserted to be the agent is not understood to be the agent, then he is not able to be understood.

original: de yang bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis byed pa po yin pa'i phyir bya ba rtogs pa la ltos pa kho nas byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis byed pa po yin pa'i phyir bya ba rtogs pa la ltos pa kho nas byed pa po nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since he is the agent because he is the one who accomplishes the action, he is understood to be the agent only in dependence on the understanding of the action.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni de'i ngo bor rang las rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni de'i ngo bor rang las rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are to be understood from their own nature.

original: phan tshun las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they exist in mutual dependence,

original: de lta na gcig ma grub na ma grub pa la yang gzhan du sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na gcig ma grub na ma grub pa la yang gzhan du sgrub par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one of them does not exist, it is not reasonable that the other exists.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba dang tshor ba po zhes bya ba rang dang phan tshun las ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs 'di yang skabs kyis skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba dang tshor ba po zhes bya ba rang dang phan tshun las ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs 'di yang skabs kyis skye ba dang ldan pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this reason, ‚Äúbecause they are not established from themselves or from each other,‚Äù also applies to the case of feeling and the feeler.

original: de ltar byed pa po dang las nyid kyi bdag nyid lta ba po dang ba lta bar bya ba nyid kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩsgra gnyis po dag gis 'di 'tshed pa po dang 'tshed pa dang nyan pa po dang / mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang rigs pa thun mong ba nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar byed pa po dang las nyid kyi bdag nyid lta ba po dang ba lta bar bya ba nyid kyang sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin par sbyar bar bya'o // sgra gnyis po dag gis 'di 'tshed pa po dang 'tshed pa dang nyan pa po dang / mnyan bya nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan dag kyang rigs pa thun mong ba nyid kyis ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: So too, the seer and the seen should be applied to the identity of the agent and action.üîΩThe two terms ‚Äúcook‚Äù and ‚Äúfood‚Äù also establish the other reasons, such as the hearer and the heard.

original: skabs kyis bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid du nye bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs kyis bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid du nye bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since they are established by a reason that is common to both, they are devoid of the capacity to establish the probandum.

original: gal te gang yang dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dag yin na 'o na ni de dag yod pa ma yin zhing gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag @353a * //
analyzed: gal te gang yang dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dag yin na 'o na ni de dag yod pa ma yin zhing gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag @353a * //
translated: If things do not arise and do not cease due to their intrinsic reality, then they would not exist.

original: kyang dus gsum du 'jug pa nyid du tha snyad bya bar mi nus par 'gyur na /
analyzed: kyang dus gsum du 'jug pa nyid du tha snyad bya bar mi nus par 'gyur na /
translated: And if they do not exist, then it would be impossible to designate them as engaging the three times.

original: tha snyad kyang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang byed pa yin no //
translated: But designation is made.

original: de'i phyir de'i tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnams yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po rnams yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na /
translated: In that case, why do you think,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye med cing //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye med cing //
translated: ‚ÄúHow could that which is intrinsically non-arisen

original: 'gag med gang de thar min nam //üîΩzhes rjod par byed snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'gag med gang de thar min nam // zhes rjod par byed snyam du sems na /
translated: and non-ceased be liberation?‚Äù

original: de la dus gsum nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid ma grub mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la dus gsum nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid ma grub mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach that the three times themselves do not exist, he says ‚Äúnot established, not enduring,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf time is a thing,üîΩhow could it be different from a thing?

original: gang gi phyir dus zhes bya ba dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus zhes bya ba dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin nam /
translated: If it is different from a thing,üîΩhow could it be a thing?üîΩIf time is a thing, how could it be different from a thing?

original: don gzhan du gyur pa de yang ci gcig yin nam /üîΩdus ma yin /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa de yang ci gcig yin nam / dus ma yin /
translated: If it is different from a thing, how could it be a thing?

original: de la re zhig don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig don gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not different from a thing.

original: bdag nyid de rang nyid dngos po'i bdag nyid ma yin par gyur pa rang gi ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /üîΩtshad mas khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bdag nyid de rang nyid dngos po'i bdag nyid ma yin par gyur pa rang gi ngo bo nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /üîΩtshad mas khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is not established as the nature of a thing itself, as its own nature, because it is not established by valid knowledge.

original: / de ltar khas blangs pa na yang gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: / de ltar khas blangs pa na yang gcig ma yin te /
translated: And even if one were to accept that, it is not one.üîΩBecause it does not endure.

original: mi gnas phyir te de gcig tu zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mi gnas phyir te de gcig tu zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is: ‚Äúthat is not one.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa gsum du tha snyad du bya ba de ni gcig nyid du rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa gsum du tha snyad du bya ba de ni gcig nyid du rnam par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is conventionally designated as threefold, it does not endure as one.

original: 'o na ni du mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni du mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not one, it is many.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That also is not reasonable.

original: phan tshun grub phyir dang / 'chol phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis po dag gis so //
analyzed: phan tshun grub phyir dang / 'chol phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis po dag gis so //
translated: Because of mutual dependence and because of confusion.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag de ltar rtogs par bya ba rnams re re zhing de las gzhan grub pa la rag las na grub pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa dang / da ltar ba dang / ma 'ongs pa dag de ltar rtogs par bya ba rnams re re zhing de las gzhan grub pa la rag las na grub pa dag yin te /
translated: Because the past, present, and future, which are to be understood in that way, are established in dependence on each other, they are established.

original: da ltar yang /
analyzed: da ltar yang /
translated: But if they are established,üîΩthen the past and future would exist at present.

original: ma 'ongs pa dag de ltar nyid du rtogs pa med par ni 'das pa'i dus de ltar rtogs par nus pa med pa ma yin na 'das pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa med na da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa dag rang gi bdag nyid du yang ma yin no
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dag de ltar nyid du rtogs pa med par ni 'das pa'i dus de ltar rtogs par nus pa med pa ma yin na 'das pa'i ngo bor rtogs pa med na da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa dag rang gi bdag nyid du yang ma yin no
translated: But if the future does not exist in that way, then the past cannot be known in that way. If the past does not exist in that way, then the present and future do not exist in their own intrinsic reality.

original: // de ltar gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: // de ltar gzhan la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the other two times.

original: de'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyis gcig kyang ma grub pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di du ma'i bdag nyid du yang grub pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa nyid kyis gcig kyang ma grub pa de'i phyir ji ltar 'di du ma'i bdag nyid du yang grub pa yin /
translated: Therefore, since they are mutually dependent, they do not exist as one. Since they do not exist as one, how can they exist as many?

original: 'di dag ni 'chol ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'chol ba yang yin te /
translated: They are also confused.

original: 'di ltar da ltar nyid la ltos nas gang da ltar ba nyid 'das pa la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar nyid la ltos nas gang da ltar ba nyid 'das pa la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, in dependence on the present, that which is present becomes the future in dependence on the past.

original: de la ltos @353b nas 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩma 'ongs pa la ltos nas 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de la ltos @353b nas 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no // ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas 'das pa yin te /
translated: In dependence on that, it becomes the future.üîΩIn dependence on the future, the present becomes the past.

original: de la ltos nas 'das pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas 'das pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In dependence on that, it becomes the past.

original: de ltar gzhan du yang ltos pa'i dbye bas gsum nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du yang ltos pa'i dbye bas gsum nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, in other cases as well, time is threefold by the division of dependence.

original: de ltar 'chol ba'i phyir yang 'di du ma 'di yang dag par ma grub pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir 'di ltar dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i dus gcig gam du mar ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar 'chol ba'i phyir yang 'di du ma 'di yang dag par ma grub pa nyid do // de'i phyir 'di ltar dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i dus gcig gam du mar ma grub pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin na /
translated: And because of the confusion of these, this is not established as one or many.üîΩTherefore, it is established that time is not established as one or many, apart from things.

original: gang zhig dngos po nyid skyes la 'gags pa dang / skyes la ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa las 'das pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid dus kyi dbye ba yin par sems pa de las yang 'di dngos po ba nyid du ma grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bstan pa ni dngos po med phyir yod min te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po nyid skyes la 'gags pa dang / skyes la ma 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa las 'das pa dang / da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid dus kyi dbye ba yin par sems pa de las yang 'di dngos po ba nyid du ma grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bstan pa ni dngos po med phyir yod min te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if one thinks that time is the division of the present, the past, and the future, which are things that have arisen and ceased, have arisen and not ceased, and have not arisen, respectively, then in order to show that time is not established as a thing, the reason is stated: ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist as a thing, it is not existent.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po nyid 'ga' zhig dngos po ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'di gnas skabs kyi dbye ba la brten nas dus gsum gyi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin na 'di yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te dngos po nyid 'ga' zhig dngos po ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe 'di gnas skabs kyi dbye ba la brten nas dus gsum gyi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin na 'di yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because if a thing itself were a thing, then it would not be posited as having the nature of the three times in dependence on the division of its temporal stages.

original: de ni sngar kho na 'thad pa mang po'i sgo nas rang bzhin stong pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro /üîΩgal te dngos po las don gzhan du gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ni sngar kho na 'thad pa mang po'i sgo nas rang bzhin stong pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro / gal te dngos po las don gzhan du gyur ba'am /
translated: It does not exist, because previously we have extensively demonstrated with many reasonings that it is empty of essence.

original: don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'i dus kyi dbye ba dngos po pa nyid du yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'i dus kyi dbye ba dngos po pa nyid du yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the division of time does not exist as a thing, either as different from a thing or not different from a thing,üîΩthen how could the conventions of the three times exist?

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten na thog ma med pa'i brgyud pa nas grags pa de la brten pa'i tha snyad 'di ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /üîΩdus gsum nyid ni rtogs pa tsam //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten na thog ma med pa'i brgyud pa nas grags pa de la brten pa'i tha snyad 'di ji ltar yin snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir / dus gsum nyid ni rtogs pa tsam //
translated: In order to dispel the doubt that arises from wondering about this, he says,

original: zhes bya ba smos so//
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so//
translated: The three times are merely conceptualized.

original: thog ma med pa'i brdzun pa'i rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i bag chags las byung ba can dus gsum mo snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nyid 'ba' zhig yin gyi dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i brdzun pa'i rnam par rtog pa goms pa'i bag chags las byung ba can dus gsum mo snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa nyid 'ba' zhig yin gyi dngos po'i nye bar len pa can ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no
translated: The thought ‚Äúthe three times‚Äù arises from the latent predispositions that arise from beginningless false conceptions, but it is only a conception, it does not have the appropriation of a thing.

original: // gang yang skye ba dang 'gag par bya ba'i ngo bo dag spong ba yin na 'dus byas spang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: // gang yang skye ba dang 'gag par bya ba'i ngo bo dag spong ba yin na 'dus byas spang bar 'gyur la /
translated: If you reject the entity that arises and ceases, then you reject conditioned phenomena.

original: de spangs na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po rnams spong bar 'gyur na de dag ni spang bar nus pa yang ma yin zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: de spangs na yang 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po rnams spong bar 'gyur na de dag ni spang bar nus pa yang ma yin zhes zer ba de la /
translated: If you reject that, then you reject the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, but they cannot be rejected.üîΩTo respond:

original: gang phyir skye dang gnas dang 'jig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩ@354a * // 'dus byas mtshan nyid ces bya bar rigs la gcig gis tshig yin la /
analyzed: gang phyir skye dang gnas dang 'jig / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // @354a * // 'dus byas mtshan nyid ces bya bar rigs la gcig gis tshig yin la /
translated: Because arising, enduring, and ceasingüîΩIt is logical that the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena are one in nature but different isolates.

original: rigs kyang gsal ba mtha' dag 'phen par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyang gsal ba mtha' dag 'phen par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Also, a single type of reason can imply all instances of the phenomena to be proven.

original: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúcharacteristics of the conditioned‚Äù is established.

original: de ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rjes su brjod nas spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rjes su brjod nas spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus described the characteristics of the conditioned, in order to refute them, he says:

original: 'di gsum med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di gsum med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: These three do not exist.

original: gang gi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas 'di gsum yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas 'di gsum yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Because these three do not exist through the reasoning that will be explained,

original: de'i sgo nas 'dus byas nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩ'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub par byed na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'dus ma byas nyid yod pa nyid du lus pa yin na de yang ci yang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: de'i sgo nas 'dus byas nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no // 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir gcig dgag pa ni gzhan sgrub par byed na med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rigs pas 'dus ma byas nyid yod pa nyid du lus pa yin na de yang ci yang yod pa ma yin
translated: conditioned phenomena themselves do not exist.

original: te / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa ni de la mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: te / gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i don byed nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yod pa ni de la mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Since the conditioned and the unconditioned are mutually exclusive, the negation of one affirms the other. Since the reasoning of ‚Äúbecause it does not exist‚Äù is not established, the existence of the unconditioned remains. But that also does not exist at all, because it is not tenable that it has the characteristic of existence that is able to perform a function, as accepted by others.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /üîΩgal te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya bar yod par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i byed pa'i gnas 'dus byas kyang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya bar 'os par 'gyur na 'di gsum ni gdon mi za bar khas
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te / gal te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya bar yod par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i byed pa'i gnas 'dus byas kyang yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya bar 'os par 'gyur na 'di gsum ni gdon mi za bar khas
translated: This is the explanation:üîΩIf the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena were to exist, then it would be appropriate to accept that the basis of their activity, conditioned phenomena, also exists.

original: blang bar bya bar yod pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blang bar bya bar yod pa can yang ma yin te /
translated: But these three do not exist in such a way that they are to be accepted without doubt.

original: de'i byed pa ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa ni ji ltar yang 'thad pa ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their activity is not tenable in any way.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: ma zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ma zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot disintegrating‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gal te 'dus byas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang yin la /
translated: If conditioned phenomena were to arise, endure, and disintegrate,

original: de'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid kyang de dag rab tu sbyor du 'jug pa nyid kyis byed pa dang ldan pa nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya bar yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i mtshan nyid kyang de dag rab tu sbyor du 'jug pa nyid kyis byed pa dang ldan pa nyid du gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya bar yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then it would be necessary to accept that their characteristics would also exist in such a way that they possess activity by virtue of being engaged in their activity.

original: de'i tshe skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is no arising, enduring, or ceasing.

original: gang gis skyes pa ni skye ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang gis skyes pa ni skye ba ma yin te ;
translated: That which has arisen does not arise,

original: skye ba'i bya ba rdzogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba rdzogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of arising is completed.

original: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That which has not arisen does not arise,

original: gang zhig ri bong gi rva bzhin du skye ba'i bya ba'i dgag pa grub pa yin no //üîΩgal te gang la skye ba la rgyu med pa ni skye ba'i chos can gyis ma skyes pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur du chug na /üîΩgang @354b la skye ba la rgyu yod pa skye ba'i chos can gyi ma skyes pa de ni ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ri bong gi rva bzhin du skye ba'i bya ba'i dgag pa grub pa yin no // gal te gang la skye ba la rgyu med pa ni skye ba'i chos can gyis ma skyes pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur du chug na / gang @354b la skye ba la rgyu yod pa skye ba'i chos can gyi ma skyes pa de ni ci'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: because it is like the non-arising of the horn of a donkey.üîΩIf you say that that which has a cause for arising does not arise,üîΩthen why does that which has no cause for arising not arise?

original: de yang skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang skye ba ma yin te /
translated: That which has no cause for arising does not arise,

original: de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa ni rgyu ma yin pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is asserted as its cause is not a cause.

original: 'dir yang rigs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang rigs pa ni /
translated: Here, the reasoning is this:

original: yod pa'i 'bras la'ang 'bras ldan rgyu //
analyzed: yod pa'i 'bras la'ang 'bras ldan rgyu //
translated: Even with respect to an existent effect, a cause possessing an effect

original: zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa lan mang du bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya bya ba la sogs pa lan mang du bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times already.

original: de ltar gnas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i yul gyi dbye bas gnas pa dang 'jig pa mi rigs par bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa dang mi gnas pa dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa'i yul gyi dbye bas gnas pa dang 'jig pa mi rigs par bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since the distinctions of enduring and not enduring, disintegrating and not disintegrating are not tenable, enduring and disintegration are not tenable.

original: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni byed pas stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ni byed pas stong pa'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the three characteristics of conditioned phenomena, such as arising, are empty of performing functions, they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang 'dus byas dngos po ba nyid du khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang 'dus byas dngos po ba nyid du khas blang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to accept that conditioned phenomena are real things on the basis of that.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas sna tshogs nyid rang bzhin nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas sna tshogs nyid rang bzhin nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Since various conditioned and unconditioned phenomena do not have intrinsic reality,

original: de'i phyir du ma dang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rigs pa rnams kyang de la brten pa nye bar len pa med pa rnams nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma dang gcig nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par rigs pa rnams kyang de la brten pa nye bar len pa med pa rnams nyid yin no //
translated: therefore, the various reasonings, such as the analysis of the one and the many, are also not tenable.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas nyid kyi mtshams las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid du dngos po srid du yang ma yin zhing thams cad 'di kho nar 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i thar pa yin
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas nyid kyi mtshams las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid du dngos po srid du yang ma yin zhing thams cad 'di kho nar 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i thar pa yin
translated: Since it is not possible for an entity to exist outside of the boundary between the conditioned and the unconditioned, and since everything is included in just this, the liberation that is endowed with reason is only primordial peace.

original: no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'dus byas ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The conditioned and the unconditioned and so forth.

original: 'phags pa 'di'i don rtogs par zad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'di'i don rtogs par zad do //
translated: The noble ones have fully realized the meaning of this.üîΩHere, in order to clarify what is asserted as the inclusion of everything, the treatise states:üîΩThe teacher, the Transcendent Conqueror,üîΩthe one who has gone to the other shore,üîΩthe one who has gone to the other shore,

analyzed: 'dir thams cad gang zhig 'dus par 'dod pa de ni phyogs snga ma bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /

original: bla ma bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bla ma bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: the one who has gone to the other shore,

original: gal te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe las kyang 'dus byas kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir de ltar gyur na yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe las kyang 'dus byas kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir de ltar gyur na yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'di ltar bla ma ste 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bla ma ste 'jig rten gsum gyi ston pa gcig pu'o //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One is the guru, the sole teacher of the three worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One is so calledüîΩbecause he possessesüîΩmastery, good form,üîΩglory, fame, wisdom,

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa la //üîΩdrug po de la ldan zhes brjod //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa la // drug po de la ldan zhes brjod //
translated: and perfect effort.
These six are called the ‚Äúpossessions.‚Äù

original: bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yon tan ma lus pa 'phen par byed pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi sgras brjod par bya ba yon tan ma lus pa 'phen par byed pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Blessed One is the Buddha who possesses the six qualities that project all the virtues expressed by the word ‚ÄúBlessed.‚Äù

original: nges par rnam par smin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir las gnas te nges par gnas shing nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rnam par smin par byed pa yin pa'i phyir las gnas te nges par gnas shing nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: Karma is stable, that is, it endures and is revealed, because it definitely produces its result.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three kinds:

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbye ba ste /
translated: Karma to be experienced in the current life, karma to be experienced after taking rebirth, and karma to be experienced in a third life.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is taught:

original: nges pa dang ni ma nges las //
analyzed: nges pa dang ni ma nges las //
translated: Karma is certain or uncertain.

original: nges pa yang ni rnam gsum ste //üîΩmthong chos la sogs myong phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa yang ni rnam gsum ste // mthong chos la sogs myong phyir ro //
translated: The certain is also threefold:

original: zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because it is experienced in this life and so on.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:

original: las bdag dang ni 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las bdag dang ni 'bras bu dang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Karma is one‚Äôs own and its result.

original: gnas pa dang gsung zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang gsung zhes bya ba dang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: This should be connected with the words ‚Äúabides‚Äù and ‚Äúis taught.‚Äù

original: 'dir bdag nyid kyi sgra ni rang bzhin brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir bdag nyid kyi sgra ni rang bzhin brjod do //
translated: Here the word ‚Äúown‚Äù expresses intrinsic nature.

original: des na 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore this is taught:

original: gang yang las rnams kyi bdag nyid gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang las rnams kyi bdag nyid gnas pa ste /
translated: Karma is that which abides as one‚Äôs own intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid nges pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid nges pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The definition is ascertained as follows:

original: yid kyi ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi ni sems pa'o //
translated: Mental karma is intention.

original: lus dang ngag gi ni sems pas kun nas bslang ba nyid de /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi ni sems pas kun nas bslang ba nyid de /
translated: Physical and verbal karma are motivated by intention.üîΩIt is taught:

original: sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
analyzed: sems pa yid kyi las yin te //
translated: Mental karma is intention.

original: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
analyzed: des bskyed lus dang ngag gi las //
translated: Physical and verbal karma are generated by it.

original: zhes gang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rang gi don la bka' sgrub pa'i phyir de ni las kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi don la bka' sgrub pa'i phyir de ni las kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of action because it is the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own aim.

original: de'i 'bras bu ste /üîΩlas gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi bdag nyid smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ste / las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi bdag nyid smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa'o //
translated: It is the result of that.üîΩThe maturation of actions that are entirely black is entirely black.üîΩThe maturation of actions that are entirely white is entirely white.

original: gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu dkar ba'o //üîΩ'dren ma rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'dren ma'o zhes bya ba'i dbye ba gnas pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu dkar ba'o // 'dren ma rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni 'dren ma'o zhes bya ba'i dbye ba gnas pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The maturation of mixed actions is mixed.üîΩThe world is the domain of action.üîΩAction is the master of the world, because it is always the sovereign of its own nature.üîΩThe world is like a calf that follows its mother.üîΩThe world is the domain of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten ni las bdag gir bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pas las nyid rang gi bdag nyid du bya ba rtag tu dbang sgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni las bdag gir bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pas las nyid rang gi bdag nyid du bya ba rtag tu dbang sgyur ba yin te /

translated: The world is the domain of action.üîΩThe world is the

original: chud mi za ba nyid yin te //
analyzed: chud mi za ba nyid yin te //
translated: It is indestructible.

original: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
analyzed: tshogs shing dus la bab pa na //
translated: When the assemblage and the occasion are right,

original: lus can rnams la 'bras bu smin //
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'bras bu smin //
translated: the results ripen for embodied beings.

original: zhes gsungs pa las rnams chud mi za bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa las rnams chud mi za bar gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: dang po ni tha ma dag tu gsungs zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis @355b nye bar bzung ba ni dbus su yang de sbyar ba'i don du'o //
translated: The two words ‚Äúfirst‚Äù and ‚Äúlast‚Äù are used to indicate that this is also to be applied in the middle.

analyzed: de lta bas na gal te las kyang stong pa nyid yin na 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das gsung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if karma were empty, the Lord Buddha would not have said this.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra ba ni /
translated: The proponent of tenets says:

original: las gsungs te gang phyir ma skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: las gsungs te gang phyir ma skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Karma is taught, because it is not arisen, etc.

original: gang las gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: gang las gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i /
translated: What is the nature of ‚Äúabiding‚Äù?

original: sems can rnams kyis las bdag gir zhes bya ba 'bras bu ma byin par chud mi za zhes bya bar gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis te /üîΩde ni gang gi phyir ma skyes //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis las bdag gir zhes bya ba 'bras bu ma byin par chud mi za zhes bya bar gsungs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis te / de ni gang gi phyir ma skyes //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe karma of sentient beings is not lost‚Äù means that the effect of karma is not lost without giving its effect, and this is from the perspective of worldly convention.üîΩBecause it is unborn,

original: mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
translated: it does not disintegrate.

original: de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med ces tshig sbrel te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med ces tshig sbrel te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is to be supplied with the phrase ‚Äúultimately it is essenceless.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises in dependence, like an illusion and so on,

original: gang zhig de kho na nyid du skye ba dang 'gag pa mi rigs pa de ni ji ltar rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid ces gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig de kho na nyid du skye ba dang 'gag pa mi rigs pa de ni ji ltar rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid ces gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be said that it has essence, since it is not tenable that it arises and ceases in reality?

original: de la 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: In response to this, the following might be thought:

original: gal te rang bzhin med pa'i las de'i dbang gis ji ltar bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin med pa'i las de'i dbang gis ji ltar bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf karma is essenceless, how could it be that the nature of the self is appropriated on the strength of that?‚Äù

original: 'dir lan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir lan bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to that is:

original: de skyes bdag 'dzin de 'dzin med //
analyzed: de skyes bdag 'dzin de 'dzin med //
translated: When it arises, there is no self-appropriation.

original: ces bya ba'i las las skyes pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid du de yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i las las skyes pa nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bdag nyid kyi dngos po yongs su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid du de yongs su 'dzin pa med pa de kho na'o //
translated: That which is the appropriation of a self, which is the entity that is held to arise from karma, is in reality just the non-appropriation of that.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa las yin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa las yin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is said that it is from conceptualization.

original: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: yang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir las las skyes par mngon par 'dod pa bdag nyid kyi dngos por snang ba gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa kho na las yin gyi dngos po nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las las skyes par mngon par 'dod pa bdag nyid kyi dngos por snang ba gang yin pa de ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa kho na las yin gyi dngos po nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Because that which appears as the entity of a self, which is held to arise from karma, is just from conceptualization, which is the nature of beginningless ignorance, and not from an entity.

original: rab rib kyi rgyu mtshan skra shad 'dzings pa dang zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab rib kyi rgyu mtshan skra shad 'dzings pa dang zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the visual images of a mass of hair, a double moon, and so on.

original: 'di nyid kyang khyod kyis kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang khyod kyis kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: This must be accepted by you.

original: gzhan du gal te las ni rang bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te las ni rang bzhin du gyur zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: Otherwise, if karma were to exist essentially, as you have said, then the body would be permanent.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: gang zhig rten 'brel ma yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa yin te /üîΩrgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang @356a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rten 'brel ma yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa yin te / rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang @356a * //
translated: It is reasonable to say that whatever is not dependently arisen is essentially existent.

original: dag par ma skyes pa nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag par ma skyes pa nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which arises from causes and conditions, like an illusion, is not really arisen, it is essenceless.

original: gal te las kyang rten 'brel ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te las kyang rten 'brel ma yin te /
translated: If karma were not dependently arisen,

original: der 'gyur ba na gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu ba nyid du 'gyur ba de'i phyir des bskyed par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa lus kyi dngos po yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba
analyzed: der 'gyur ba na gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir rtag tu ba nyid du 'gyur ba de'i phyir des bskyed par bya bar mngon par 'dod pa lus kyi dngos po yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba
translated: then, since it would not depend on another, it would be permanent. Therefore, the body that is to be produced by it would also be permanent, since its cause would be complete.

original: ni nyes pa gcig ste /
analyzed: ni nyes pa gcig ste /
