translated: This is the first fault.

original: gang gi phyir khyod kyis rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyod kyis rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: Because you do not assert that permanence is the nature of things.

original: las dang las kyi 'bras bu rtag pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: las dang las kyi 'bras bu rtag pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If karma and the result of karma were permanent,

original: las kyang sdug bsngal rnam smin can mi 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyang sdug bsngal rnam smin can mi 'gyur //
translated: karma would not be the cause of suffering.üîΩThis is the second fault. And,üîΩtherefore, it would be a self and not nonself,

original: zhes bya ba nyes pa gnyis pa dang / de'i phyir bdag tu 'gyur te bdag med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nyes pa gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyes pa gnyis pa dang / de'i phyir bdag tu 'gyur te bdag med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba nyes pa gsum pa yin te /
translated: this is the third fault.

original: mi rtag kho na las sdug bsngal ba de nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag kho na las sdug bsngal ba de nyid dang / bdag med pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is maintained that only the impermanent is suffering and nonself.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa ni 'du byed dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag dang / bdag med pa dang 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa ni 'du byed dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dag dang / bdag med pa dang 'brel pa'am /
translated: Because the permanent is not related to the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of change, and nonself.

original: khyod kyis khas blangs pa yang ma yin te /üîΩgang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
analyzed: khyod kyis khas blangs pa yang ma yin te / gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
translated: And you do not accept that,üîΩbecause it is established as a tenet that whatever is impermanent is suffering,

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and whatever is suffering is nonself.

original: gal te de yang sgyu ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skye ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med par khyod kyis khas len pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par thal ba ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: gal te de yang sgyu ma nyid la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas skye ba'i phyir de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med par khyod kyis khas len pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par thal ba ma yin te / gang gi phyir /
translated: But if you accept that, like an illusion and so on, it arises in dependence, then you accept that ultimately it is essenceless. Therefore, the absurd consequence stated does not follow.

original: gang brten nas skyes pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang brten nas skyes pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: Because whatever arises in dependence is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.üîΩWhatever is suffering is essenceless.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid du smra bas kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mi bsnyon pa'i phyir khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes stong pa nyid du smra bas kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa la mi bsnyon pa'i phyir khas len pa nyid do //
translated: Because the proponents of emptiness do not deny conventional truth, they accept this.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / las ni rkyen skyes ci yang med //
analyzed: de'i phyir / las ni rkyen skyes ci yang med //
translated: Karma is not produced from conditions.

original: ces rgyas par ro //
analyzed: ces rgyas par ro //
translated: This is elaborated.

original: gang gi phyir las brten nas skyes par khas len na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las brten nas skyes par khas len na /
translated: Because we accept that karma arises in dependence,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du de kho na nyid du skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / brten nas ma skyes pa la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gsum du thal ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'phags pa gnyis po dag gis de ma thag tu rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du de kho na nyid du skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / brten nas ma skyes pa la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gsum du thal ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'phags pa gnyis po dag gis de ma thag tu rang bzhin med pa nyid du bstan pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because they are like illusions and so on, they are not produced and do not cease in reality, and because the three faults mentioned in the context of dependent origination would ensue for that which is not produced in dependence, the two noble ones have just taught that they are essenceless.

original: las ni rkyen skyes ci yang med //
analyzed: las ni rkyen skyes ci yang med //
translated: Karma is not produced from conditions.

original: rkyen las skyes min yod min te //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes min yod min te //
translated: That which is not produced from conditions does not exist.

original: de kho na nyid du @356b zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du @356b zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the statement of reality.

original: 'on te de las rab tu spangs na rigs pa thun mong ba nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / de gnyi ga rgyu mtshan can gyi skye ba yang rab tu spang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te de las rab tu spangs na rigs pa thun mong ba nyid kyis de'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / de gnyi ga rgyu mtshan can gyi skye ba yang rab tu spang bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if you reject that, then would you not also have to reject the afflictions that are asserted to be its cause by means of the common logic of the world, and the production that is based on both of them?

original: de'i phyir 'du byed 'di gang dag gis 'du byed pa dang / gang dag 'du byed pa zhes bye brag tu sgrub pa'i dbye bas dngos po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so sor snang ba'i spyod yul du 'gro ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed 'di gang dag gis 'du byed pa dang / gang dag 'du byed pa zhes bye brag tu sgrub pa'i dbye bas dngos po rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid rnams so sor snang ba'i spyod yul du 'gro ba ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove the doubt, ‚ÄúHow can these formations, which are the objects of the domain of experience that appear individually as things with the nature of cause and effect, be established by the distinction of those that form and those that are formed?

original: 'du byed rnams ni sgyu ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni sgyu ma dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúFormations are like illusions, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa rnams kyang brten nas byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du log par snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis snang ba de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kyang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa rnams kyang brten nas byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du log par snang ba'i bdag nyid kyis snang ba de bzhin du 'du byed thams cad kyang yin te /
translated: Just as the non-existent cities of gandharvas, etc., appear as the nature of a false appearance that is dependent origination, so are all formations.

original: gang gis na de dag nyid yang dag par yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las rgyu mtshan lhag ma mthong ngo zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na de dag nyid yang dag par yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa las rgyu mtshan lhag ma mthong ngo zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that one sees the remaining reasons for positing them as real.

original: 'di dag nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this, he says,

original: las ni nyon mongs rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs rgyu mtshan can //
translated: Action is the cause of the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: gang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'du byed thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du med kyang brdzun pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'du byed thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid du med kyang brdzun pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang /
translated: Because all formations are dependently arisen, like a phantom city and so on, they do not exist as real things, but appear as false aspects.

original: ba de nyid kyi phyir las 'ba' zhig stong pa nyid du dpyod pa'i skabs su bab pa yin na yang rigs pa thun mong nyid kyis gsum ka yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par dpyod pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ba de nyid kyi phyir las 'ba' zhig stong pa nyid du dpyod pa'i skabs su bab pa yin na yang rigs pa thun mong nyid kyis gsum ka yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par dpyod pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the occasion is to analyze only action as empty, the three are analyzed as empty of intrinsic reality by the common reasoning.

original: gsum ka zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsum ka zhes bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / lus zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / lus zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: They are the afflictions, action, and body.

original: sngar 'du byed ces brjod pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'di dag nyid tsam sngar bstan pa'i bye brag tu bsgrub pa'i dbye bas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar 'du byed ces brjod pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir 'di dag nyid tsam sngar bstan pa'i bye brag tu bsgrub pa'i dbye bas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they were previously mentioned as formations, they are taught first because they are the principal ones. They are included in the analysis of the categories of establishment as just these three.

original: de la byed pa sgrub pa bstan pas nyon mongs pa dang las dag ni rgyu nyid du bstan to /
analyzed: de la byed pa sgrub pa bstan pas nyon mongs pa dang las dag ni rgyu nyid du bstan to /
translated: The statement that the formations are the cause of the defilements and karma teaches that the defilements and karma are the cause of the formations.

original: nyon mongs pa ni las kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni las kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: The defilements are the cause of karma,

original: las kyang lus kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyang lus kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and karma is the cause of the body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: las ni nyon mongs la rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba dang / lus ni las kyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs la rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba dang / lus ni las kyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that karma is the cause of the defilements and the body is the cause of karma.

original: 'di ji ltar rtogs par yin zhe na /üîΩ'du byed nyon mongs pa las bdag nyid ces @357a * //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar rtogs par yin zhe na / 'du byed nyon mongs pa las bdag nyid ces @357a * //
translated: How is this understood?

original: bya bar smos so //
analyzed: bya bar smos so //
translated: It is said that the formations are of the nature of the defilements.

original: 'ang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: 'ang ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir las dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rnams te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir las dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi 'du byed kyi rnams te /
translated: Because the formations are of the nature of karma and defilements,üîΩthe causes are taught in the tenets of the Abhidharma.

original: rgyu rnams ni grub pa'i mtha' las bstan to zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni grub pa'i mtha' las bstan to zhes bya ba dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas yin //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas yin //
translated: The root of existence is the proclivities.

original: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The world is born from karma.

original: zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: 'dir rtsa ba ni rgyu las kyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba ni rgyu las kyi rgyu yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here, the root should be understood as the cause of karma.

original: las sgrub pa bstan pa ni lus gtso bor las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin la de las gzhan longs spyod dang gnas kyi dngos po la sogs pa ni de'i yan lag nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: las sgrub pa bstan pa ni lus gtso bor las kyi 'bras bu nyid yin la de las gzhan longs spyod dang gnas kyi dngos po la sogs pa ni de'i yan lag nyid kyis yin no //
translated: The teaching on the accomplishment of karma is that the body is the result of karma, and that the other things, such as resources and place, are its branches.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang de nyid kyis de 'phen par grub pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang de nyid kyis de 'phen par grub pa'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos te /
translated: Therefore, since it is established that it is projected by that, it is not mentioned separately.

original: rgyal po 'ongs zhes ston pa na de'i 'khor logs shig tu ston par mi byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal po 'ongs zhes ston pa na de'i 'khor logs shig tu ston par mi byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: When it is said that the king has come, his retinue is not mentioned separately.

original: de bas na 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs su bab na de dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dbang gis 'du byed thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa yin la /üîΩskabs su bab pa'i las rang bzhin med par mthar phyin pas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar rang bzhin stong pa nyid du rnam par dpyod pa'i skabs su bab na de dang rjes su 'brel ba'i dbang gis 'du byed thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa yin la / skabs su bab pa'i las rang bzhin med par mthar phyin pas /
translated: Therefore, when the occasion is the analysis of the emptiness of intrinsic reality, all compounded phenomena are taught to be empty of intrinsic reality by the power of their connection with that.üîΩSince the occasion is the ultimate nonexistence of karma,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye med cing //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis skye med cing //
translated: it is said that karma is not produced by itself.

original: 'gag med gang tshe mthar min nam //
analyzed: 'gag med gang tshe mthar min nam //
translated: If there is no cessation, then there is no end.

original: zhes bya ba skabs kyi rang gzod ma nas zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhung gzugs la ches shin tu grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba skabs kyi rang gzod ma nas zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzhung gzugs la ches shin tu grub bo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the scriptures on nirvana, which has the characteristic of primordial peace, are completely established,

original: las med na ni byed pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: las med na ni byed pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf there is no karma, then there is no agent,‚Äù and so on.

original: las ni bya ba yin la de yang byed pa po med par mi rigs pa'i phyir de dag nyid yod na byed pa po yang yod pa 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: las ni bya ba yin la de yang byed pa po med par mi rigs pa'i phyir de dag nyid yod na byed pa po yang yod pa 'phen par byed do //
translated: Karma is activity, and that is not tenable without an agent. Therefore, if they exist, the existence of the agent is implied.

original: de byed pa dang ldan pa 'di de ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de byed pa dang ldan pa 'di de ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin la /
translated: This agent who possesses activity is not without a result.

original: 'bras bu yang longs spyod pa po rnams kyang de nyid thob pa med pa'i phyir las dang byed pa po yod pa ni 'bras bu dang longs spyod pa po'i yod pa 'phen par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang longs spyod pa po rnams kyang de nyid thob pa med pa'i phyir las dang byed pa po yod pa ni 'bras bu dang longs spyod pa po'i yod pa 'phen par byed do //
translated: Since the result also is not without an experiencer, the existence of karma and the agent imply the existence of the result and the experiencer.

original: yang gang gi tshe bstan zin pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi las nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe der med pas der 'brel par 'jug par byed pa po dang 'bras bu dang longs spyod pa po rnams kyang med pa yin pa de bas
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe bstan zin pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi las nyid yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe der med pas der 'brel par 'jug par byed pa po dang 'bras bu dang longs spyod pa po rnams kyang med pa yin pa de bas
translated: Moreover, when the karma of emptiness of intrinsic reality does not exist due to the reasoning already explained, then since it does not exist there, the agent who engages in it, the effect, and the experiencer do not exist.

original: na dben pa yin te /
analyzed: na dben pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are void.

original: rnam par dben pa nyid yin zhing rang bzhin stong pa nyid de gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na mthar phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa nyid yin zhing rang bzhin stong pa nyid de gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na mthar phyin pa nyid do //
translated: They are completely void, and that emptiness of intrinsic reality is peace from the beginning itself, and it is the ultimate itself.

original: @357b de nyid kyang sngar thar par rnam par gzhag pa yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba la 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @357b de nyid kyang sngar thar par rnam par gzhag pa yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba la 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is previously established as liberation, there is not the slightest contradiction for the proponent of emptiness.

original: gal te gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na thar pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid kho na thar pa yin no //
translated: If peace from the beginning itself is liberation,

original: 'o na ni de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid smra ba la lam goms pa'i 'bad pa don med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid smra ba la lam goms pa'i 'bad pa don med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: then since it is not to be accomplished, the exertion to cultivate the path for the proponent of emptiness is pointless.

original: ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma yin te ;
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is it so?

original: las stong par ni yang dag par //
analyzed: las stong par ni yang dag par //
translated: And action is truly empty.

original: zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: And so on at length.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning is understood as follows:

original: gal te don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa de ltar na yang de kun rdzob tu yang de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te don dam par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba med pa de ltar na yang de kun rdzob tu yang de ltar ma yin te /
translated: If ultimately dependent origination is non-arisen, then it is not so conventionally either.

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa ni kun rdzob yin te /
translated: Because ignorance is conventional,

original: de kho na nyid la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obscures reality.

original: 'di na yang dag min dngos kyang //
analyzed: 'di na yang dag min dngos kyang //
translated: And here:

original: yang dag nyid du snang gang de //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du snang gang de //
translated: The unreal appears as real.

original: ma rig de nyid kun rdzob yin //
analyzed: ma rig de nyid kun rdzob yin //
translated: That ignorance is conventional.

original: de yi skye bar yang dag 'dod //
analyzed: de yi skye bar yang dag 'dod //
translated: Its arising is accepted as real.üîΩAnd so on.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: And:

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes dngos rnams //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes dngos rnams //
translated: Those things arisen from causesüîΩAre explained as unarisen

original: yang dag par ni rtogs pa gang //
analyzed: yang dag par ni rtogs pa gang //
translated: By the one who sees reality.

original: de ni ston pas ma rig gsungs //
analyzed: de ni ston pas ma rig gsungs //
translated: The Teacher has declared ignorance

original: de las yan lag bcu gnyis 'byung //
analyzed: de las yan lag bcu gnyis 'byung //
translated: To be the root of the twelve links.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so on.

original: de bas na 'di ltar skye ba'i rim pa mi 'gal ba yin na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar skye ba'i rim pa mi 'gal ba yin na /
translated: Thus, since the order of arising is not contradictory,

original: 'gog pa'i rim pa yang mi 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rim pa yang mi 'gal ba nyid yin te /
translated: The sequence of cessation is also not contradictory.

original: dngos stong shes na yang dag pa //
analyzed: dngos stong shes na yang dag pa //
translated: If one understands the emptiness of things,

original: mthong phyir ma rig mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: mthong phyir ma rig mi 'byung ba //
translated: then one sees reality, and ignorance does not arise.

original: de ni ma rig 'gog pa yin //
analyzed: de ni ma rig 'gog pa yin //
translated: This is the cessation of ignorance.

original: de'i phyir yan lag bcu gnyis 'gag / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag bcu gnyis 'gag / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the twelve members cease.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du lta ba la kun rdzob kyi bden pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du lta ba la kun rdzob kyi bden pa skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the view of emptiness does not contradict the arising and cessation of conventional truth.

original: pha rol po sa lam goms pa'i 'bad pas 'bras bu med pa'i nyes pas thal bar 'gyur ba smra ba la lan 'debs par 'dod pas /
analyzed: pha rol po sa lam goms pa'i 'bad pas 'bras bu med pa'i nyes pas thal bar 'gyur ba smra ba la lan 'debs par 'dod pas /
translated: The opponent, who has been charged with the fault that the result is nonexistent because of the effort of cultivating the path,

original: las stong par ni yang dag par //
analyzed: las stong par ni yang dag par //
translated: wishes to reply, ‚ÄúIf karma is empty,üîΩthen the path is not tenable.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lan bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: The reply that is taught, ‚ÄúIf karma is empty, then the path is not tenable,‚Äù and so on, is itself reasonable.

original: 'di ltar tshogs dang sbyor ba'i lam rnams med par las yang dag par stong par rnam par shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs dang sbyor ba'i lam rnams med par las yang dag par stong par rnam par shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, without the path of accumulation and the path of preparation, one would not understand that karma is truly empty.

original: de la chos mchog gi gnas skabs su nem nur med par stong par rnam par shes na de ma thag tu de nyid mthong ba'i phyir dang lam mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la chos mchog gi gnas skabs su nem nur med par stong par rnam par shes na de ma thag tu de nyid mthong ba'i phyir dang lam mi 'byung ste /
translated: In that regard, when one knows emptiness without doubt in the state of the supreme mundane right view, then immediately after that, one sees thatness. Therefore, the path does not arise.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'gog par 'gyur te mi 'jug go zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'gog par 'gyur te mi 'jug go zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that when ignorance ceases, cessation occurs, and the path does not engage.

original: de las de med na /
analyzed: de las de med na /
translated: If that does not exist,

original: las las @358a * //
analyzed: las las @358a * //
translated: from action

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste skye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba ste skye ba'o //
translated: consciousness and so on arise, that is, are born.

original: mi 'byung ba ni mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba ni mi skye ba'o //
translated: Non-arising is non-birth.

original: de zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is ‚Äúthat.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The intended meaning is that it does not arise because there is no cause.

original: de bas na 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pa bstan pas kun rdzob tu lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis lugs las bzlog pa'i rim pa bstan pas kun rdzob tu lam 'bras bu dang bcas par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the twelve factors of dependent origination are taught in reverse order, and the conventional path with its result is established.

original: 'on te don dam par rnam par dpyad na med pa gang yin pa de nyid ma brtags na nyams dga' bar grags pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dam 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes bya bar dngos po gcig la ltos pa'i
analyzed: 'on te don dam par rnam par dpyad na med pa gang yin pa de nyid ma brtags na nyams dga' bar grags pa'i mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu rgyu'i ngo bo nyid dam 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid du yod do zhes bya bar dngos po gcig la ltos pa'i
translated: But if you analyze in terms of the ultimate, you accept that the very thing that does not exist is the nature of the conventional, which is not analyzed but is renowned as delightful.

original: dbye bas yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa yin na /
analyzed: dbye bas yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid du khas blangs pa yin na /
translated: In terms of the conventional, you accept that it exists as the nature of the cause or the nature of the effect.üîΩBut since it is not an object of knowledge, it is not possible for anyone to understand it as nonexistent without an example.

original: de yang dpe med par bstan pa'i med par 'ga' zhig gis kyang rtogs par nus pa ma yin zhing 'di la dpe 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ma bstan pa dang 'dra ba kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang dpe med par bstan pa'i med par 'ga' zhig gis kyang rtogs par nus pa ma yin zhing 'di la dpe 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir 'di ma bstan pa dang 'dra ba kho na ma yin nam /
translated: And since it has no example at all, isn‚Äôt it just like something that is not taught?üîΩIn order to teach this point to the opponent, the following is stated:

original: zhes bya bar phyir rgol ba de la shin tu grags pa'i dpe rab tu bstan pas don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩji ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar phyir rgol ba de la shin tu grags pa'i dpe rab tu bstan pas don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩji ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The example that is very well knownüîΩis taught in order to understand the meaning.

original: ji ltar khyod dang kho bo cag la rtsod pa med par grub pa /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod dang kho bo cag la rtsod pa med par grub pa /
translated: Just as you and we do not dispute thatüîΩthe Bhagavat is the one who knows and understands the way things really are,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ji lta ba de kho na bzhin gnas pa de ni de kho na bzhin du rtogs shing khong du chud pa'am yang na thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid du gyurüîΩpa thob pa dang 'brel bas 'khor ba kho na'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni chos rnams thams cad kyi ji lta ba de kho na bzhin gnas pa de ni de kho na bzhin du rtogs shing khong du chud pa'am yang na thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mthar thug pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa thob pa dang 'brel bas 'khor ba kho na'am /
translated: or else he is the one who has attained the state of the ultimate meditative stabilization of nondual method and wisdom,üîΩand thus he does not remain in samsara alone or in nirvana alone,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa kho nar ji ltar gnas par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs shing thob pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyis zhes bya ba'i cho 'phrul gyi
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa kho nar ji ltar gnas par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su gshegs shing thob pa zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas gang yin pa de ni rdzu 'phrul gyis zhes bya ba'i cho 'phrul gyi
translated: in the same way, the Tathagata, the Buddha, who is said to have gone to and attained the expanse of nirvana, is the one who has attained the power of the miraculous,üîΩthe power of the superknowledge of miracles.

original: khyad par gyis gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung nas rjes su mthun pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par sprul pa sprul par mdzad la ste skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyis gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung nas rjes su mthun pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par sprul pa sprul par mdzad la ste skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Having taken care of the beings to be trained, he emanates emanations, that is, he creates emanations, in accordance with the particular characteristics of those to be trained.

original: sprul pa des kyang sprul pa gzhan la yang ste slar yang sprul par byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang sprul pa gzhan la yang ste slar yang sprul par byed do //
translated: And those emanations also emanate other emanations, that is, they again create emanations.

original: de la ste sprul pa de dag gi nang nas de bzhin gshegs pas dngos su sprul pa gang yin pa de dag tu stong pa rang bzhin dang bral ba der sprul pas @358b sprul pa la gtam du brjod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar bstan
analyzed: de la ste sprul pa de dag gi nang nas de bzhin gshegs pas dngos su sprul pa gang yin pa de dag tu stong pa rang bzhin dang bral ba der sprul pas @358b sprul pa la gtam du brjod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar bstan
translated: And from among those emanations, the emanations that are directly emanated by the Tathagata, in those emanations, the emptiness devoid of intrinsic existence is taught. So what need is there to mention the teaching of emptiness in the emanations of those emanations?

original: pa ni / sprul pas sprul smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa ni / sprul pas sprul smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúWhat need is there to mention the emanations of emanations?‚Äù

original: dpe 'dis de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med pa bstan nas de nyid la kun rdzob tu yod pa yin yang mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir smos pa ni /
analyzed: dpe 'dis de kho na nyid du rang bzhin med pa bstan nas de nyid la kun rdzob tu yod pa yin yang mi 'gal lo zhes bstan pa'i phyir smos pa ni /
translated: Having taught that in reality there is no intrinsic existence, in order to teach that even though it does exist conventionally, there is no contradiction, the text says:

original: de ni gnyi ga yod min te /üîΩsprul pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga yod min te /üîΩsprul pa gnyi ga zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Neither of them exists.üîΩThis means that neither of the two emanations exists.

original: ci yang dag pa nyid du yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci yang dag pa nyid du yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it real?

original: gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúWhatever it may be,‚Äù

original: dpyad par 'os pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir te kun rdzob bo zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dpyad par 'os pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir te kun rdzob bo zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: because the nature of what is not suitable to be analyzed is not able to withstand analysis. The meaning is that it is the relative.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan pa rtogs pa tsam ste 'khrul pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan pa rtogs pa tsam ste 'khrul pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúmere realization of the teaching‚Äù is ‚Äúmere delusion.‚Äù

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyis dpe la ltos pa'i dbye bas gcig la yang dag par med pa'i ngo bo dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas gnyi ga'i ngo bo de nyid don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor gyur pa nyid kyis dpe la ltos pa'i dbye bas gcig la yang dag par med pa'i ngo bo dang / kun rdzob tu yod pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan nas gnyi ga'i ngo bo de nyid don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, by virtue of being the nature of cause and effect, the example is divided into the nature that does not exist in reality and the nature that exists conventionally. Having taught that, in order to apply both natures to the meaning, he says, ‚ÄúThus, it is like‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: byed pa po 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas dngos su sprul pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs par rtogs par byas te /
analyzed: byed pa po 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas dngos su sprul pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs par rtogs par byas te /
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúThus, it is like‚Ä¶‚Äù is that the nature of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs emanation is like the nature of the emanated person.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the same in being the agent.

original: las ni de'i sprul pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: las ni de'i sprul pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The action is similar to its emanation,

original: bskyed par bya ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the same in being the object produced.

original: byed pa po dang las kyi ngo bo de lta bu gnyis ka de ni de bzhin te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa'i sprul pa gnyis bzhin du /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las kyi ngo bo de lta bu gnyis ka de ni de bzhin te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gyur pa'i sprul pa gnyis bzhin du /
translated: Both of these two, the nature of the agent and the nature of the action, are like the two emanations, which are the entity of cause and effect.

original: don dam par rang bzhin gyis ni zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bos stong pa yin par rtogs par bya zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin gyis ni zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bos stong pa yin par rtogs par bya zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: One should understand that ultimately, i.e., by way of their intrinsic reality, they are empty of intrinsic reality.üîΩThis is the remainder of the verse.

original: de tsam gyis rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis rnam pa thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But this does not mean that they do not exist in any way,

original: de ni kun rdzob tu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob tu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because they exist conventionally. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: rtog tsam gang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtog tsam gang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Whatever is merely conceptual, etc.

original: de 'dir yang de bzhin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'dir yang de bzhin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here also, the phrase ‚Äúin just the same way‚Äù should be supplied.

original: don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning is the same as before.

original: 'on te las la sogs pa gcig kho nar yod pa nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs nas skyon ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te las la sogs pa gcig kho nar yod pa nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs nas skyon ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: But if you accept that karma and so on exist as one entity, then what fault ensues?

original: gang gis ni de spang ba'i phyir ltos pa'i dbye bas gnyi ga'i ngo bor 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ni de spang ba'i phyir ltos pa'i dbye bas gnyi ga'i ngo bor 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what means do you abandon that? You assert that karma and so on have a nature that is both, by dividing them into two in terms of their dependence.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis las yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgal te gcig kho nar rang bzhin gyis las dang des nye bar mtshon pa @359a * //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis las yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te gcig kho nar rang bzhin gyis las dang des nye bar mtshon pa @359a * //
translated: If karma exists essentially, then what fault accrues if you accept that karma and so on exist as one entity?üîΩIf you accept that karma and so on exist essentially as one entity, then the effect of that karma, the person who is characterized by that karma, and so on would all exist simultaneously.

original: gzhan byed pa po la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bur skye ba'i yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gnyis kyis rtag pa nyid du 'jug pas de nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa med pa de'i phyir
analyzed: gzhan byed pa po la sogs pa yod par khas blangs pa de'i tshe de'i 'bras bur skye ba'i yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gnyis kyis rtag pa nyid du 'jug pas de nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa med pa de'i phyir
translated: Since the effect would arise simultaneously with the cause, the effect would be permanent. Therefore, since nirvana, which is the pacification of that, would not exist,

original: thar pa la skur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba dgongs so ;
analyzed: thar pa la skur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba dgongs so ;
translated: you would be denigrating liberation.

original: /'on te las dang byed pa po rang bzhin gyis gtan du gal te med na de'i tshe rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de'i 'bras bu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yang med pa de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa'i
analyzed: /'on te las dang byed pa po rang bzhin gyis gtan du gal te med na de'i tshe rgyu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pas de'i 'bras bu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa yang med pa de'i phyir 'khor bar 'jug pa'i
translated: But if karma and the agent were utterly nonexistent by nature, then, because there would be no cause, there would be no effect. Thus, the pleasant and unpleasant effects would also not exist. Therefore, this process of engaging in cyclic existence

original: rim pa nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di la bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa nyams su myong bas grub pa 'di la bsnyon pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: would be refuted by the experience of its establishment.

original: yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas skyon 'di gnyis kyi go skabs med pa de'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas skyon 'di gnyis kyi go skabs med pa de'i phyir thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, because of the absence of the opportunity for these two errors, as explained above, everything is well established.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba la ltos nas yod pa gang yin pa de nyid med pa yin par mi 'gal ba yin pa de'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i bstan pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbye ba la ltos nas yod pa gang yin pa de nyid med pa yin par mi 'gal ba yin pa de'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i bstan pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i bsam pa'i
translated: Since existence, in terms of the distinction between conventional and ultimate truth, is not contradictory with nonexistence, the teachings, which are included in the three vehicles, are not contradictory with the thought of the disciples.

original: bye brag gi ngo bor 'jug pa don snga phyi 'gal ba nyid lta bur mngon du snang yang don mi 'gal ba don can kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod ces rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: bye brag gi ngo bor 'jug pa don snga phyi 'gal ba nyid lta bur mngon du snang yang don mi 'gal ba don can kho na'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir yod ces rgyas par smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the meaning is not contradictory, even though the engagement in the particular nature appears to be contradictory, he says: ‚Äúexistence‚Äù and so on extensively.

original: yod ces pa'am ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi tshul la gzugs kyi phung po lta bu'o //
analyzed: yod ces pa'am ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi tshul la gzugs kyi phung po lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Existence‚Äù is like the aggregate of form in the external mode.

original: med ces pa'am ni ji ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i tshul lta bu'o //
analyzed: med ces pa'am ni ji ltar de nyid rnam par shes pa'i tshul lta bu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Non-existence‚Äù is like that very [aggregate of form] in the mode of consciousness.

original: yod med dam zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshul lta bu ste /
analyzed: yod med dam zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i tshul lta bu ste /
translated: ‚Äú Both existence and non-existence‚Äù is like the mode of consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par bya ba gang yin pa de kun rdzob dang / don dam pa la ltos nas ci rigs par mi 'gal ba'i phyir yod pa nyid do zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan par bya ba gang yin pa de kun rdzob dang / don dam pa la ltos nas ci rigs par mi 'gal ba'i phyir yod pa nyid do zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is to be taught by the Blessed One, that should be understood as ‚Äúexistence‚Äù in accordance with the conventional and the ultimate, because it is not contradictory.

original: phyogs gnyis pa dag la yod par zhes bya ba byed pa'i tshig dang 'brel te brjod pa na phyogs gsum pa la yang gi sgras 'phangs pa de dang 'brel par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa dag la yod par zhes bya ba byed pa'i tshig dang 'brel te brjod pa na phyogs gsum pa la yang gi sgras 'phangs pa de dang 'brel par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the second case, ‚Äúin the ultimate‚Äù is connected with the verbal action, and when it is stated, it should be understood that it is connected with the term ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the third case.

original: mchog gi don dam pa la ltos nas ni /
analyzed: mchog gi don dam pa la ltos nas ni /
translated: In relation to the supreme ultimate,

original: yang med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yang med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúnot existent‚Äù is stated.

original: med pa yang zhes yang gi sgras rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: med pa yang zhes yang gi sgras rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso not nonexistent‚Äù is stated by the term ‚Äúalso,‚Äù which is connected in order.

original: ci zhig ces sdig pa la /
analyzed: ci zhig ces sdig pa la /
translated: What?

original: yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúExistent,‚Äù ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù

original: yod med ces bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa ma brjod pa sdud pa'i don can gyi yang gi sgras 'phangs pa rnams pa gsum pa 'gog pa'i @359b bdag nyid rnam pa bzhi par bstan par bya ba dgag pa nyid du 'di sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yod med ces bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan pa ma brjod pa sdud pa'i don can gyi yang gi sgras 'phangs pa rnams pa gsum pa 'gog pa'i @359b bdag nyid rnam pa bzhi par bstan par bya ba dgag pa nyid du 'di sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: or ‚Äúboth existent and nonexistent‚Äù are the three modes of expression that are not stated. They are implied by the term ‚Äúalso,‚Äù which has the meaning of inclusion. They are to be connected with the negation that is the fourth mode of expression, which has the nature of a negation.

original: gang gi phyir mchog gi dam pa ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis kyang bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog gi dam pa ni rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis kyang bstan par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the supreme ultimate is not suitable to be expressed by these four modes.

original: de ni mtha' bzhi dag las rnam par grol ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mtha' bzhi dag las rnam par grol ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the four extremes.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //
translated: It is not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent,

original: gnyi ga min pa'i bdag nyid min //
analyzed: gnyi ga min pa'i bdag nyid min //
translated: Not even of the nature of not being either.

original: mtha' bzhi dag las grol ba la //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dag las grol ba la //
translated: Liberated from the four extremes,

original: dbu ma pa yis dam par rtogs //üîΩzhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbu ma pa yis dam par rtogs // zhes bstan to //
translated: The Madhyamika understands it to be supreme.

original: 'phags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang /üîΩgang blo yod dang med pa las //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i zhal snga nas kyis kyang / gang blo yod dang med pa las //
translated: And the Arya Nagarjuna also says,üîΩThose whose minds transcend existence and nonexistence

original: rnam par 'das shing mi gnas pa //üîΩde dag zab mo dmigs med par //
analyzed: rnam par 'das shing mi gnas pa // de dag zab mo dmigs med par //
translated: And do not abide in either,

original: rkyen gyi don la rnam par sgom //
analyzed: rkyen gyi don la rnam par sgom //
translated: They meditate on the profound, the absence of any cognitive object,

original: zhes gsungs so //üîΩ'dir yang mtha' gnyis smos pa ni cig car sgrub pa dang dgag pas de las gzhan pa'i mtha' gnyis yod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs so // 'dir yang mtha' gnyis smos pa ni cig car sgrub pa dang dgag pas de las gzhan pa'i mtha' gnyis yod pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of dependent origination.üîΩHere, the mention of two extremes is for the sake of the other two extremes, by affirming and negating them respectively.

original: de'i phyir don gyis 'phangs pa nyid kyis mthar phyi ma gnyis ma bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis 'phangs pa nyid kyis mthar phyi ma gnyis ma bstan pa ni mdor bsdus pa brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the latter two extremes are not mentioned, because they are implied by the former two, and because it is the intention to speak concisely.

original: de kho na nyid ni mtha' bzhi dag las rnam par 'das pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni mtha' bzhi dag las rnam par 'das pa nyid yin te /
translated: Reality is beyond the four extremes,

original: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pa nyid kyis tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing brjod du med pa nyid kyis tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nondual and inexpressible, and thus it transcends all conventions.

original: gal te mchog gi don dam pa ni ngag dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang bstan par mi spyod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mchog gi don dam pa ni ngag dang rnam par rtog pa las 'das pa nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang bstan par mi spyod pa yin na /
translated: If the supreme ultimate truth transcends speech and thought, and thus the buddhas do not even teach it,

original: 'o na ni de las gzhan du de dag gi bstan pa rnams 'jug par byed ce na /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni de las gzhan du de dag gi bstan pa rnams 'jug par byed ce na / sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then how do their teachings function in regard to it?üîΩThe verse says, ‚ÄúThe buddhas, having seen the supreme ultimate truth, teach the Dharma in order to help others see it.‚Äù

original: mchog gi don dam pa gzigs pa'i skyob pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs nas te /
analyzed: mchog gi don dam pa gzigs pa'i skyob pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs nas te /
translated: The buddhas, the protectors, who have seen the supreme ultimate truth, teach the Dharma with the intention of helping others see it.

original: rigs kyi khyad par la ltos nas dgongs pa'i khyad par gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dgongs pa la rgyu nyid du brten nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis gang gsungs pa bstan pa'i ngo bo'i gsung 'jug pa de ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par la ltos nas dgongs pa'i khyad par gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su bzung ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dgongs pa la rgyu nyid du brten nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis gang gsungs pa bstan pa'i ngo bo'i gsung 'jug pa de ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The special intention in dependence on the special type of person is the teaching of the essence of speech that is not easily understood, which is spoken by the power of the force of former prayers, in dependence on the cause of the special intention that is the acceptance of the person to be trained.

original: rgan po nye bar bsten pa ma byas pa rnams kyis ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgan po nye bar bsten pa ma byas pa rnams kyis ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not easily understood by those who have not relied on an elder.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gang dag bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa de'i dbang gis bsgrubs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' la mkhas pa'i blo gros can yin pa de dag @360a * //
analyzed: gang dag bla ma dam pa nye bar bsten pa de'i dbang gis bsgrubs pa bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' la mkhas pa'i blo gros can yin pa de dag @360a * //
translated: Those who have relied on a holy guru and, by the power of that, have an intellect skilled in the speech of the Sugata

original: gis de dag rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gis de dag rtogs par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: will not easily understand it.

original: de ltar yang bstan bcos mdzad pa po nyid kyis 'dir gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar yang bstan bcos mdzad pa po nyid kyis 'dir gnas pa'am /
translated: Thus, the author of the treatise himself says here:

original: skye 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan bcos rtsom pa ni theg pa gsum dang 'brel ba'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pas bstan bcos rtsom pa ni theg pa gsum dang 'brel ba'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rgyu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The treatise is composed with the words arising and cessation, etc. in order to teach the cause of the Sugata's teaching, which is connected with the three vehicles.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir yang de dag gis ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir yang de dag gis ni rtogs par sla ba ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, they are not easily understood, because arising and cessation are not easily understood.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la bsten par mi 'gal bar 'jug pa bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' ma lus pa'i bstan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nye bar bstan pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la bsten par mi 'gal bar 'jug pa bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' ma lus pa'i bstan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa nye bar bstan pa yin na yang /
translated: Although the entire teaching of the Sugata, together with its result, is demonstrated without contradiction in dependence upon the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate,

original: kha cig thog ma med pa'i srid pa brgyud pa nas goms pa'i bden pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i zhen pas mi mkhas pa'i blo can gzugs la sogs pa rnams la kun rdzob nyid bzod par mi byed do //
analyzed: kha cig thog ma med pa'i srid pa brgyud pa nas goms pa'i bden pa'i dngos por 'dzin pa'i zhen pas mi mkhas pa'i blo can gzugs la sogs pa rnams la kun rdzob nyid bzod par mi byed do //
translated: some, due to the attachment to the apprehension of real things that has been cultivated since beginningless time, do not accept the conventional nature of form, etc. due to their unskillful intellect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas kyang de dag la don dam pa nyid du rang gi lugs kyis sngar gsal ba yin yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bstan bcos mdzad pas kyang de dag la don dam pa nyid du rang gi lugs kyis sngar gsal ba yin yang /
translated: For this very reason, although the treatise author has previously clarified his own position as the ultimate truth,üîΩhe says I will explain in order to demonstrate the conventional.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de nyid kyi lugs kyis gsal bar bzhed pa na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de nyid kyi lugs kyis gsal bar bzhed pa na /
translated: In order to generate certainty that is not subject to reversal, he states

original: gal te gzugs ni 'byung rang bzhin //
analyzed: gal te gzugs ni 'byung rang bzhin //
translated: If form is the intrinsic reality of the elements,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: etc.üîΩThat which has the cause of the elements that are not different in intrinsic reality is stated as

original: 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa de ni gal te gzugs ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i rgyu gang la yod pa de ni gal te gzugs ni 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: If form is the intrinsic reality of the elements,üîΩetc.üîΩAfter repeating that in reality, he refutes with

original: de kho na nyid du zhes rjes su brjod nas gzugs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du zhes rjes su brjod nas gzugs de zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: That form, etc.

original: gzugs de 'byung las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba ste grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs de 'byung las zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las byung ba ste grub pa ma yin no //
translated: That form does not arise from the elements that are its intrinsic reality, i.e., it does not arise from the elements that are its own nature.

original: 'dir aa'i tshig phrad ni dgag pa gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir aa'i tshig phrad ni dgag pa gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, the negative particle a is used to clarify the negation.

original: aa dang ma dang na dang n'a dag ni dgag par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: aa dang ma dang na dang n'a dag ni dgag par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚Äúa, ma, na, and na are used to negate.‚Äù

original: gang yang sems pa rang bzhin las min ma yin nam ste /
analyzed: gang yang sems pa rang bzhin las min ma yin nam ste /
translated: Also, it is not the case that intention is not from the intrinsic reality of the elements.

original: rang gi ngo bor grub pa'i 'byung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor grub pa'i 'byung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the elements that are established as their own nature.

original: des ni gdon mi za bar gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las byung ngo zhes khas len pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des ni gdon mi za bar gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las byung ngo zhes khas len pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is definitely accepted that they originate from elements that are different.

original: 'di la bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bstan pa ni /
translated: In response to this, the treatise states:

original: gzhan las kyang min te don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang min te don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They do not originate from other elements, for the meaning is: from elements that are different.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de med phyir zhes smos te gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med phyir zhes smos te gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The text states: ‚Äúbecause they do not exist,‚Äù for those elements that are different do not exist.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas gzugs @360b rnam pa bcu 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / reg byas bsdus pa 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid dngos po bar khas len pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta bur brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gyi dbye bas gzugs @360b rnam pa bcu 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / reg byas bsdus pa 'byung ba rnam pa bzhi'i bdag nyid dngos po bar khas len pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta bur brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: The ten types of form that originate from the differentiation of the faculties and objects are accepted as being real entities that are of the nature of the four types of elements that are subsumed within the tactile objects.

original: gang zhig 'byung ba'i rgyu can de ni 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'byung ba'i rgyu can de ni 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is caused by the elements is called ‚Äúderived from the elements.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba las grub pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes rjod par byed do //üîΩ'byung ba de dag kyang ci de las don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba las grub pa ni 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes rjod par byed do // 'byung ba de dag kyang ci de las don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'am /
translated: Thus, that which is established from the elements is called ‚Äúderived from the elements.‚ÄùüîΩAre these elements not different from that?

original: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin /
translated: Or are they different from that?

original: de la re zhig don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: First, they are not not different from that,

original: de dag ni skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni skyed par byed pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that they are producers of that.

original: de mi rigs pa ni 'bras bu las sngar 'bras bu bzhin du de dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi rigs pa ni 'bras bu las sngar 'bras bu bzhin du de dag kyang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not logical because, like the effect, they do not exist prior to that.

original: yang na yod pa nyid de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na yod pa nyid de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because existence is not different from that, the effect also exists.

original: de ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin te des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin te des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not the effect because it is not something that is benefited by that.

original: de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod rgyal ba nyid yin na yang de dag kyang de la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du 'dod rgyal ba nyid yin na yang de dag kyang de la ltos nas 'bras bu nyid du gyur na /
translated: If it is asserted that that is the effect of that, then even though they are not different from that, they become the effect of that.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de lta bas na don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'i 'byung ba la ltos nas 'byung ba las gyur pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa'i 'byung ba la ltos nas 'byung ba las gyur pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical that the form that is asserted to be derived from the elements in dependence on the elements that are not a different substance is the effect of the elements.

original: 'on te yang skyon 'di spang ba'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba rnams de'i rgyu nyid du rtog par byed na /
analyzed: 'on te yang skyon 'di spang ba'i phyir don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba rnams de'i rgyu nyid du rtog par byed na /
translated: But if you imagine that the elements that are a different substance from form are the cause of form in order to avoid this error,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also illogical.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that they are a different substance.

original: de ma grub pa'i gzugs las rnams par dbye ba med par gnas pa nyid kyi de dag khyed kyis de'i rgyu nyid du khas len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i gzugs las rnams par dbye ba med par gnas pa nyid kyi de dag khyed kyis de'i rgyu nyid du khas len par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that they are the cause of form, which is not established as separate from form and exists as a mere designation.

original: de ltar yang rnam 'grel mdzad pas brten pa'i gzugs rnam par bshad pa na /
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam 'grel mdzad pas brten pa'i gzugs rnam par bshad pa na /
translated: In this way, when the author of the Commentary explains dependent form,

original: de brten sgra yang rgyu don dam //
analyzed: de brten sgra yang rgyu don dam //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSound is also the ultimate cause of that,

original: yang na rang gi rten dang ni //
analyzed: yang na rang gi rten dang ni //
translated: or it is the cause of that,

original: dbyer med par ni gnas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbyer med par ni gnas pa'i phyir //
translated: because it exists inseparably from its basis.‚Äù

original: rten yin gzhan du 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: rten yin gzhan du 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is untenable that they are different.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du de'i rgyur bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du de'i rgyur bshad pa yin no ;
translated: The words ‚Äúit is untenable that they are different‚Äù explain that the primary elements are not different from the derivative form, since the latter is the cause of the former.

original: / don gzhan nyid yin na rnam par dbye ba med par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / don gzhan nyid yin na rnam par dbye ba med par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If they were different, it would be illogical for them to be inseparable,

original: bum pa las snam bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa las snam bu lta bu'o //
translated: like a vase and a woolen cloth.

original: de lta bas na khyed cag gis khas blangs pa kho nas gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba @361a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed cag gis khas blangs pa kho nas gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gzhan du gyur pa'i 'byung ba las kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba @361a * //
translated: Therefore, since they are not established as different by your own admission, it is untenable that derivative form arises from the primary elements that are different from it.

original: 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position.

original: gzhan yang gal te yang 'byung ba las gyur pa la ltos nas 'byung ba rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba med par gnas pa nyid de'i rten nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de yang gzhan phan tshun bdag nyid du grub pa yin
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yang 'byung ba las gyur pa la ltos nas 'byung ba rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba med par gnas pa nyid de'i rten nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de yang gzhan phan tshun bdag nyid du grub pa yin
translated: Moreover, if the primary elements are established as different from each other, it is untenable that they are the basis of derivative form.

original: ni rigs na de nyid kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ni rigs na de nyid kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The passage beginning with

original: gcig las bzhi nyid yod min zhing //
analyzed: gcig las bzhi nyid yod min zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúThe four do not exist in one‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: teaches this.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: gal te gang gi phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa rnam pa bcur khas blangs pa so sor 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe de'i so sor gcig ni de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid nyams shing 'byung ba bzhin du bzhi nyid du 'gyur
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa rnam pa bcur khas blangs pa so sor 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe de'i so sor gcig ni de las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gcig nyid nyams shing 'byung ba bzhin du bzhi nyid du 'gyur
translated: If the ten primary elements are accepted as having the nature of the four primary elements that occur individually, then at that time, since each of them is not different from the four primary elements, the four primary elements would be the four primary elements, and the four primary elements would be one.

original: na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not exist.

original: de yod na ni 'byung ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang lus kyi dbang po'i gzung ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid du dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba nyid med par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: de yod na ni 'byung ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang lus kyi dbang po'i gzung ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa nyid du dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba nyid med par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If it did, then it would follow that the eye and so on and form and so on would be objects of the body sense faculty, like the primary elements. Therefore it is difficult to avoid the consequence that they would be imperceptible, that is, not objects of a different sense faculty.

original: de lta bas na gcig la bzhi nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig la bzhi nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the four do not exist in one.

original: de la 'di snyam du ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin du ma gyur mod /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du ji skad bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir 'byung ba las gyur pa 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin du ma gyur mod /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúBecause the error explained above would ensue, the primary elements do not have the nature of the four primary elements that are derived matter.

original: 'byung ba bzhi po dag ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na skyon ci yang med do sems na /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi po dag ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin na skyon ci yang med do sems na /
translated: But if the four primary elements have the nature of derived matter, there is no error at all,‚Äù

original: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also not correct.üîΩWhy?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because it is said:

original: bzhi la'ang gcig nyid yod min te //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi la'ang gcig nyid yod min te // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four do not have the nature of one.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩgang gi tshe bzhi po dag gis 'byung ba las gyur pa gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe de dag de las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhi nyid nyams shing /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / gang gi tshe bzhi po dag gis 'byung ba las gyur pa gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe de dag de las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzhi nyid nyams shing /
translated: The intended meaning is this:üîΩWhen the four have the nature of one derived matter, then because they are not a different entity from that, the four are impaired and

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du gcig nyid kho nar 'gyur na bzhi po dag la gcig nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du gcig nyid kho nar 'gyur na bzhi po dag la gcig nyid yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: like derived matter, they would be only one. But the four do not have the nature of one.

original: de dag la de yod pa yin na 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa nyid dang / dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba nyid dag tu ci rigs par thal ba'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba nyid med par thal ba lan gdab par mi nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la de yod pa yin na 'byung ba las gyur pa bzhin du dbang po las 'das pa nyid dang / dbang po tha dad pa'i gzung ba nyid dag tu ci rigs par thal ba'i phyir lus kyi dbang pos gzung ba nyid med par thal ba lan gdab par mi nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they existed in those, then like the primary elements, they would be imperceptible by the senses and would be objects apprehended by different senses, as is appropriate. Thus, it would be impossible to respond to the consequence that they would not be apprehended by the body sense faculty.

original: de lta bas na bzhi po dag ni gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bzhi po dag ni gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the four primary elements are not one.

original: de bas na 'di ltar 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag phan tshun de'i bdag nyid du ma grub @361b pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs las rnam par dbye ba med par gnas pa med pa nyid
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa dag phan tshun de'i bdag nyid du ma grub @361b pa'i phyir 'byung ba chen po bzhi po rnams ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs las rnam par dbye ba med par gnas pa med pa nyid
translated: Thus, since the primary elements and derivative form are not established as being the same nature, the four great primary elements do not exist without being differentiated from derivative form.

original: du med pa yin la /
analyzed: du med pa yin la /
translated: They do not exist as many.

original: de dag kyang de lta bur med pa dag la brten nas de rgyu nyid du brten nas 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni ji ltar grub par 'gyur te ji ltar yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang de lta bur med pa dag la brten nas de rgyu nyid du brten nas 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni ji ltar grub par 'gyur te ji ltar yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, since those do not exist in that way, how could form that is derived from the primary elements that are dependent-arisings be established? The meaning is that it is not established in any way.

original: de bas na 'di ltar skye ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / de'i zhar la 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dngos po nyid du bsal ba mdzad nas shes pa'i sgo nas de nyid sel bar byed pa'i phyir shin tu mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar skye ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / de'i zhar la 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo dngos po nyid du bsal ba mdzad nas shes pa'i sgo nas de nyid sel bar byed pa'i phyir shin tu mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, having thus eliminated the nature of the primary elements and that derived from the primary elements in terms of arising, in order to eliminate that in terms of cognition, he says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not apprehended,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbye bas dngos po pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa med ces bya ba yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbye bas dngos po pa'i ngo bor khas blangs pa med ces bya ba yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not possible to designate as existent that which is accepted as the nature of entities by the division of the primary elements and that derived from the primary elements.

original: de la re zhig 'byung ba las gyur pa dbang po'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs yod pa'i tha snyad byar mi rung ba nyid la gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'byung ba las gyur pa dbang po'i bdag nyid kyi gzugs yod pa'i tha snyad byar mi rung ba nyid la gtan tshigs bstan pa ni /
translated: First, the reason is stated for the fact that the conventional expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is not applicable to the form that is the nature of the sense faculties, which are derived from the elements.

original: shin tu mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dzin phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not apprehended at all.‚Äù

original: rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is always hidden.

original: 'dis ni 'di la mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma mi 'jug pa'i ngo bor gtan tshigs nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di la mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma mi 'jug pa'i ngo bor gtan tshigs nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that non-apprehension is the reason for the fact that direct perception is not applicable to this.üîΩBut if you accept that inference is applicable to it, then to anticipate the objection of the opponent,

original: ci ste de la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes khas len pa gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste de la rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes khas len pa gang yin pa de'i 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i phyir /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf you think that it exists because of a reason.‚Äù

original: rtags las shen zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩrtags can gyi don go bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: rtags las shen zhes bya ba smos so // rtags can gyi don go bar byed pa'am /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving a reason‚Äù is understood.üîΩOr, it is a reason because it makes understood, or it makes one understand and comprehend, a hidden object.

original: 'dis lkog tu gyur pa'i don go bar byed cing khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir rtags yin la de las yod ces gal te sems so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis lkog tu gyur pa'i don go bar byed cing khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir rtags yin la de las yod ces gal te sems so zhe na /
translated: If you think that it exists because of that,

original: lan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lan bstan pa ni /
translated: the answer is stated.

original: rtags de yang med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtags de yang med ces bya ba ste /
translated: That reason also does not exist.

original: de med ces bya ba'i tshig sngar don byas zin pa yang grub pa'i mtha'i gzhung 'dir yang blangs te sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de med ces bya ba'i tshig sngar don byas zin pa yang grub pa'i mtha'i gzhung 'dir yang blangs te sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is used in the previous verse, and it is also applied here in the treatise.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i gzugs ni rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas go bar bya ba nyid du 'dod pas dbang po'i blo rtags nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i gzugs ni rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyis 'bras bu ldog pa'i sgo nas go bar bya ba nyid du 'dod pas dbang po'i blo rtags nyid du khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Since the form of the sense faculty is always hidden, it is accepted that the sense faculty is understood by way of the result. Therefore the mind of the sense faculty is accepted as a reason.

original: rtags de yang dbang po yod pa'i dus su ni med la gang gi tshe yang yod pa de'i tshe ni dbang po gzugs med pa yin no /
analyzed: rtags de yang dbang po yod pa'i dus su ni med la gang gi tshe yang yod pa de'i tshe ni dbang po gzugs med pa yin no /
translated: That reason does not exist when the sense faculty exists. When it exists, the sense faculty is formless.

original: 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes phyir te //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes phyir te // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions.

original: 'di skad bstan @362a * //üîΩpa yin te /üîΩdbang po yod pa'i go byed nyid du 'dod pa'i dbang po'i blo rang dbang can yin nam /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan @362a * // pa yin te / dbang po yod pa'i go byed nyid du 'dod pa'i dbang po'i blo rang dbang can yin nam /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gzhan dbang can yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan dbang can yin grang na /
translated: Is the mind of the sense faculty, which is asserted to be the reason for the existence of the sense faculty, independent or dependent?

original: re zhig rang dbang can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rang dbang can ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not independent for a time,

original: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir te /
