analyzed: res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is intermittent.

original: de dang 'brel pa med pas rtags nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa med pas rtags nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not related to that, it is not reasonable as a reason, and it is not accepted.

original: 'on te rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yin na de'i tshe dbang po la yang bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyis de la rgyu nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang rkyen la rag las te skye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan dbang yin na de'i tshe dbang po la yang bdag po'i rkyen nyid kyis de la rgyu nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur na /
translated: But if it is dependent on causes and conditions, and it is produced, then it is other-powered. In that case, since the sense faculty is the dominant condition, it is accepted as the cause.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid ni de dag bskyed bya dang skyed byed nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid ni de dag bskyed bya dang skyed byed nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: But they are not simultaneous, and they are not the producer and the produced.

original: de'i phyir rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dbang po yod pa'i dus su blo zhes bya ba'i rtags de med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyur mngon bar 'dod pa'i dbang po yod pa'i dus su blo zhes bya ba'i rtags de med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the sense faculty, which is accepted as the cause, exists, the so-called cognition does not exist.

original: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the error in that?

original: yod la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: yod la'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that the existent is a reason for the existent.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i gzugs yod cing bdog pa la med cing mi bdog pa ni rtags su yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzugs yod cing bdog pa la med cing mi bdog pa ni rtags su yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the existent form of the sense faculty is a reason for the nonexistent cognition.

original: gang zhig ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba de ni mi grub po zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: gang zhig ma grub pas bsgrub par bya ba de ni mi grub po zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: That which is not established is not established by that which is to be established.

original: de lta bas na dbang po'i gzugs rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba yang ma yin la tshad ma gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ji ltar na yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbang po'i gzugs rjes su dpag pas go bar bya ba yang ma yin la tshad ma gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ji ltar na yod pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin //
translated: Thus, the form of the sense faculty is not understood by inference, and since there is no other valid cognition, how can it be suitable to make the conventional designation ‚Äúexists‚Äù?üîΩSince this shows that it is impossible for there to be a valid cognition that establishes the form of the sense faculty that is derived from the elements, it shows that it is not suitable to make the conventional designation ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbang po'i gzugs la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mi srid par bstan pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byar mi rung bar bstan nas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbang po'i gzugs la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma mi srid par bstan pas yod pa'i tha snyad du byar mi rung bar bstan nas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi /
translated: The form of the object, which is of the nature of the elements and that derived from the elements,

original: yul gyi gzugs la'ang gang du med //
analyzed: yul gyi gzugs la'ang gang du med //
translated: does not exist in any of them.

original: ces bya bas dam bcas pa de bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ces bya bas dam bcas pa de bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: gal te blo gzugs 'dzin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te blo gzugs 'dzin gyur na //
translated: If the mind were to apprehend form,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: gal te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yul du gyur pa'i gzugs 'dzin par gyur na ste /
analyzed: gal te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yul du gyur pa'i gzugs 'dzin par gyur na ste /
translated: If the mind that arises from the sense faculty were to apprehend form that is the object,

original: mngon sum du gyur na zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan dag la grags pa'i mngon sum gyis gzugs 'dzin pa nyid rjes su brjod nas sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur na zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan dag la grags pa'i mngon sum gyis gzugs 'dzin pa nyid rjes su brjod nas sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase if it were directly perceived indicates that, having restated the direct perception that is renowned to others, he will refute it.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase by me and so on indicates that.

original: bdag gi rang bzhin nyid rang gi ngo bo kho na blos 'dzin par 'gyur te mngon sum du byed kyi yul gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin nyid rang gi ngo bo kho na blos 'dzin par 'gyur te mngon sum du byed kyi yul gyi ngo bo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the nature of the self means the essence of the self. The phrase is apprehended by the mind means is directly perceived. The phrase not the nature of the object means that.

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir yul kho na mngon sum du gzung bar bya ba nyid du dam bca' bar byed pa gang @362b yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar don dang shes pa dag la dus mnyam pa nyid du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por mngon par 'dod
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te / gang gi phyir yul kho na mngon sum du gzung bar bya ba nyid du dam bca' bar byed pa gang @362b yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar don dang shes pa dag la dus mnyam pa nyid du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por mngon par 'dod
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.üîΩBecause the object alone is asserted to be the object that is directly perceived, one must accept that the object and consciousness are apprehended as the entity of subject and object at the same time.

original: pa yin la 'di ni phan gdags par bya ba dang // phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa yin la 'di ni phan gdags par bya ba dang // phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyis rgyu mtshan can yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not reasonable because of the fault that the object and consciousness would be different from each other, and because the object and consciousness are not the basis of the relation of the supported and the supporter.

original: dus gcig dag la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig dag la de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for them to exist at the same time.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis 'di ma nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis 'di ma nges pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they are simply inconclusive.

original: gal te rang gi rigs su skyes pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rigs su skyes pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not so, because they are born in their own class,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin na rang gi rigs su skyes pa nyid du brjod par rigs na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gnas pa yin na rang gi rigs su skyes pa nyid du brjod par rigs na /
translated: If they were to exist in that way, it would be reasonable to say that they are born in their own class,

original: rnam par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa nyid kyang ma yin te rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but they do not exist in that way, because there is no reason for them to do so.

original: gal te so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir yul gzugs kho na bzung ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir yul gzugs kho na bzung ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is only form that is apprehended as an object because it appears individually,

original: de'i tshe shes pa yang so sor snang ba nyid yin pas de yang bzung ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa yang so sor snang ba nyid yin pas de yang bzung ba nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then consciousness also appears individually, so it follows that it is also apprehended.

original: nang dang phyi'i ngo bo nyid rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par de dag la yod pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i ngo bo nyid rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par de dag la yod pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is like the internal and external natures that exist in those specific causes,

original: de ni ma bstan pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma bstan pa dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: that is similar to not having taught anything,

original: gzugs brnyan snang bas 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang bas 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to be mistaken about the appearance of a reflection.

original: 'on te shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe so sor snang ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe so sor snang ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: But if consciousness is hidden, then at that time it does not appear to itself.

original: don gsal bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gsal bas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is inferred from the clarity of the object.

original: 'o na ni gsal ba de shes pas bskyed pa yul gyi rang gi chos yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal ba de shes pas bskyed pa yul gyi rang gi chos yin te /
translated: But if the clarity of the object is produced by consciousness, it is a property of the object itself.

original: 'di ni ma rtogs par grub pa'am shes pa yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ma rtogs par grub pa'am shes pa yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a proof of the existence of consciousness, because it is not established without consciousness.

original: rtogs pa yang shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa yang shes pa de nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: And it is not understood by that consciousness itself,

original: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rang nyid ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo de ni 'di la rtogs par byed pa po nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas rang nyid ma rtogs pa'i ngo bo de ni 'di la rtogs par byed pa po nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that the nature of something that is not apprehended as distinct can be understood as distinct.

original: de nyid las de rtogs na phan tshun brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las de rtogs na phan tshun brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were understood by that consciousness itself, there would be mutual dependence.

original: shes pa gzhan la rag las nas grub pa nyid yin na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan la rag las nas grub pa nyid yin na yang thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if it were established in dependence on another consciousness, there would be an infinite regress.

original: des na 'dir rig pa kho nar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir rig pa kho nar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here, it should be accepted that only cognition exists.

original: de ltar na yang shes pa ni de mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang shes pa ni de mi 'dzin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it follows that cognition does not apprehend itself.

original: 'on te 'di ni shes pa nyid kyi chos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni shes pa nyid kyi chos yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this is a property of cognition,

original: 'o na ni 'di shes pa bzhin du nyams su myong bar bya ba mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di shes pa bzhin du nyams su myong bar bya ba mi 'gyur la /
translated: then it would not be experienced like cognition.

original: de nyams su ma myong yang don kyang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur bas 'gro ba ma lus pa @363a * //
analyzed: de nyams su ma myong yang don kyang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur bas 'gro ba ma lus pa @363a * //
translated: And if it is not experienced, then the object would not be experienced, and the entire world

original: long pa nyid du 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: long pa nyid du 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: would be blind.

original: de lta bas na shes pa ni lkog tu gyur par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa ni lkog tu gyur par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, cognition should not be accepted as hidden.

original: lkog gyur ma yin pa nyid na de yang so sor snang ba nyid yin pas de ni bzung ba nyid du thal bas bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog gyur ma yin pa nyid na de yang so sor snang ba nyid yin pas de ni bzung ba nyid du thal bas bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If it is not hidden, then it appears individually, and it follows that it is apprehended. Therefore, it cannot be refuted.

original: 'on te de yang shes pa la so sor snang ba yod na yang gzung bar bya ba nyid med pa ni yul la yang de med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te de yang shes pa la so sor snang ba yod na yang gzung bar bya ba nyid med pa ni yul la yang de med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is said that even though it appears individually to cognition, it is not apprehended, then that would also be the case for objects.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid med na yang gang zhig so sor snang ba de ni shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid med na yang gang zhig so sor snang ba de ni shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even if there is no object to be apprehended, that which appears separately is consciousness itself,

original: bde ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like pleasure and so on.

original: de'i phyir yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni shes pa'i bdag nyid rnams kho na yin pas shes pa'i bdag nyid las gzhan ni nam yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang sngon po la sogs pa rnams ni shes pa'i bdag nyid rnams kho na yin pas shes pa'i bdag nyid las gzhan ni nam yang mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to explain that since blue and so on are only of the nature of consciousness, they are never apprehended as other than the nature of consciousness.

original: blo bdag rang bzhin nyid 'dzin 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bar bstan pa ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: blo bdag rang bzhin nyid 'dzin 'gyur // zhes bya bar bstan pa ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: The mind would apprehend its own nature.

original: de bas na 'di ltar yul gzugs kyi yod pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la mi dmigs pa mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i ngo bo bstan nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar yul gzugs kyi yod pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa la mi dmigs pa mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i ngo bo bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated that non-apprehension, which is a means of valid cognition that refutes the existence of the object form, does not engage in the nature of non-existence,

original: da rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i ngo bor yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i ngo bor yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that inference also does not engage in the nature of non-existence,

original: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúNon-existence is not an object of inference,‚Äù and so on.

original: mdo sde pa dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir shes pa dang dus mnyam pa'i don so sor snang ba nyid gzung bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag ni ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir shes pa dang dus mnyam pa'i don so sor snang ba nyid gzung bar bya ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: SautrƒÅntikas: Because of the logical faults just explained, the object that appears to a consciousness at the same time as the consciousness is not the object that is apprehended.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: 'dra ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is the object that generates a consciousness that is similar to it.

original: 'di ltar shes pa nye bar skye ba na rnam pa med par skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa nye bar skye ba na rnam pa med par skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, when a consciousness arises, it does not arise without a form.

original: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la de'i rnam pa nyid du med pa yin na nyams su myong ba med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa rnams la de'i rnam pa nyid du med pa yin na nyams su myong ba med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If blue and so on did not exist as the form of the object, it would follow that they would not be experienced.

original: nyams su myong ba ni shes pa chos yin la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni shes pa chos yin la /
translated: Experience is a quality of consciousness.

original: shes pa yang don las don gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yang don las don gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: And consciousness is different from the object.

original: gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyi yin pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyi yin pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical for the quality of one thing to belong to another,

original: sgron ma gsal ba'i mun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgron ma gsal ba'i mun pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the darkness of a lamp.

original: de lta bas na shes pa nyid rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa nyid rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore consciousness itself has a form.

original: de yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang res 'ga' ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu mtshan la ltos pa yin la /
translated: Since it is sometimes the case, it depends on a concordant reason.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rnams ni de la rjes su mthun pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rnams ni de la rjes su mthun pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: But the sense faculties and so on are not concordant with it,

original: thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are common to all.

original: de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa gtod par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyi rol te rtag tu lkog tu gyur @363b pa yin yang rgyu nyid yin pa nyid kyis shes pa'i gzung bar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yinüîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa gtod par byed pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni phyi rol te rtag tu lkog tu gyur @363b pa yin yang rgyu nyid yin pa nyid kyis shes pa'i gzung bar kho bo cag gi 'dod pa yin zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, we assert that the external object, which is the cause of such an aspect that casts the aspect of consciousness, is the object of consciousness, even though it is always hidden, because it is the cause.

original: de ltar smra ba de dag gis don 'di blo'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ldog pas khong du chud pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya bar khas blangs par 'gyur na de de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa
analyzed: de ltar smra ba de dag gis don 'di blo'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu ldog pas khong du chud pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid du rjes su dpag pas gzung bar bya bar khas blangs par 'gyur na de de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa
translated: Those who speak in that way, by the reversal of the effect of the characteristic of consciousness, understand this point and assert that it is apprehended by inference in reality.

original: bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa ni /
translated: We demonstrate that this is illogical:

original: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nonexistent is not a cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du gyur pa don dang blo'i skad cig dag ni dus tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩgang gi tshe don yod pa de'i tshe blo med pa yin la med pa de yang gzugs ni ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur la zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du gyur pa don dang blo'i skad cig dag ni dus tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir / gang gi tshe don yod pa de'i tshe blo med pa yin la med pa de yang gzugs ni ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur la zhes sbyar te /
translated: Because the momentary object and cognition that are cause and effect are different in time.üîΩWhen the object exists, the cognition does not exist, and when the cognition exists, the object does not exist.

original: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: How can the nonexistent object be apprehended?

original: / yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las skyes pa ste grub pa'i blo de'i tshe shugs kyis de yod pa yin yang 'gags pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen las skyes pa ste grub pa'i blo de'i tshe shugs kyis de yod pa yin yang 'gags pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs med ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, when the cognition arises from the conditions such as the object, that is, when the cognition is established, then by implication it exists. But how can the nonexistent object be apprehended, because it has ceased?

original: ji ltar yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could it be apprehended at all?

original: de bas na 'di ltar yul gzugs yod pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i ngo bo bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar yul gzugs yod pa dgag pa sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug pa'i ngo bo bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of the object, form, is established by the nonapprehension that is a proof.

original: de lta bas na shes pa'i sgo nas kyang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa'i sgo nas kyang 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i ngo bo'i gzugs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even from the perspective of cognition, form that is the nature of the elements and that which is derived from the elements is not established.

original: de gzugs mdor bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po'i ni gtam tsam nyid du lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gzugs mdor bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi phung po'i ni gtam tsam nyid du lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could the form aggregate be merely a collection of forms?

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par 'jog par byed pa dag na gzugs gang ci yang rung 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po rnam par 'jog par byed pa dag na gzugs gang ci yang rung 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: In the presentation of the form aggregate, whatever form there is‚Äîwhether past, future, or present;

original: nang ngam phyi'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: nang ngam phyi'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: whether internal or external;

original: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: rags pa'am / phra ba'am /
translated: whether gross or subtle;

original: dman pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
analyzed: dman pa'am / gya nom pa'am /
translated: whether inferior or exalted;

original: rgyang ring po gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: rgyang ring po gang yin pa'am /
translated: whether far or near‚Äî

original: thag nye ba gang yin pa de thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes de ltar gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: thag nye ba gang yin pa de thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes de ltar gdon par bya'o //
translated: all of that is subsumed into one and is counted as the form aggregate.

original: de la 'das pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi dbye ba rnams tshad mas rtogs pa yin na ni de mdor bsdus pa la phung po rnam par gzhag pa rigs na de nyid kyang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang tshe skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de la 'das pa la sogs pa gzugs kyi dbye ba rnams tshad mas rtogs pa yin na ni de mdor bsdus pa la phung po rnam par gzhag pa rigs na de nyid kyang med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang tshe skad cig ces bya ba la sogs pa
translated: If the categories of form such as the past are realized by valid knowledge, then it is logical to posit the aggregates as a summary of those.

original: smos so // yang gang gi tshe de ltar lta ba gnyis kyi skad cig pa blo ni gzugs skyes te da ltar ba skad cig ma mi 'dzin to zhes bshad pa ste /üîΩrab tu bstan pa de'i tshe @364a * //
analyzed: smos so // yang gang gi tshe de ltar lta ba gnyis kyi skad cig pa blo ni gzugs skyes te da ltar ba skad cig ma mi 'dzin to zhes bshad pa ste / rab tu bstan pa de'i tshe @364a * //
translated: But since they do not exist, the text says, ‚ÄúWhen the mind apprehending momentary form does not apprehend it,‚Äù and so on.üîΩWhen the mind apprehending momentary form does not apprehend it,üîΩat that time how could that mind apprehending momentary form

original: skad cig pa'i blo de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rtogs par ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i blo de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs rtogs par ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: realize past and future form?

original: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It could not!

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gang gi phyir gang la gzugs da ltar ba blo la nye ba nyid du khyed kyis khas blangs kyang yul du 'gro ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la gzugs da ltar ba blo la nye ba nyid du khyed kyis khas blangs kyang yul du 'gro ba ma yin na /
translated: Since you assert that present form is not an object of the mind that is proximate to it,

original: de las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa bskal pa dag gi gtam du brjod pa ltag la yod /
analyzed: de las 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa bskal pa dag gi gtam du brjod pa ltag la yod /
translated: and beyond that, the stories of past and future eons.

original: 'di yang 'di las gzhan pa'i dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa gtsor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang 'di las gzhan pa'i dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir nye bar mtshon pa gtsor bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no other classification than this, the primary teaching is the illustration.

original: de lta bas na dbye ba rnams ma rtogs pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po ma grub pa yin no //üîΩda ni gzugs kyi phung po'i nang du ma gtogs pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa dang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdul bya'i skye bo'i bye brag gi ngor skye mched nyid du bstan pa dag la gang dag de kho na nyid
analyzed: de lta bas na dbye ba rnams ma rtogs pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po ma grub pa yin no // da ni gzugs kyi phung po'i nang du ma gtogs pa nang gi bdag nyid kyi mig la sogs pa dang phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa rnams gdul bya'i skye bo'i bye brag gi ngor skye mched nyid du bstan pa dag la gang dag de kho na nyid
translated: Therefore, because the classifications are not understood, the form aggregate is not established.

original: du zhen par byed pa de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched gnyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas skye mched thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: du zhen par byed pa de spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched gnyis rnam par dpyad pa'i sgo nas skye mched thams cad rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to abandon the attachment to reality of those who conceive of the internal nature of the eyes and so on, which are not included in the form aggregate, and external forms and so on, which are taught to be the sense bases from the perspective of the different types of trainees, the sense bases are analyzed in terms of the eyes and forms. In order to teach that all the sense bases are empty of intrinsic existence,üîΩthe root verse states:

original: gang tshe nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang tshe nam yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The verse ‚ÄúNever‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: 'dis ni gzugs kyi skye mched la kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas gzugs rnam gnyis te zhes bya ba'i tshig gi dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa dang shes pa'i rim pa dag gis ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzugs kyi skye mched la kha dog dang dbyibs kyi dbye bas gzugs rnam gnyis te zhes bya ba'i tshig gi dbye ba bstan pa gang yin pa de ni grub pa dang shes pa'i rim pa dag gis ma grub par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This demonstrates that the statement ‚ÄúThe form base is twofold, because of the classification of color and shape‚Äù is not established by the order of establishment and cognition.

original: nam yang kha dog dbyibs de dag dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad pa'i dbye bas yod cing bdog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang kha dog dbyibs de dag dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa bzhin du tha dad pa'i dbye bas yod cing bdog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Never‚Äù means that those colors and shapes are not existent and possessed as different classifications, like blue, yellow, and so on.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs de gnyis tha dad pa 'dzin pa ste shes pa gzung ba yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs de gnyis tha dad pa 'dzin pa ste shes pa gzung ba yang med pa yin no //
translated: Also, the cognition apprehending those two, color and shape, as different is not existent.

original: gang la yang tha dad par yod pa'am sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yin pa de dag ji ltar dngos po pa nyid du khas blang bar 'os pa dag yin /
analyzed: gang la yang tha dad par yod pa'am sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yin pa de dag ji ltar dngos po pa nyid du khas blang bar 'os pa dag yin /
translated: How could those that are existent or established as different be suitable to be accepted as real things?

original: 'o na ni gzugs de rnam pa gcig pur yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs de rnam pa gcig pur yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Well then, that form exists as a single aspect?

original: gzugs de'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzugs de'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThat form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir grag ces bya ba ni lung mtshon par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir grag ces bya ba ni lung mtshon par byed pa'i don to //
translated: Here, ‚Äúit is said‚Äù indicates the meaning of revealing scripture.

original: des na don 'di yin te gzugs de gcig pu ste /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te gzugs de gcig pu ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: That form, etc., is not established as a single thing,

original: rnam pa gcig nyid du grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig nyid du grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: as a single aspect, in the tenets of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: de bas na ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir @364b gzugs kyi skye mched med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar khas blangs pa bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir @364b gzugs kyi skye mched med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not established as it is accepted, the sense sphere of form does not exist.

original: 'o na ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ji ltar drang bar bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' ji ltar drang bar bya /
translated: But how can you interpret the tenet that visual consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and form?

original: gang gi phyir med pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rten yin par brjod par rigs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gi rten yin par brjod par rigs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: For it is not reasonable to say that something nonexistent is the basis of something else.

original: 'di yang snying po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di yang snying po med pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is also pointless, as is explained in the following:

original: mig blo mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig blo mig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness is not in the eye, etc.

original: gang gi phyir skye mched ces bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas te skye ba mched par byed pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye mched ces bya ba ni skye ba'i gnas te skye ba mched par byed pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúsense base‚Äù is the abode of arising, since it is the cause of the arising of consciousness.

original: de yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa las lhag ma ni ma yin no //üîΩskyed par byed pa yang yul mtshungs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu skyed par byed pa las lhag ma ni ma yin no // skyed par byed pa yang yul mtshungs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, it is not the remainder of the cause of the arising of the effect.üîΩThe cause of arising is either the effect of the same object or the effect of a different object.

original: yul mi mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu la yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
analyzed: yul mi mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu la yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible in any other way.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mig dang gzugs dag las skye mched nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mig dang gzugs dag las skye mched nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that the eye and form are sense bases in either way.

original: 'di ltar / mig blo mig la 'byung min te //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig blo mig la 'byung min te //
translated: Thus: The eye consciousness does not arise from the eye,üîΩnor does it arise from form.

original: gzugs la 'byung min zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid du de med par bstan te /
analyzed: gzugs la 'byung min zhes bya ba 'dis ni yul mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid du de med par bstan te /
translated: By this statement, it is shown that it does not exist as the cause of the effect of the same object.

original: bar na med ces bya ba 'dis ni yul mi mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: bar na med ces bya ba 'dis ni yul mi mtshungs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: By ‚Äúnor in between,‚Äù it is shown that it does not exist as the cause of the effect of a different object.

original: de'i yul nyid dang de ma yin pa'i yul nyid du de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yul nyid dang de ma yin pa'i yul nyid du de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not perceived as the object of that or as the nonobject of that.

original: des na yang blo skye mched gnyi ga las skye ba nyid du yongs su brtags pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na yang blo skye mched gnyi ga las skye ba nyid du yongs su brtags pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the examination of the visual faculty as arising from both itself and something else is itself mistaken.

original: de ni mig dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mig dang gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúThe eye and visible forms, etc.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dag la skye mched nyid yin pa bsal nas mtshan nyid las kyang gsal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar mig dang gzugs dag la skye mched nyid yin pa bsal nas mtshan nyid las kyang gsal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, having refuted the status of the eye and visible forms as sense-spheres, the Master now clarifies this point by means of their characteristics.

original: gal te mig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúIf the eye sees, etc.‚Äù

original: lta ba po dang blta bar bya ba nyid ni mig dang gzugs dag gi mtshan nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: lta ba po dang blta bar bya ba nyid ni mig dang gzugs dag gi mtshan nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The eye and visible forms are asserted to be the characteristics of the seer and the seen, respectively.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong brten bcas //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong brten bcas //
translated: The eye sees visible forms in dependence.

original: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //üîΩgang phyir rab tu chod pa yi //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min // gang phyir rab tu chod pa yi //
translated: The consciousness dependent on it does not.

original: gzugs ni mthong ba yin phyir ro //üîΩzhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni mthong ba yin phyir ro // zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Because a visible form is seen even when obstructed.

original: 'di yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: This is untenable.

original: 'di ltar dngos po nyid du khas blang bar bya ba mig bdag kyang mthong ngam ma mthong /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po nyid du khas blang bar bya ba mig bdag kyang mthong ngam ma mthong /
translated: Thus, is the eye, which is accepted as a real entity, a seer or not?

original: gal te des bdag nyid mi mthong na gzugs de mthong bar ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te des bdag nyid mi mthong na gzugs de mthong bar ni ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not see itself, how could it see that visible form?

original: des zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /üîΩblta ba'i bya ba de ni mig gi chos @365a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te / blta ba'i bya ba de ni mig gi chos @365a * //
translated: This is the explanation:

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: The activity of seeing is not the nature of the eye.

original: de'i chos nyid yin na ni de'i bdag nyid gdon mi za bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i chos nyid yin na ni de'i bdag nyid gdon mi za bar mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the nature of the eye, it would certainly see itself.

original: gang gi phyir chos de dag gi ma yin pa de yang gang gi dbang gis gang la mthong du rung ba de la 'di dngos su gang gi chos yin pa de'i ma mthong ba la gtam du brjod pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos de dag gi ma yin pa de yang gang gi dbang gis gang la mthong du rung ba de la 'di dngos su gang gi chos yin pa de'i ma mthong ba la gtam du brjod pa lta ga la yod /
translated: But since it is not the nature of those things, how could it be said that it is the nature of that which is suitable to see, when it does not see itself?

original: de ni de'i chos nyid du ma yin yang mthong du rung ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i chos nyid du ma yin yang mthong du rung ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though it is not the nature of that, it would be accepted as the nature of what is suitable to see.

original: de nyan pa po la sogs pa bzhin du mig ni blta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir lta ba po med pa nyid yin pas mig mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de nyan pa po la sogs pa bzhin du mig ni blta ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir lta ba po med pa nyid yin pas mig mtshan nyid stong pa nyid yin na /
translated: But the eye is not a seer, because it is devoid of the activity of seeing, like a listener, etc. If the eye is empty of the characteristic of the eye,

original: de'i mtshan nyid la rag las pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs kyang mtshan nyid med pa nyid do zhes don gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid la rag las pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzugs kyang mtshan nyid med pa nyid do zhes don gyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the meaning that is taught.

original: 'di nyid nye bar sdud par byed pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid nye bar sdud par byed pa ni //
translated: This is the summary:

original: de phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med // ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the eye and form are selfless.

original: bdag med ces bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba ni rang bzhin dang bcas pa ma yin te /
translated: Selfless means not having a self-nature.

original: dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not a non-existent thing.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid gzhan la bsgre bar bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩskye mched lhag ma la yang de dang 'dra //
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid gzhan la bsgre bar bstan pa'i phyir / skye mched lhag ma la yang de dang 'dra //
translated: In order to teach that this very reasoning is to be applied to the others,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said: The remaining sense bases are also like that.

original: rigs pa gang kho nas mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched rang bzhin med par bstan pa de nyid kyis skye mched lhag ma rna ba dang sgra la sogs pa rang bzhin med par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa gang kho nas mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched rang bzhin med par bstan pa de nyid kyis skye mched lhag ma rna ba dang sgra la sogs pa rang bzhin med par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: By whatever reasoning the sense base of the eye and the sense base of form are shown to be essenceless, by that very same reasoning the remaining sense bases such as the ear and sound should be understood to be essenceless.

original: de bas na 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i skye mched thams cad dag ni rang bzhin du stong pa nyid bstan du zin kyang brgya la gzhan 'ga' zhig de dag la gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ba de dag
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar mig la sogs pa'i skye mched thams cad dag ni rang bzhin du stong pa nyid bstan du zin kyang brgya la gzhan 'ga' zhig de dag la gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ba de dag
translated: Therefore, although the emptiness of intrinsic reality of all the bases such as the eyes, etc. has been taught, if someone were to suspect that they have intrinsic reality by way of another,

original: de'i dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir bstan pa ni /
translated: in order to eliminate that suspicion, the teaching is:

original: mig ni rang bzhin nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: mig ni rang bzhin nyid kyis stong //
translated: The eye is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩde dag la gzhan gang gis bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ba des mtshan nyid dang ldan par yang bya dgos la mtshan nyid de yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas de la yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyang stong
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / de dag la gzhan gang gis bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa nyid du dogs par 'gyur ba des mtshan nyid dang ldan par yang bya dgos la mtshan nyid de yang sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas de la yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyang stong
translated: The intention is this:

original: pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa nyid do //
translated: If one suspects that they have intrinsic reality by way of another, then one must also have a characteristic. But since that characteristic is also untenable in that regard by the reasoning taught previously, its intrinsic reality is also empty.

original: de bas na 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po dang de'i nang du gtogs pa'i nang dang phyi'i @365b skye mched dag la rang bzhin stong pa nyid du yongs su dpyad pa dag ni de'i bdag nyid kyi lus rtag par phyin ci log par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yangüîΩyongs su dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po dang de'i nang du gtogs pa'i nang dang phyi'i @365b skye mched dag la rang bzhin stong pa nyid du yongs su dpyad pa dag ni de'i bdag nyid kyi lus rtag par phyin ci log par 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang yongs su dpyod pa yin no //
translated: is also a thorough analysis of the reason for engaging in the misconception of permanence with regard to the body that is of their nature.

original: da ni bde ba'i phyin ci log pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tshor ba'i phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du de'i rgyu reg pa med par bstan pa'i sgo nas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bde ba'i phyin ci log pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tshor ba'i phung po rang bzhin med pa nyid du de'i rgyu reg pa med par bstan pa'i sgo nas nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the aggregate of feeling, the reason for engaging in the misconception of pleasure, is devoid of intrinsic reality, he teaches this by way of showing that the cause of that, contact, does not exist.

original: 'phags pa gnyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnyis bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the noble ones

original: gang tshe gcig reg lhan cig 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe gcig reg lhan cig 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is that when one is touched, it arises together.

original: gang nyan thos dag gis tshor ba dngos po la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas len par byed do //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dag gis tshor ba dngos po la rang bzhin yod pa nyid du khas len par byed do //
translated: The hearers accept that feeling exists as a thing with intrinsic reality.

original: de yang rkyen med na mi rigs pas reg pa yang de'i rgyu nyid du de dag gis khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rkyen med na mi rigs pas reg pa yang de'i rgyu nyid du de dag gis khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Since it is illogical that it would exist without conditions, contact is also accepted by them as its cause.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Feeling is conditioned by contact.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'di ltar 'di 'dis reg par byed pas reg pa zhes bya ba byed pas reg pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo yin nam reg pas reg pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo grang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di 'dis reg par byed pas reg pa zhes bya ba byed pas reg pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i ngo bo yin nam reg pas reg pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo grang /
translated: Thus, if contact is the nature of activity, it is called contact because it contacts through this, or it is called contact because it has the nature of contact.

original: de la re zhig 'di byed pa po'i ngo bor rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'di byed pa po'i ngo bor rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not logical that it is the nature of an agent,

original: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yul dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsum pa 'di ni 'di la byed pa po dag yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po dang yul dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsum pa 'di ni 'di la byed pa po dag yin te /
translated: because these three‚Äîthe faculty, the object, and the consciousness‚Äîare the agents in this case.

original: de dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag yin no //
translated: And they are not the uncommon nature of contact.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe byed pa po gcig dper na mig reg pa gang reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i bdag nyid la nye bar gyur pa'i ngo bo dang lhan cig par gyur cing 'brel pa'i tshe yang gzugs la sogs pa gzhan
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe byed pa po gcig dper na mig reg pa gang reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i bdag nyid la nye bar gyur pa'i ngo bo dang lhan cig par gyur cing 'brel pa'i tshe yang gzugs la sogs pa gzhan
translated: Therefore, when the single agent, for example, the eye that is in contact with the object, is the one that performs the action of contact, at that time, the other things such as form

original: rnams stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rnams stong pa yin te /
translated: are empty.

original: de zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the remaining things.

original: gzhan yang gal te skabs su bab pa gsum po 'di la sngar gcig bstan pa ni lhag mar gyur pa gzhan dag stong pa yin zhes bstan par rigs pa de lta na yang de las gzhan gsum po rnams rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te skabs su bab pa gsum po 'di la sngar gcig bstan pa ni lhag mar gyur pa gzhan dag stong pa yin zhes bstan par rigs pa de lta na yang de las gzhan gsum po rnams rigs pa mtshungs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir
translated: Moreover, if it is logical to teach that the one thing that is present in the three parts is empty of the other remaining things, then the other three parts are also taught to be similar to that.

original: / de la ltos nas gsal ba mang po nyid kyis gzhan rnams stong pa yin /
analyzed: / de la ltos nas gsal ba mang po nyid kyis gzhan rnams stong pa yin /
translated: In that case, the many things that are dependent on that are empty of other things.

original: de'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu bstan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to teach that the many things are empty.

original: gang yang gzhan dag la reg pa des stong zhing bral ba'i ngo bo de ni nam yang mi stong pa nyid de ldan pa nyid mi bsten pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzhan dag la reg pa des stong zhing bral ba'i ngo bo de ni nam yang mi stong pa nyid de ldan pa nyid mi bsten pa yin no //
translated: That which is empty of contact with something else, and whose nature is devoid of contact, is never empty of the entity itself, which is not to be relinquished.

original: gang zhig des mi stong pa ni stong pa @366a * //
analyzed: gang zhig des mi stong pa ni stong pa @366a * //
translated: That which is not empty of that is emptiness.

original: nyid de bstan pa ni dngos po nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyid de bstan pa ni dngos po nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The entity itself is primary,

original: bsten pa min zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsten pa min zhes sbyar ro //
translated: and it is not to be relinquished.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo ni gsal ba so so tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin la /
analyzed: reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa nyid du gyur pa'i ngo bo ni gsal ba so so tha dad pa nyid yin pa'i phyir du ma nyid yin la /
translated: The nature of the entity that is the agent of the action of contact is manifold, because it is the individual manifestation of each.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen reg pa ni du ma'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen reg pa ni du ma'i bdag nyid du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the contact that is the condition of sensation is not accepted as having a manifold nature.

original: de lta bas na reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i reg pa ni med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na reg pa'i bya ba sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i reg pa ni med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the contact that is the agent of the action of contact does not exist.

original: 'di bya ba'i ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di bya ba'i ngo bor yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: It is also unreasonable to consider it as the action itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo gnas med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gnas med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is demonstrated by the passage beginning with ‚Äúbecause it does not endure in its own nature.‚Äù

original: 'du ba ni 'dus shing reg pa ste /
analyzed: 'du ba ni 'dus shing reg pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúContact‚Äù is the coming together of the three.

original: de yang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa rnams nyid la rigs kyis med pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa rnams nyid la rigs kyis med pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it exists only when the sense faculties and so on exist, not when they do not exist.

original: 'di dag yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they do not exist.

original: rang gi ngo bo gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their intrinsic reality does not endure.

original: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa bzhin 'di dag la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du nges par gnas pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rnam par dpyad pa bzhin 'di dag la 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid du nges par gnas pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because, as has been previously explained, when analyzed by reasoning, they do not have an intrinsic reality that definitely endures as the elements or the element-derivatives.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po la sogs pa gsum po rnams la bya ba'i ngo bo'i rigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dbang po la sogs pa gsum po rnams la bya ba'i ngo bo'i rigs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the three‚Äîthe sense faculties and so on‚Äîdo not have a nature that is a function.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med pas tshor ba yang yod pa ma yin na de'i phung po yod par 'gyur ba lta ga la yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med pas tshor ba yang yod pa ma yin na de'i phung po yod par 'gyur ba lta ga la yin /
translated: Since they do not have a cause, feeling also does not exist. How could its aggregates exist?

original: da ni bdag tu phyin ci log 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par shes pa'i phung po gzhan gsal bar 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bdag tu phyin ci log 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan rnam par shes pa'i phung po gzhan gsal bar 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the other aggregates, which are the causes for the engagement of error in self, he says:

original: nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa'o //
translated: The internal and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir nang mig la sogs pa dang / phyi gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nang mig la sogs pa dang / phyi gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched la brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de skye ba'o //
translated: Because consciousness arises in dependence upon the internal, such as the eyes, and the external, such as forms, it is born.

original: de lta bas na rnam shes med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam shes med do //
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not exist.

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist intrinsically.

original: de'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i skye mched gnyis po 'di nyid sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o /
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i skye mched gnyis po 'di nyid sngar bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o /
translated: The two bases, which are accepted as its causes, do not exist intrinsically, because of the reasoning explained earlier.

original: // 'o na ji ltar de med kyang snang zhe na /
analyzed: // 'o na ji ltar de med kyang snang zhe na /
translated: Well then, if it does not exist, how does it appear?

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Mirage and so forth.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu bye ma dang 'brel ba nyid kyis nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams dang / nor bu dang sngags dang sman la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba shing bu dang 'jim dum la sogs pa sgyu ma'i bdag nyid rnams ni @366b brdzun pa'i rnam pa chu dang glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ste 'on kyang ji ltar
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu bye ma dang 'brel ba nyid kyis nyi ma'i 'od zer rnams dang / nor bu dang sngags dang sman la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su gzung ba shing bu dang 'jim dum la sogs pa sgyu ma'i bdag nyid rnams ni @366b brdzun pa'i rnam pa chu dang glang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid du snang ste 'on kyang ji ltar
translated: Just as a mirage is related to the sun‚Äôs rays, and a stick, a lump of clay, and so on, which are held by a gem, a mantra, a medicine, and so on, are of the nature of an illusion, they appear in the form of water, an elephant, and so on, which are false.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin stong pa yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ma rig pas yongs su bzung bas gang dang gang gi bdag nyid du snang ba de yang des ni de kho na nyid du stong pa yin pa'i phyir de med pa yin yang
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin stong pa yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ma rig pas yongs su bzung bas gang dang gang gi bdag nyid du snang ba de yang des ni de kho na nyid du stong pa yin pa'i phyir de med pa yin yang
translated: However, just as the nature of what appears is empty, in the same way, consciousness, which is held by ignorance, appears in whatever way. Since that is empty of reality, it does not exist.

original: snang ba mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: snang ba mi 'gal lo //
translated: However, it is not contradictory for it to appear.

original: de la gal te 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la gal te 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: In this regard, one might think as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa don dam par ma gyur mod bdag ni rnam par shes pa po nyid du 'ga' zhig gis khas blangs pa de yang yang dag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don dam par ma gyur mod bdag ni rnam par shes pa po nyid du 'ga' zhig gis khas blangs pa de yang yang dag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But I am accepted by some as the very consciousness itself.

original: 'di yang snying por gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang snying por gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not the core of the matter.

original: gang gi phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba rgyas par ro //
translated: Why? Because consciousness is not the self,üîΩand the self is not consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i bya ba'i byed pa po ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa po zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i bya ba'i byed pa po ste /
translated: The so-called consciousness is the agent of the action of consciousness.

original: de yang las dang bcas pa'i bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang las dang bcas pa'i bya ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since that is an action that possesses an object,üîΩit must definitely rely on the entity called an object.

original: des gdon mi za bar las zhes bya ba'i ngo bo la ltos par bya ba yin la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bya ba de yang sngar bstan par rigs pas yod pa ma yin la de med pa'i phyir shes pa yang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: des gdon mi za bar las zhes bya ba'i ngo bo la ltos par bya ba yin la gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bya ba de yang sngar bstan par rigs pas yod pa ma yin la de med pa'i phyir shes pa yang yod pa ma yin
translated: Since it is reasonable to explain that the action of consciousness of form and so on is nonexistent, consciousness also does not exist.

original: no // des na shes dang shes bya med pa'i phyir de gnyi ga la ltos nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par byed pa po yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: no // des na shes dang shes bya med pa'i phyir de gnyi ga la ltos nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par byed pa po yang med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is neither consciousness nor the object of consciousness, the agent of consciousness, which is engaged in dependence on those two, does not exist.

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag la skur ba btab na 'dus byas thams cad la skur ba btab par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag la skur ba btab na 'dus byas thams cad la skur ba btab par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if consciousness and the object of consciousness are denied, is not the denial of all conditioned things?

original: de ni de las phyi rol du gyur pa yang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de las phyi rol du gyur pa yang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest thing that is external to that.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi mdo bzhi ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mgur nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi mdo bzhi ston pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mgur nas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, the TathƒÅgata, himself, who teaches the four summaries of the Dharma, has sung this song from his heart:

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa /
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal bar mdzad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal bar mdzad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to remove the doubt that this might be so, he says,

original: thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba pa sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag ces bya ba pa sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll is impermanent,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this.

original: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas 'dra bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyi bden pa la ltos nas 'dra bar byed na /
translated: If one makes it similar in dependence on conventional truth,

original: de'i tshe thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: At that time, all are impermanent.

original: ngas ni cung zad kyang 'dus byas rang gi chos nyid du lhan cig tu gyur pa la /
analyzed: ngas ni cung zad kyang 'dus byas rang gi chos nyid du lhan cig tu gyur pa la /
translated: I do not deny anything that is a conditioned thing by its intrinsic reality.

original: skur ba ma btab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skur ba ma btab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: 'on te don dam pa'i bden pa la ltos nas nyid kyis mgur nas gsungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa'i bden pa la ltos nas nyid kyis mgur nas gsungs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is not a statement from his own throat, in reliance on ultimate truth.

original: de la bsnyon yang 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa ni yang @367a * //
analyzed: de la bsnyon yang 'gal ba cung zad kyang med do zhes bstan pa ni yang @367a * //
translated: In this regard, there is not the slightest contradiction in denying it.

original: na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúOr, it is not a statement from his own throat,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by this passage.

original: ji ltar chos can bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po la tshad ma med pa nyid dang / tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar chos can bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos po la tshad ma med pa nyid dang / tshad mas gnod pa nyid kyis med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as with respect to the phenomena of self, space, and so on, there is no valid cognition with respect to things, and they are nonexistent because they are undermined by valid cognition.

original: de la rten pa rtag pa nyid kyang byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyang de'i rten du gyur pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po la sngar rgyas par brjod pa'i rigs pas dngos po nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir khyed kyis
analyzed: de la rten pa rtag pa nyid kyang byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid kyang de'i rten du gyur pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po la sngar rgyas par brjod pa'i rigs pas dngos po nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir khyed kyis
translated: Just as you accept that permanence is the support of things, in the same way, impermanence is also the support of things. Because the reasoning that was previously extensively explained in the context of the support of things clarifies that impermanence is a thing.

original: med do zhes khas blang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: med do zhes khas blang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore you must accept that it exists.

original: gal te nang dang phyi'i skye mched med pa'i phyir shes pa med pa 'o na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te nang dang phyi'i skye mched med pa'i phyir shes pa med pa 'o na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that consciousness does not exist because internal and external sources do not exist, then attachment and so on that are included in the aggregate of formation are not established as concomitant with consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir sems dang lhan cig de dag rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa rnams kyis mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams med par brjod par mi bya ba yin nam zhes phyir rgol bar gnas pa gang yin pa de la phyin ci log tsam las
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems dang lhan cig de dag rten dang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa rnams kyis mtshungs par ldan pa nyid du de ltar 'dod pa'i phyir dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams med par brjod par mi bya ba yin nam zhes phyir rgol bar gnas pa gang yin pa de la phyin ci log tsam las
translated: Because it is asserted that they are concomitant with the mind through being similar in terms of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance, is it the case that the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses cannot be said to be nonexistent?

original: byung ba nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi sdug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: byung ba nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi sdug ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To respond to that objection, the root text says, ‚ÄúThey are merely the arising of error,‚Äù because attachment and so on do not exist in reality through their own intrinsic reality.

original: mi sdug pa dman pa'i dngos po la sdug par mchog gi rnam par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen te de las gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams dngos dang brgyud pas
analyzed: mi sdug pa dman pa'i dngos po la sdug par mchog gi rnam par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyin ci log gang yin pa de nyid rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen te de las gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams dngos dang brgyud pas
translated: The cause is the error that has the nature of conceiving the unattractive and inferior as attractive and superior.

original: dngos po 'byung ste skye ba 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po 'byung ste skye ba 'grub par byed do //
translated: Because of that, craving, hatred, and delusion arise and are produced, and they cause things to arise and be produced.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dir rang bzhin gyis te rang gi ngo bos yang dag par med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dir rang bzhin gyis te rang gi ngo bos yang dag par med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, craving, hatred, and delusion do not exist here in reality, that is, by their intrinsic reality.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan dag kyang yod na 'dir 'dod chags pa dag kho na nye bar smos pa ni de dag gsal bar yang dag par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa gzhan dag kyang yod na 'dir 'dod chags pa dag kho na nye bar smos pa ni de dag gsal bar yang dag par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there are other concomitant factors, here only craving, hatred, and delusion are mentioned because they are clearly existent in reality.

original: gang yang ji skad du 'di la 'dod pa dang dgra bo dang grub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi yul la yang rgyu nyid du yod pa yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na 'khrul pa tsam gyis tha skyed pa nyid kyis 'di dag la yang @367b dag parüîΩmed pa nyid ston par byed /
analyzed: gang yang ji skad du 'di la 'dod pa dang dgra bo dang grub pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi yul la yang rgyu nyid du yod pa yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar na 'khrul pa tsam gyis tha skyed pa nyid kyis 'di dag la yang @367b dag par med pa nyid ston par byed /
translated: Since desire, enemies, and so on exist as the cause of the object of form, how can you demonstrate that they are unreal by mere delusion?

original: de ltar yang /üîΩphra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul ni nye bar gyur pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed las //
analyzed: de ltar yang / phra rgyas spangs pa ma yin dang // yul ni nye bar gyur pa dang // tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed las //
translated: Thus:

original: nyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgyu ni tshang ba yin //
translated: The cause of affliction isüîΩThe non-abandonment of negative tendencies,üîΩThe presence of objects,üîΩAnd improper mental activity.

original: zhes bstan to zhes zer ba de la /
analyzed: zhes bstan to zhes zer ba de la /
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: yul ni de'i rgyu nyid kho nar ma grub ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul ni de'i rgyu nyid kho nar ma grub ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that the object is not established as the cause of that,

original: gang phyir der chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang phyir der chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSince attachment exists toward that,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gang gi phyir gal te yul gyis kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skyed par byed pa de'i tshe yul gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin des de nyid bskyed dgos na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gal te yul gyis kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams skyed par byed pa de'i tshe yul gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin des de nyid bskyed dgos na /
translated: If objects generate attachment and so on, then the object that generates a certain affliction would always generate that affliction, because of the essential nature of the object.

original: bskyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bskyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case,

original: de nyid la rtogs pa po gzhan nam de nyid dus gzhan gyi tshe de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la rtogs pa po gzhan nam de nyid dus gzhan gyi tshe de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the perceiver of that object generates another affliction at another time.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa gang la snang ba'i spyod yul du spyod pa na 'dod pa dang ldan pas 'dod chags skyed par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa gang la snang ba'i spyod yul du spyod pa na 'dod pa dang ldan pas 'dod chags skyed par byed la /
translated: Thus, when one who desires engages in the domain of objects that appear desirable, attachment is generated.

original: de nyid gzhan gyi tshe nyid dam de'i tshe kun du rgyus zhe sdang skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi tshe nyid dam de'i tshe kun du rgyus zhe sdang skyed par byed de /
translated: But at another time, the same person who desires generates aversion toward that object or toward someone else.

original: de las gzhan pas ni gti mug skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pas ni gti mug skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: Someone else generates delusion toward that object.

original: de ltar rtogs pa po tha dad pa rnams kyis yul gcig la mthar thug pa nyid kyis gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug skye bar nyams su myong bar byed pa de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa po tha dad pa rnams kyis yul gcig la mthar thug pa nyid kyis gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug skye bar nyams su myong bar byed pa de'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, because of the ultimate difference of the cognizers, when attachment, aversion, and delusion arise, they are experienced.üîΩ

original: 'di dag rnam par rtog pa ji ltar goms pa bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dag kho nas skye bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par rtog pa ji ltar goms pa bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dag kho nas skye bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Thus, because of the ultimate difference of the cognizers, and because of the experience of the arising of attachment, aversion, and delusion, it should be understood that these arise only from improper mental activity, in accordance with the habitual tendencies of conceptual thought.

original: rmi lam du nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul la ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam du nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'dod pa la sogs pa'i yul la ji lta ba bzhin du phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, like the experience of objects such as forms in a dream, they are not due to external objects.

original: gang de nyid ni rtag tu mngon par 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir gcig la gang gi sgra ma smos pa ni 'dun pa'i mtha' can gyis der gyi sgra 'ba' zhig lan gsum brjod pa ma 'brel ba lta bur mdzad pa ni lan gsum brjod pa'i der gyi
analyzed: gang de nyid ni rtag tu mngon par 'brel ba yin pa'i phyir 'dir gcig la gang gi sgra ma smos pa ni 'dun pa'i mtha' can gyis der gyi sgra 'ba' zhig lan gsum brjod pa ma 'brel ba lta bur mdzad pa ni lan gsum brjod pa'i der gyi
translated: Because it is always related to that, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is not mentioned here. The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is repeated three times, as if it were not related to the word ‚Äúwhich‚Äù that ends the sentence.

original: sgra'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i gang gi sgra der gyi sgras sgrub pa'i don la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'brel bar shes par bya ba yin par de'i phyir ro //üîΩde ltar na gang kho na la 'dod chags pa de nyid la zhe sdang pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa'i gang gi sgra der gyi sgras sgrub pa'i don la rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'brel bar shes par bya ba yin par de'i phyir ro // de ltar na gang kho na la 'dod chags pa de nyid la zhe sdang pa yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúwhich‚Äù is implied by the force of the meaning of the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù that is repeated three times. The word ‚Äúwhich‚Äù is to be understood as related to the meaning of the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù in the same order.üîΩThus, one who is attached to something is also averse to it.

original: de nyid la rmongs pa yin no //üîΩgang kho na @368a * //üîΩla zhe sdang ba de nyid la 'dod chags pa yin pa de nyid la rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la rmongs pa yin no // gang kho na @368a * // la zhe sdang ba de nyid la 'dod chags pa yin pa de nyid la rmongs pa yin no //
translated: And one who is attached to something is also confused about it.üîΩOne who is averse to something is also attached to it.üîΩAnd one who is averse to something is also confused about it.

original: gang kho na la rmongs pa de nyid la 'dod chags pa yin la /
analyzed: gang kho na la rmongs pa de nyid la 'dod chags pa yin la /
translated: One who is confused about something is also attached to it.

original: de nyid la zhe sdang ba yin no zhes ngag gi don tha dad pa 'thad pa yin na thams cad la 'bras bu ma nges par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid la zhe sdang ba yin no zhes ngag gi don tha dad pa 'thad pa yin na thams cad la 'bras bu ma nges par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the meaning of the statement ‚Äúit is aversion toward that itself‚Äù were different, then the result would be indeterminate for all.

original: gzhan du na yul gcig la gang gi sgra 'brel bar byas nas de nyid la 'bras bu ma nges par dogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du na yul gcig la gang gi sgra 'brel bar byas nas de nyid la 'bras bu ma nges par dogs pa yin la /
translated: Otherwise, having connected the term ‚Äúthat‚Äù to one object, there would be doubt that the result would be indeterminate for that itself.

original: de lta bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid yul la ltos pa med pa rnams kho na phyin ci log tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can dang rang nyid kyang phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pa des
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid yul la ltos pa med pa rnams kho na phyin ci log tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can dang rang nyid kyang phyin ci log gi bdag nyid yin pa des
translated: Therefore, attachment and so on are only the causes of error, they are not the causes of the object, and they are not the causes of the object‚Äôs appearance.

original: na yang dag par rang bzhin med do zhes bya bar bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: na yang dag par rang bzhin med do zhes bya bar bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is established that they are not real.

original: 'di nyid kyis ni sdug par phyin ci log pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par med pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ni sdug par phyin ci log pa'i 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang dag par med pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains that the cause of the engagement of attachment to the attractive is not real.
