original: gang gi phyir 'du byed kyi phung po bsdus pa'i chos rnam ma las gzhan ni sdug par phyin ci log pa'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du byed kyi phung po bsdus pa'i chos rnam ma las gzhan ni sdug par phyin ci log pa'i rgyu med de /
translated: Apart from the phenomena included in the aggregate of compositional factors, there is no cause for the error of attachment.

original: rgyun la ltos nas de dag lan cig phan tshun 'bras bu nyid yin pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun la ltos nas de dag lan cig phan tshun 'bras bu nyid yin pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction in their being mutually resultant in dependence on the continuum.

original: da ni 'du shes kyi phung po la brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'du shes kyi phung po la brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to investigate the aggregate of discernment, it is said:

original: bskyed de rnam par rtog de yang //üîΩyang dag nyid du yod ma yin //
analyzed: bskyed de rnam par rtog de yang // yang dag nyid du yod ma yin //
translated: Discernment is generated by conceptuality.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: That also does not exist in reality.

original: 'dir 'di mngon par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir 'di mngon par 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the relevance of this here?

original: gang gi phyir gang dag 'di snyam du gal te de'i skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag yul gyis bskyed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dag 'di snyam du gal te de'i skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag yul gyis bskyed pa ma yin na /
translated: Because of that, if attachment and so on are not generated by objects because it is untenable that they generate them,

original: 'o na ni gang dag gis 'di dag bskyed pa de dag nyid mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'du shes kyi sngon po rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang dag gis 'di dag bskyed pa de dag nyid mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'du shes kyi sngon po rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag par yod pa yin te /
translated: then those that generate them are the conceptual thoughts of discernment that have the character of apprehending signs.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la rgyu mtshan nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes sems pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang gi phyir gang dag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa bskyed pa de ltar kun rdzob tu 'dod pa
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la rgyu mtshan nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes sems pa de yang yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang gi phyir gang dag gis 'dod chags la sogs pa bskyed pa de ltar kun rdzob tu 'dod pa
translated: Because of that, those who generate attachment and so on,üîΩthose conceptual thoughts are not ultimately established because they are not real.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis don dam par ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩThe demonstration of the logic of this is presented in the lines beginning with:

original: 'di nyid la brtag bya gang de //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa @368b bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la brtag bya gang de // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'thad pa @368b bstan pa ni /
translated: That which is to be examined by this‚Ä¶

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba bskyed pa na gdon mi za bar cung zad rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba bskyed pa na gdon mi za bar cung zad rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: Because when something called a conceptual thought is generated, it must be conceptualizing something.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa med na rnam par rtog pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa med na rnam par rtog pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without a conceptual thought, it is not reasonable for there to be a conceptual thought.

original: de la ci 'di rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag nyid ma yin pa la yang /
analyzed: de la ci 'di rnam par brtag par bya ba bdag nyid ma yin pa la yang /
translated: In that regard, is it the case that this conceptual thought is conceptualizing something that is not itself?

original: ci kun rdzob tu rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: ci kun rdzob tu rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dam /
translated: Is it by intrinsic identity?üîΩ

original: de'i ngo bor zhen pa gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo yin grang na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhen pa gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo yin grang na /
translated: Is it the nature of the object itself that is conceived, or is it the nature of the exclusion of other?

original: de la re zhig bdag nyid la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag nyid la ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the nature of the object itself,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par mi rtog go zhes khyed cag nyid kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par mi rtog go zhes khyed cag nyid kyis bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you yourself have refuted the idea that a conceptual cognition can have the nature of the object itself.

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la ni ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la ni ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it the nature of the object itself, which is the essence of its own characteristics,

original: de ni thams cad la log pa nyid kyis shin tu khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni thams cad la log pa nyid kyis shin tu khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because that is the essence that is the opposite of everything, and it is extremely specific.

original: 'di ni spyi'i rnam par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni spyi'i rnam par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is the general mode of engagement.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been taught:üîΩThe essence of that is the opposite of everything,

original: de yi ngo bo kun las log / de ltar de ni rtog byed pa //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo kun las log / de ltar de ni rtog byed pa //
translated: and thus it is conceptualized.

original: sgra dang rnam rtog yod min te //
analyzed: sgra dang rnam rtog yod min te //
translated: Sound and conceptualization do not exist,

original: spyi nyid la ni 'jug phyir ro //üîΩzhes bstan to //
analyzed: spyi nyid la ni 'jug phyir ro // zhes bstan to //
translated: because it engages with universals.

original: gzhan sel ba'i ngo bor zhen pa ni rnam par brtag par bya ba yin na yang /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i ngo bor zhen pa ni rnam par brtag par bya ba yin na yang /
translated: Even if the nature of the exclusion of other is conceived,

original: yang dag pa kun rdzob pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba dngos por 'gyur ba med pas rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa kun rdzob pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba dngos por 'gyur ba med pas rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it does not exist as the nature of a real, conventional entity, the object of conceptualization does not exist as a thing. Therefore, conceptualization is also not real.

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni brtag bya gang rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis de'i yul du gyur pa de dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni brtag bya gang rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis de'i yul du gyur pa de dngos por yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught: The object of conceptualization, which is the cause of the arising of conceptualization, does not exist as a thing, because it is the object of conceptualization.

original: brtag bya dngos por gyur pa med na gal te rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang na yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtag bya dngos por gyur pa med na gal te rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang na yang med pa nyid do //
translated: If the object of conceptualization does not exist as a thing, then conceptualization, which is the nature of a thing, does not exist anywhere.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar /üîΩde phyir brtag bya rtog pa yang //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar / de phyir brtag bya rtog pa yang //
translated: Because it is so,üîΩtherefore, the object of conceptualization and conceptualization

original: zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang stong pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang stong pa yin te /
translated: are both empty.

original: ji ltar zhen pa de'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar zhen pa de'i ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they do not have the nature that is imagined.

original: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la gtan tshigs gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, another reason is taught:

original: rkyen las skyes phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: because it arises from conditions, and so on.

original: 'di ltar dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: gang yang dngos po dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad dngos po'i bdag nyid du ma gyur mod /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad dngos po'i bdag nyid du ma gyur mod /
translated: Although all conceptual thoughts do not exist as the nature of things because they are not related to things,

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa @369a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa @369a * //
translated: conceptual thoughts such as inference

original: gang zhig la brgyud pas dngos po la rag las par 'jug pa nyid du yod pa de'am /
analyzed: gang zhig la brgyud pas dngos po la rag las par 'jug pa nyid du yod pa de'am /
translated: do exist in the sense that they engage indirectly in dependence on things.

original: de'i rnam par brtag par bya ba ji ltar dngos por ma gyur pa yin snyam du sems pa de la gtan tshigs 'di nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par brtag par bya ba ji ltar dngos por ma gyur pa yin snyam du sems pa de la gtan tshigs 'di nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or, the conceptual thought that is the object of investigation, how could it not exist as a thing? This is the reason that is taught.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gang yang brgyud pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de gnyi ga yin pa 'di yang rkyen las skyes phyir te /
analyzed: gang yang brgyud pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa'i dngos po dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa de gnyi ga yin pa 'di yang rkyen las skyes phyir te /
translated: That which is asserted to be the object of investigation by the mere fact of generating conceptual thoughts such as inference, and the conceptual thoughts such as inference that are asserted to be the object of investigation, both of these are things that arise from conditions.

original: ji ltar lan gyi rgyu la rag las nas skye ba'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid do //üîΩ'di ltar rtogs pa'i sgras rang dga'i rnam par rtog pa yang bzung ba des na de yang phyi rol gyi dngos po la rag las pa nyid med kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la rag las nas skye ba'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid khong du
analyzed: ji ltar lan gyi rgyu la rag las nas skye ba'i phyir sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid do // 'di ltar rtogs pa'i sgras rang dga'i rnam par rtog pa yang bzung ba des na de yang phyi rol gyi dngos po la rag las pa nyid med kyang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la rag las nas skye ba'i phyir rang bzhin stong pa nyid khong du
translated: Just as a magical creation, etc. are empty of intrinsic reality by way of their utter unreality, so too is the world, because it arises in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: chud par bya'o //
analyzed: chud par bya'o //
translated: Since the word ‚Äúrealization‚Äù also includes the voluntary conceptualization, therefore, although it does not depend on external things, one should understand that it is empty of intrinsic reality, because it arises in dependence on the immediately preceding condition.

original: 'di khyad par ni 'di tsam yin te /
analyzed: 'di khyad par ni 'di tsam yin te /
translated: This is the only difference:

original: sngar ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dag pha rol gyi 'dod pa kho nas yang dag pa'i ngo bo gsal ba yin la ;
analyzed: sngar ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dag pha rol gyi 'dod pa kho nas yang dag pa'i ngo bo gsal ba yin la ;
translated: Previously, the object of conceptualization and the conceptualization itself were clarified as to their true nature only by the opponent‚Äôs assertion,

original: da ltar ni rang gi 'dod pas yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni rang gi 'dod pas yin no //
translated: but now it is by our own assertion.

original: de lta bas na gang dag gis gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yang dag par yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa de dag nyid kyi gzhung gis de dag rnam par dpyad pa na mi 'thad pa'i rang bzhin rnams dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis lta smos kyang ci
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dag gis gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag yang dag par yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa de dag nyid kyi gzhung gis de dag rnam par dpyad pa na mi 'thad pa'i rang bzhin rnams dbu ma pa'i lugs kyis lta smos kyang ci
translated: What need is there to mention the system of the Followers of the Middle Way?

original: dgos zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the point.

original: da ni bden pa'i dngos por zhen pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba de dag kho na la stong pa nyid kyis tshul 'di rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par grol ba dang rjes su mthun pa bstan pas gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba nyid duüîΩbstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bden pa'i dngos por zhen pa'i gdon gyis bzung ba de dag kho na la stong pa nyid kyis tshul 'di rang gi mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam par grol ba dang rjes su mthun pa bstan pas gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate to those who are possessed by the demon of clinging to real things that this approach of emptiness is in harmony with their own desired form of liberation and that they should therefore definitely accept it, the following is taught:üîΩBecause of correct realization,

original: yang dag rtogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag rtogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the wise are liberated.üîΩBecause of incorrect realization,üîΩthe unwise are bound.

original: gang gi tshe yang de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la de kho na nyid du so sor brtag pa la sogs pa mthar phyin pa las skyes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam @369b par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rnams la de kho na nyid du so sor brtag pa la sogs pa mthar phyin pa las skyes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam @369b par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi de kho na nyid rang bzhin med
translated: When one has perfected the analysis of form and so on in terms of reality and so on, one will give rise to supramundane nonconceptual wisdom that realizes the reality of the absence of intrinsic existence of all phenomena.üîΩ

original: pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing mngon du byed de khong du chud par gyur pa /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs shing mngon du byed de khong du chud par gyur pa /
translated: When one has perfected the analysis of reality in regard to form, etc., and has generated the supramundane, non-conceptual intuition that is the realization of reality, the characteristic of the absence of intrinsic reality,

original: de'i tshe yang dag rtogs phyir te //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dag rtogs phyir te //
translated: at that time, because of the correct realization,

original: des na ma rig pa med cing 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ma rig pa med cing 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: ignorance does not exist and the process does not occur.

original: gang gi phyir de ni phyin ci log bzhi las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni phyin ci log bzhi las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Because it is generated from the four errors.

original: phyin ci log bzhi po de dag kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba na nyi ma shar ba la mun pa bzhin du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhi po de dag kyang de kho na nyid mthong ba na nyi ma shar ba la mun pa bzhin du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: And when one sees reality, those four errors do not exist, just as darkness does not exist when the sun rises.

original: gang gi phyir lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dag la brten pa de dag rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / sdug pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i ngo bor go rims 'jug pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dag la brten pa de dag rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / sdug pa'i rnam par zhen pa'i ngo bor go rims 'jug pa rnams ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'dod de /
translated: Because they engage in the order of the essential natures of the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena, which are the objects of clinging to permanence, happiness, self, and beauty, they are asserted to be the characteristics of ignorance.

original: lus la sogs pa de dag kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa yin la /üîΩgang dag rang bzhin stong pa de dag ni rtag pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pa zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa de dag kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pas rang bzhin stong pa yin la / gang dag rang bzhin stong pa de dag ni rtag pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pa zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Those bodies and so on are empty of intrinsic reality, as has been taught by the reasoning explained above.üîΩThose that are empty of intrinsic reality are not suitable to be called permanent or impermanent.

original: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: dngos yod rtag dang mi rtag nyid //
translated: If things existed, they would be permanent or impermanent.

original: yin na de lta ga la yod //
analyzed: yin na de lta ga la yod //
translated: How could that be?

original: ces bstan to //üîΩde lta bas na gzhi med pa'i phyir phyin ci log rnams mi 'jug na ma rig pa mi 'jug go zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: ces bstan to // de lta bas na gzhi med pa'i phyir phyin ci log rnams mi 'jug na ma rig pa mi 'jug go zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus it has been taught.üîΩTherefore, because there is no basis, it has been taught that if misconceptions do not engage, ignorance does not engage.

original: de med phyir te ma rig pa de mi 'jug na 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: de med phyir te ma rig pa de mi 'jug na 'du byed rnams te /
translated: If that does not exist, then due to the nonengagement of ignorance, formations do not engage.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyi dbye ba rnams mi 'byung ste mi skye ba yin no //üîΩde bzhin du de ma thag tu bstan pas rgyu mi 'jug pas na 'bras bu mi 'jug pa'i rim pas lhag ma ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'i las kyi dbye ba rnams mi 'byung ste mi skye ba yin no // de bzhin du de ma thag tu bstan pas rgyu mi 'jug pas na 'bras bu mi 'jug pa'i rim pas lhag ma ste /
translated: The divisions of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable karma do not occur, i.e., are not produced.

original: lus la rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rga shi'i mthar thug pa mi 'jug pa'i chos can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus la rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rga shi'i mthar thug pa mi 'jug pa'i chos can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, since the cause does not operate due to the non-operation of the immediately preceding condition, the remaining links, i.e., the effect, should be understood to be dharmas that do not operate, from consciousness up to old age and death, which are the limbs of dependent origination in the body.

original: 'di nyid la 'phags pa'i phyed kyis pha rol la shin tu grags pa bstan pa ni /üîΩgang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'phags pa'i phyed kyis pha rol la shin tu grags pa bstan pa ni / gang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang yin te /
translated: This very point is taught by the second half of the verse:üîΩWhatever is desired as the effect is based on the thing desired as the cause, i.e., it is produced in dependence on it.

original: 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang rgyur 'dod pa'i dngos po la brten pa ste brten nas skyes pa ste 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa de las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gang rgyur 'dod pa'i dngos po la brten pa ste brten nas skyes pa ste 'byung ba'i 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa de las skyes pa ste /
translated: The effect that is desired to arise is produced from that cause.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de la dngos su skyes pa nyid nges pa na rgyur mngon par @370a * //
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de la dngos su skyes pa nyid nges pa na rgyur mngon par @370a * //
translated: When the thing that is asserted to be the cause is ascertained to be directly produced, it is ascertained to be the effect.üîΩ

original: 'dod pa'i dngos po de med na 'brel pa min na mi 'byung ba ste mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po de med na 'brel pa min na mi 'byung ba ste mi skye ba'o //
translated: When the thing that is asserted to be the cause is ascertained to be directly produced, then the thing that is asserted to be the cause is absent, and the effect that is related to it as a non-arisen, i.e., not produced.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is a remainder.

original: de lta bas na yan lag snga ma snga ma ma tshang ba'i phyir yan lag phyi ma phyi ma mi 'jug par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa
analyzed: de lta bas na yan lag snga ma snga ma ma tshang ba'i phyir yan lag phyi ma phyi ma mi 'jug par bstan pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa
translated: Therefore, since the latter members do not occur when the former members are incomplete, this teaching shows that one attains liberation, which has the characteristic of the complete pacification of the twelve members of dependent-arising, and

original: tshul 'di bstan pa gang yin pa de rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul 'di bstan pa gang yin pa de rigs pa dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: this teaching of this method is not unreasonable. Therefore,

original: pha rol po dag gis kyang gdon mi za bar tshul 'di kho na khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gis kyang gdon mi za bar tshul 'di kho na khas blang bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: it is taught that the opponent must certainly accept this method.

original: 'di tsam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa mtshungs pa nyid du dgongs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa mtshungs pa nyid du dgongs par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But this alone does not warrant the conclusion that nirvana is the same as samsara.

original: 'di la khyad par chen po srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par chen po srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a great difference between them is possible.

original: khyad par de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that difference, he says:

original: dngos dang dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚Äúexistence and non-existence‚Äù and so on.

original: skye bar byed pa'i phyir dngos po ste /
analyzed: skye bar byed pa'i phyir dngos po ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExistence‚Äù is that which causes arising;

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyis zin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyis zin pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: samsara is characterized by the five appropriative aggregates, which are the results of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de bzhin du gang yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po ste las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang yod na 'byung ba'i phyir dngos po ste las dang nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i rgyu'o //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúexistence‚Äù is that which exists when something else arises; it is the cause of that, characterized by karma and the afflictions.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence‚Äù is the non-existence of that,

original: 'khor ba ldog pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ldog pa'i mtshan nyid thar pa'o //
translated: nirvana is characterized by the cessation of samsara.

original: de bzhin gang yod na mi 'byung bas dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gang yod na mi 'byung bas dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is that which does not exist when something else exists;

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi gnyen por gyur pa lam mo //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gi gnyen por gyur pa lam mo //
translated: it is the path, which is the antidote to karma and the afflictions.

original: dngos po dag dang dngos po med pa dag ni /üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa rnams te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dag dang dngos po med pa dag ni / dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnams te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Things and nonthings areüîΩthe truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'dus byas rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam rnams so //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam rnams so //
translated: The truths of suffering, origin, and path are conditioned things.

original: 'dus ma byas ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The truth of cessation is unconditioned.üîΩThe Sautrantikas understand that the terms thing and nonthing refer to the truths of suffering and so on,

original: 'dus byas rnams dang 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te mdo sde pa dag gis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshig gis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams tha snyad btags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams dang 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te mdo sde pa dag gis ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshig gis sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams tha snyad btags pa yin la /
translated: but Vaibhasikas understand that the terms conditioned and unconditioned refer to the truths of suffering and so on.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i ming gis yin no zhes rtogs pa po rnams kyis dbye bas bsdus pas dgongs pas @370b ming gi dbye ba smos pa na zlog par dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i ming gis yin no zhes rtogs pa po rnams kyis dbye bas bsdus pas dgongs pas @370b ming gi dbye ba smos pa na zlog par dogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the terms are included in the categories of the understander, it is not to be doubted that the terms are reversed when the categories are mentioned.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang yin la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang yin la /
translated: and also existent and nonexistent,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag go //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag go //
translated: and also compounded and uncompounded.

original: de dag ni zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das par tshul 'di la rigs par bya ba yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das par tshul 'di la rigs par bya ba yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that in this system, one should understand that nirvana is peace, the natural pacification of suffering.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ni gzod ma nas de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ni gzod ma nas de kho na nyid du ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: Thus, suffering is primordially non-arisen in reality.

original: gang skyes pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang skyes pa de ni rang bzhin stong pa'o //
translated: That which is arisen is empty of essence.

original: gang rang bzhin stong pa ni rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin stong pa ni rgyu ma yin la /
translated: That which is empty of essence is not a cause.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu ma yin pa de ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu ma yin pa de ni 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not a cause and is not an essence is not a cessation.

original: gang 'gog pa ma yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu'i gnyen po lam rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang 'gog pa ma yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i rgyu mtshan rgyu'i gnyen po lam rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is not a cessation is not a path, a cause, a reason, or an antidote for the cessation of suffering.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa kho na thar pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa kho na thar pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the natural nirvana of phenomena is liberation.

original: gzhan dag gi theg pa la ni sdug bsngal dngos por gyur pa nyid kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi theg pa la ni sdug bsngal dngos por gyur pa nyid kyang /
translated: In other vehicles, the reality of suffering

original: de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu las skye ba dang / rgyu'i gnyen po'i lam skye ba na de 'gog pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyi gzod ma nas nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu las skye ba dang / rgyu'i gnyen po'i lam skye ba na de 'gog pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams kyi gzod ma nas nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa ma yin no //
translated: arises from its own causes, and when the path that is the antidote to its causes arises, it is stopped. Therefore, they assert that nirvana is the primordial peace of suffering and so on.

original: theg pa de'i phyir theg pa 'di la ni khyad par che ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa de'i phyir theg pa 'di la ni khyad par che ba yin no //
translated: But in this vehicle, it is different.

original: de la 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: If you think this,

original: gal te chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis myang 'das nyid thar pa dam pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis myang 'das nyid thar pa dam pa yin na /
translated: if the natural nirvana of phenomena is the highest liberation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rim pa'am ldog pa'i rim pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi rgyu mtshan nyid can gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyis 'jug pa'i rim pa'am ldog pa'i rim pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then the twelve factors of dependent arising, which have the character of the three afflictions, would not exist in the process of engagement or the process of disengagement.

original: de'i phyir spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba med pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed /üîΩskye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gog pas 'du byed 'gog / skye ba 'gog pas rga shi 'gog ces bya ba'i bar du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der bstan pa ji ltar na 'bras bu med pa nyid du
analyzed: de'i phyir spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dag gi rnam par dbye ba med pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar dang / de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gog pas 'du byed 'gog / skye ba 'gog pas rga shi 'gog ces bya ba'i bar du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang der bstan pa ji ltar na 'bras bu med pa nyid du
translated: Therefore, since there is no distinction between cyclic existence and nirvana, which are, respectively, to be abandoned and to be adopted, the Blessed One taught the two sequences of dependent origination:üîΩ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are actions; conditioned by birth, there is aging and death,‚Äù and so on, and ‚ÄúBy stopping ignorance, actions are stopped; by stopping birth, aging and death are stopped,‚Äù and so on.

original: thal bar mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩthal bar @371a * //
analyzed: thal bar mi 'gyur zhe na / thal bar @371a * //
translated: How could it follow, absurdly, that there would be no effect?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not follow.

original: dngos po 'jug pa la ltos nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin na yang thog ma med pa nas phyin ci log gi rnam rtog goms pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyis rmongs pa'i rab rib kyis nyams pa'i blo'i mig can
analyzed: dngos po 'jug pa la ltos nas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa nyid yin na yang thog ma med pa nas phyin ci log gi rnam rtog goms pa'i bag chags kyi rang bzhin gyis rmongs pa'i rab rib kyis nyams pa'i blo'i mig can
translated: Although all phenomena are by nature in a state of nirvana, in dependence on the engagement of things, those whose eyes of intelligence are impaired by the cataracts of confusion, which is the nature of the latent potentialities of the habitual tendencies of beginningless error,

original: gyi rtogs pa po rnams kyi rtogs pa'i 'jug pa la ltos nas /üîΩrten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa gnyis su de nyid kyis yod par zhal gyis bzhes par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyi rtogs pa po rnams kyi rtogs pa'i 'jug pa la ltos nas / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa gnyis su de nyid kyis yod par zhal gyis bzhes par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, in dependence on the engagement of the understanding of theüîΩrealists, he accepts that the two modes of dependent origination exist in reality.

original: 'di nyid bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he quotes the two ƒÄryas:

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes dngos rnams //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes dngos rnams //
translated: Things arisen from causes have no origination;

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gnyis smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'phags pa gnyis smos so //
translated: they are also said to be unceasing,üîΩnot annihilated, not permanent,üîΩnot coming, and not going.

original: rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyu rkyen de lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams las skyes pa'i dngos po rnams la yang dag pa nyid du ste /üîΩde kho na nyid kyi ngo bor rtogs pa gang brten nas skyes pa nyid kyi sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i rnam pa rnams la yang brdzun pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa nyid du khong du chud pa gnag yin pa de ni sems can thams
analyzed: rgyu nye bar len pa'i rgyu rkyen de lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen rnams las skyes pa'i dngos po rnams la yang dag pa nyid du ste / de kho na nyid kyi ngo bor rtogs pa gang brten nas skyes pa nyid kyi sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i rnam pa rnams la yang brdzun pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa nyid du khong du chud pa gnag yin pa de ni sems can thams
translated: The causes are the substantial causes and the cooperative conditions.

original: cad la ston par byed pa'i phyir ston pas ma rig par gsungs te /
analyzed: cad la ston par byed pa'i phyir ston pas ma rig par gsungs te /
translated: Things arisen from those are things arisen in dependence. The understanding of those as real, that is, as having the nature of reality, is the understanding of those things arisen in dependence, which are unreal, like illusions, etc., as not being unreal. That is the teaching of the Teacher, because it is taught to all sentient beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po kun rdzob 'di'i rkyen nyid du bstan pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po kun rdzob 'di'i rkyen nyid du bstan pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe condition of this entire great mass of suffering‚Äù is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa de nyid la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi cha gang la yod pa de ni yan lag bcu gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa de nyid la yan lag bcu gnyis kyi cha gang la yod pa de ni yan lag bcu gnyis yin te /
translated: Since ignorance itself is the condition of the twelve factors, it is the twelve factors.

original: 'byung zhing rgyun du skye ba ni srid pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //üîΩgang gi tshe yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i theg pa chen po 'di thos pa dang / bsam pa dang ; bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa tshogs dang sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pas dngos po de dag nyid stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung zhing rgyun du skye ba ni srid pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba lhag ma'o // gang gi tshe yang chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i theg pa chen po 'di thos pa dang / bsam pa dang ; bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa tshogs dang sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pas dngos po de dag nyid stong pa ste /
translated: The remaining factors are the wheel of existence, which arises and is born in a continuous series.

original: rang bzhin gyis dben par nges pa ste som nyi med par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de dag de ltar rtogs pa dag yin na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dben par nges pa ste som nyi med par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de dag de ltar rtogs pa dag yin na /
translated: When one hears this Mahayana, which reveals that all phenomena are essenceless, and when one understands that all these things are empty, that is, devoid of essence, with certainty, without doubt, through the knowledge that is the nature of hearing, contemplation, and meditation, which is included in the path of accumulation and the path of preparation, then at that time, they understand things in that way.

original: de ma thag tu rab tu dga' ba'i sa rnyed pa'i yang dag pa'i mthong ba'i lam skye ba de gang las sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu rab tu dga' ba'i sa rnyed pa'i yang dag pa'i mthong ba'i lam skye ba de gang las sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rmongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Immediately upon attaining the stage of joy, the path of seeing arises, and the delusion that has the characteristics explained above does not occur.

original: de mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa 'gog pa yin la /
analyzed: de mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa 'gog pa yin la /
translated: The non-occurrence of that is the cessation of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa 'gog pa de nyid las kyang yan lag bcu gnyis kyis srid @371b pa'i 'khor lo 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gog pa de nyid las kyang yan lag bcu gnyis kyis srid @371b pa'i 'khor lo 'gag pa ste /
translated: And from that cessation of ignorance, the wheel of existence ceases with its twelve members.

original: kun rdzob tu yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: It does not occur even conventionally.

original: mdo las / dngos po zhes rigs la gcig gi tshig tu khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las / dngos po zhes rigs la gcig gi tshig tu khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In a s≈´tra, ‚Äúthing‚Äù should be understood as a collective term.

original: gzhan du sngar dngos po rnams mang po nyid du bstan pa gang dag la mdor gsal ba gcig yongs su bzung na skabs su bab pa'i nyams pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du sngar dngos po rnams mang po nyid du bstan pa gang dag la mdor gsal ba gcig yongs su bzung na skabs su bab pa'i nyams pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one were to take the many things that were previously taught as a single collective thing, one would incur the fault of violating the context.

original: de bas 'di ltar dngos po'i 'jug pas chos rnams thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du yin na yang rtogs pa po'i khyad par gyi rtogs pa la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba dang 'gog pa'i rim pa yod pa nyid du
analyzed: de bas 'di ltar dngos po'i 'jug pas chos rnams thams cad gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du yin na yang rtogs pa po'i khyad par gyi rtogs pa la ltos nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la skye ba dang 'gog pa'i rim pa yod pa nyid du
translated: Therefore, although all phenomena are primordially peace, in terms of the differences in the realization of the person who realizes this, the stages of arising and cessation exist in dependent origination.

original: bstan pas kun rdzob tu spang ba dang blang bar bya ba dang / 'khor ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod pas de dag spang ba dang / blang ba rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i lam yang kun rdzob la mi 'gal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pas kun rdzob tu spang ba dang blang bar bya ba dang / 'khor ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par dbye ba yod pas de dag spang ba dang / blang ba rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i lam yang kun rdzob la mi 'gal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa 'bras bu dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since the relative is taught to be that which is to be abandoned and adopted and since samsara and nirvana are distinguished, the path that is the reason for abandoning those and adopting those is not contradictory in the relative. Therefore this is the position that the teachings of the Transcendent Conqueror are fruitful.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yang yin te /
translated: This is also logical.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams yang dag par skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba yin yang kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'gag pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams yang dag par skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba yin yang kun rdzob tu skye ba dang 'gag pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, although things are free from real arising and ceasing, they do arise and cease conventionally, he says:üîΩFormations are like a phantom city,

original: 'du byed dri za'i grong khyer dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yang dag par skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'du byed dri za'i grong khyer dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa yang dag par skye ba'am /
translated: etc.

original: 'gag pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang tshogs pa de dang de yang dag par thob pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten las skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa nyid du ma dmigs pa ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dus byas thams cad yin
analyzed: 'gag pa ma yin pa de ltar na yang tshogs pa de dang de yang dag par thob pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten las skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa nyid du ma dmigs pa ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'dus byas thams cad yin
translated: Although a phantom city, etc. is not real in terms of arising or ceasing, still, due to the power of obtaining that particular collection, it is not the case that it is not observed to have arising and ceasing in the world. In the same way, all formationsüîΩare like that.

original: no // 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: no // 'dra ba'i rgyu mtshan de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that very reason for similarity, he says:

original: 'di la dngos 'ga' yod min zhing //
analyzed: 'di la dngos 'ga' yod min zhing //
translated: Here, there is no real entity

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: etc.

original: gang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa 'di la dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa 'di la dngos po ste /
translated: Because in this world, such things as the city of gandharvas,

original: skye ba dang / dngos med de 'gog pa rang bzhin gyis te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / dngos med de 'gog pa rang bzhin gyis te /
translated: are neither entities nor nonentities, that is, they are neither essentially arisen nor essentially ceased.

original: don dam par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: For, they do not exist at all ultimately.

original: 'di dag ni brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The point is that they are dependently arisen.üîΩTherefore, one should understand that the nature of all compounded things is also empty, because it is dependently arisen.

original: de'i phyir gang yang dngos po 'dus byas rnams kyi rang bzhin de yang brten nas skyes pa @372a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang dngos po 'dus byas rnams kyi rang bzhin de yang brten nas skyes pa @372a * //
translated: In order to include this point and in order to avoid contradiction with other systems,üîΩthe noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:üîΩAll things are empty.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: yin pa'i phyir stong pa ste yang dag par skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir stong pa ste yang dag par skye ba dang 'gag pa dang bral ba yin no zhes khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.

original: don 'di nyid 'jug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa gzhan du 'gal ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di nyid 'jug bsdu ba'i phyir dang / theg pa gzhan du 'gal ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.

original: 'phags pa gnyis smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnyis smos pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: dngos kun rang bzhin stong yin no //
analyzed: dngos kun rang bzhin stong yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.üîΩThis is the meaning of dependent origination.üîΩThis is the meaning of emptiness.

original: dngos po 'di la de'i phyir //üîΩzhes khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po 'di la de'i phyir //üîΩzhes khong nas dbyung bar bya ste /
translated: This

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas thams cad dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de'i phyir dngos po kun rang bzhin gyis stong pa rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhinüîΩgshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas thams cad dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang 'dra ba de'i phyir dngos po kun rang bzhin gyis stong pa rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa yin na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs pa med pa ste /
translated: The perfect, complete Buddha, the Bhagavan, the Tathagata, the peerless one,üîΩis superior to all teachers.

original: ston pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pas dngos po rnams kyi rten 'byung ste /
analyzed: ston pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pas dngos po rnams kyi rten 'byung ste /
translated: The dependent origination of things is like this:

original: rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pas brten nas skye ba 'di 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la sogs pas brten nas skye ba 'di 'dra ba ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They arise in dependence on causes and conditions and so on.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught to be the nature of things.

original: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba bzhin du brdzun pa kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa rnams kyi skye ba bzhin du brdzun pa kun rdzob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Like the arising of a city of gandharvas and so on, it is false and deceptive.

original: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gzhan du 'di nyid yang dag pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar theg pa gzhan du 'di nyid yang dag pa nyid du bstan zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is this taught as reality in other vehicles?

original: bstan pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bstan pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is taught, that is true,

original: de tsam gyis 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'gal ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest contradiction in this.

original: gang gi phyir dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyi don te yul skye ba 'dir zad pa ni 'di tsam gyis chad de sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam pa 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyi don te yul skye ba 'dir zad pa ni 'di tsam gyis chad de sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du
translated: The meaning of the object of the supramundane, nonconceptual gnosis and the pure mundane gnosis of the postmeditation of the noble beings is that in this world, the arising of the object ceases just with this much, like an illusion and so on.

original: brdzun pa'i rnam pa yongs su chad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i rnam pa yongs su chad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the aspect of falsity is eliminated.

original: 'jig rten tha snyad ces bya ba la 'jig rten so so'i skye bo 'phags pa'i lam la ma zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams de la grags pa'i tha snyad ni sems dang ngag dang lus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten tha snyad ces bya ba la 'jig rten so so'i skye bo 'phags pa'i lam la ma zhugs pa'i sems can gyi khams de la grags pa'i tha snyad ni sems dang ngag dang lus kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mundane conventions means that the conventions known in the world, in the realm of sentient beings who are ordinary individuals not engaged in the noble path, are threefold, distinguished by mind, speech and body.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i ngo bo la brten nas te de rjes su gzung bar 'dod nas de nyid don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir khas blangs nas ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa dang / 'jug pa'i ngo bo la brten nas te de rjes su gzung bar 'dod nas de nyid don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir khas blangs nas ma chags shing ma thogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thugs
translated: In dependence on the entities of consciousness, expression, and engagement, i.e., in order to take them up, the BhagavƒÅn, the Omniscient One, the Buddha, having accepted them in order to engage in the ultimate, with unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom,üîΩpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn, the Omniscient One, the Buddha, having fully understood all varieties, i.e., the entire collection of objects, with unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom, penetrated all aspects of all phenomena.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúall varieties‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.

original: su chud pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas @372b thams cad mkhyen pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sna tshogs thams cad de don gyi tshogs ma lus par yang dag par phyin ci log pa brtags pa ste /
analyzed: su chud pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas @372b thams cad mkhyen pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sna tshogs thams cad de don gyi tshogs ma lus par yang dag par phyin ci log pa brtags pa ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.

original: tshig gis bsnyad cing nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig gis bsnyad cing nye bar bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo'i tha snyad kyi dbye ba la ltos nas bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di thams cad kho na don mi 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa'i skye bo'i tha snyad kyi dbye ba la ltos nas bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'di thams cad kho na don mi 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all aspects.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúwith unattached and unobstructed pure wisdom‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects without exception.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúpenetrated all aspects of all phenomena‚Äù is that he fully understood all objects with all

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bstan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa la yang gang dag la skrag pa'i 'byung ba de dag la de'i dgongs pa ma rtogs pa nyid skrag pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad bstan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa la yang gang dag la skrag pa'i 'byung ba de dag la de'i dgongs pa ma rtogs pa nyid skrag pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the Lord has taught the doctrine without fault, and those who are frightened by it are frightened because they do not understand his intention.

original: 'jig rten chos can mi 'jig cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten chos can mi 'jig cing //
translated: The doctrine of the world is not destroyed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and likewise the doctrine of reality is not made.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la ltos nas bstan pa 'jug pa na ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis la ltos nas bstan pa 'jug pa na ;
translated: Because the teaching is engaged in depending on the two truths, the conventional and the ultimate,

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan pa mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan pa mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: the doctrine of the world is not destroyed,

original: kun rdzob dag gi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa dag ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag gi skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa dag ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conventional, with its arising, cessation, etc., is not abandoned.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa ste don dam par chos bstan pa ci yang mdzad par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa ste don dam par chos bstan pa ci yang mdzad par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Likewise, the doctrine of reality is not made in any way, because the ultimate is not made.

original: chos kyi dngos po yod pa cung zad kyang gzhag pa med pa'i phyir te sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po yod pa cung zad kyang gzhag pa med pa'i phyir te sgro btags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is not the slightest existent thing that can be posited as a phenomenon, because there is no superimposition.

original: de'i phyir dri ma med pa 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i skyon gyis stong pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa yin la /üîΩchos kyi de kho na nyid mchog tu zab pa mi shes pa shes par byed pa'i phyir tshul de stong pa nyid kyi theg pa gang yin pa de la dri ma med pa'i tshul 'di gang dag skrag pa de dag ni chos kyi de kho na nyid ji
analyzed: de'i phyir dri ma med pa 'di ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i skyon gyis stong pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa yin la / chos kyi de kho na nyid mchog tu zab pa mi shes pa shes par byed pa'i phyir tshul de stong pa nyid kyi theg pa gang yin pa de la dri ma med pa'i tshul 'di gang dag skrag pa de dag ni chos kyi de kho na nyid ji
translated: Therefore, this stainlessness is extremely pure because it is empty of the faults of superimposition and denial.üîΩBecause it causes the understanding of the profound, supreme reality of phenomena that is not understood, the vehicle of emptiness, the stainless way, is taught by the buddhas, the tathagatas, who clearly reveal the unmistaken reality of phenomena through the method of etymological definitions.

original: lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de bzhin du ston par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad cing bstan pa ma rtogs
analyzed: lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de bzhin du ston par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis phyin ci ma log pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid gsal bar byed pa'i sangs rgyas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bshad cing bstan pa ma rtogs
translated: Those who are afraid of that reality, as it is taught, do not understand the explanation of the tathagatas.

original: nas te / dgongs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid ma nges nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nas te / dgongs pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi de kho na nyid ma nges nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means: without ascertaining reality just as it is.

original: 'dir de kho na nyid nges pa ci 'dra ba gang yod na skrag pa mi skye ba de gsal bar bya bar bzhed pa ni /üîΩ'di brten @373a * //
analyzed: 'dir de kho na nyid nges pa ci 'dra ba gang yod na skrag pa mi skye ba de gsal bar bya bar bzhed pa ni / 'di brten @373a * //
translated: Here, in order to make clear what kind of ascertainment of reality there is when fear does not arise, he says:

original: 'di 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩrgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'di la brten pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po 'di la brten pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis arises in dependence on that.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the way of the world, that this result, which is accepted as the effect, arises, i.e., is produced, in dependence on this thing, which is accepted as the cause.

original: brten nas 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'di 'byung ba ste skye ba zhes 'jig rten mtha' dag la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i tshul 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul 'gog par mi mdzad pa ste mi spong pa nyid do zhes kun rdzob kyi bden
analyzed: brten nas 'bras bur mngon par 'dod pa 'di 'byung ba ste skye ba zhes 'jig rten mtha' dag la grags pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i tshul 'di rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul 'gog par mi mdzad pa ste mi spong pa nyid do zhes kun rdzob kyi bden
translated: Since this is well known to everyone, this way of the world is not refuted, i.e., is not rejected, by the way of dependent origination.

original: pa la brten pa'i bstan pa la de kho na nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: pa la brten pa'i bstan pa la de kho na nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in the teaching based on conventional truth, there is ascertainment of reality.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa de la ni //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la brten pa de la ni //
translated: But in regard to that based on ultimate truth,

original: rten 'byung gang de rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: rten 'byung gang de rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen is essenceless.

original: de kho na nyid du sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: In reality, it does not exist, like an illusion, and so forth.

original: gang de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de yang 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid khas len par byed pa na yang ji ltar de snang ba de gang gis na yod de /
analyzed: gang de kho na nyid du yod pa ma yin pa de yang 'ga' zhig yod pa nyid khas len par byed pa na yang ji ltar de snang ba de gang gis na yod de /
translated: And whatever does not exist in reality, even if one accepts that it exists, how could it appear as it does?

original: ji ltar yang de yod par yang mi 'gyur pa nyid ces de kho na nyid du nges pa'o //üîΩda ni gang dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can rnams dang / gang yang dman pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can de dag thams cad 'di nyid la rab tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir tshul 'di ni mngon par 'dod ba'i 'bras bu grub bsgrub par byed pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas don chen po nyid du bstan
analyzed: ji ltar yang de yod par yang mi 'gyur pa nyid ces de kho na nyid du nges pa'o // da ni gang dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can rnams dang / gang yang dman pa'i byang chub kyi rigs can de dag thams cad 'di nyid la rab tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir tshul 'di ni mngon par 'dod ba'i 'bras bu grub bsgrub par byed pa nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas don chen po nyid du bstan
translated: It is certain that it is not existent in reality.

original: pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis /
analyzed: pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa gnyis /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the great purpose of this method, which is to cause all those who have the lineage of perfect enlightenment and those who have the lineage of inferior enlightenment to enter into this method, two verses are presented to demonstrate its establishment of the desired result.

original: tshul 'di rigs pas rjes dpog gang //
analyzed: tshul 'di rigs pas rjes dpog gang //
translated: This method is to be inferred by reasoning.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos byang chub dam pa'i rigs can rnams de la yang dag par rtogs par byed do //üîΩbyang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i sgrub pa po gang thog mar lung las thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas stong pa nyid bdun cu pas bstan pa'i theg pa dam pa'i tshul 'di khong du chud nas rigs pas te 'thad pas /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos byang chub dam pa'i rigs can rnams de la yang dag par rtogs par byed do // byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i sgrub pa po gang thog mar lung las thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pas stong pa nyid bdun cu pas bstan pa'i theg pa dam pa'i tshul 'di khong du chud nas rigs pas te 'thad pas /
translated: In this regard, the first verse causes those who have the lineage of the highest enlightenment to understand it.

original: rkyen las skyes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags las rjes su dpog pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags las rjes su dpog pa ste /
translated: The practitioner who has generated the thought of enlightenment, having first understood this method of the highest vehicle, which is taught by the Yuktisastika on emptiness, by means of the knowledge whose nature is hearing from the scriptures, ascertains it by means of reasoning, by means of inference from the reason of being born from conditions, etc.

original: rigs pa las skyes pa bsam pa'i rang bzhin shes pas nges par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa las skyes pa bsam pa'i rang bzhin shes pas nges par byed pa'o //
translated: He ascertains it by means of the knowledge whose nature is reflection, which is born from reasoning.

original: de'i 'og tu dang ldan te mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dang ldan te mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: Then, he is endowed with it, endowed with the faith whose nature is full conviction.

original: yang dag tshol lhur len pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag tshol lhur len pa ste /
translated: He is intent on the correct search,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i yang dag tshol ba de rjes su tshol ba'i sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dag gis goms pa'i rim pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i yang dag tshol ba de rjes su tshol ba'i sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dag gis goms pa'i rim pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization is the realization by the stages of cultivation in the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: @373b der lhur len pa ni yid gzhan du mi gtod pa'o //
analyzed: @373b der lhur len pa ni yid gzhan du mi gtod pa'o //
translated: The devotion is the non-distraction of the mind to other things.

original: de'i bar du yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag las gdams ngag thob pa na yang chos bstan 'ga' yang mi brten pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bar du yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag las gdams ngag thob pa na yang chos bstan 'ga' yang mi brten pa ste /
translated: And in the middle, when one receives instructions from the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, one does not rely on any teachings.

original: chos ni shes bya dang / spang bya dang / rnam par dag pa la sogs pa gang bstan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdams ngag gis ston pa 'ga' zhig la yang mi brten pa chos ston pa 'ga' zhig la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni shes bya dang / spang bya dang / rnam par dag pa la sogs pa gang bstan pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gdams ngag gis ston pa 'ga' zhig la yang mi brten pa chos ston pa 'ga' zhig la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa ste /
translated: The Dharma is the teachings of the knowable, the abandonable, the pure, and so forth. One does not rely on any teachings of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. One has no attachment to any teachings.üîΩAs it is said:

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po ni //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po ni //
translated: Just as an illusory elephant

original: sgyu ma'i seng ges nyams byed pa //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i seng ges nyams byed pa //
translated: is destroyed by an illusory lion,üîΩso also is the false imagination

original: bden min de bzhin log rtogs ni //
analyzed: bden min de bzhin log rtogs ni //
translated: destroyed by the correct imagination.

original: de nyid nges par nyams par byed //
analyzed: de nyid nges par nyams par byed //
translated: One should definitely destroy that.

original: ces pa'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad la sgyu ma lta bu nyid du lhag par mos pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i tshul gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs thams cad la sgyu ma lta bu nyid du lhag par mos pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, one attains the conviction that all adverse factors and remedial factors are like illusions.

original: gang yang de ltar goms pa khyad par can gyi gnas skabs la lhag par zhugs par gyur pa de ni dngos po med pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag spangs nas zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang de ltar goms pa khyad par can gyi gnas skabs la lhag par zhugs par gyur pa de ni dngos po med pa dang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag spangs nas zhi ba ste /
translated: Moreover, one who has entered the special stage of such practice abandons non-entities, sa·πÉsƒÅra, and nirvƒÅ·πáa, and attains peace.

original: de dag la mngon par zhen pa med cing rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag par thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la mngon par zhen pa med cing rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag par thob par byed pa ste /
translated: One becomes free from attachment to those and attains complete purity in every way.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means one attains non-abiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gang yang bdag nyid 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog par 'dod pas rkyen nyid 'di pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang bdag nyid 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ldog par 'dod pas rkyen nyid 'di pa ste /
translated: Moreover, one who wishes to turn away from the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra should understand the meaning of ‚Äúthis conditionality.‚Äù

original: rkyen 'di skye ba ga la yod pa de ni rkyen 'di pa yin la /
analyzed: rkyen 'di skye ba ga la yod pa de ni rkyen 'di pa yin la /
translated: How could there be arising of this condition? This is ‚Äúthis conditionality.‚Äù

original: de nyid rkyen 'di pa ste bdag med pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la de ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen 'di pa ste bdag med pa nyid kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la de ni rkyen nyid 'di pa'o //
translated: That is the conditionality of this, i.e., it is only the dependent origination of selflessness.

original: 'di na de lta bu'i ngo bo ste sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i rang bzhin du tshor ba dang / sbyor ba dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i rig pas rig cing khong du chud la /
analyzed: 'di na de lta bu'i ngo bo ste sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du brdzun pa'i rang bzhin du tshor ba dang / sbyor ba dang / mthong ba la sogs pa'i rig pas rig cing khong du chud la /
translated: Here, by the knowledge of feeling, application, seeing, etc., one knows and understands that such is the nature of this, i.e., it is false by nature like an illusion, etc.

original: de shes nas kyang lta ngan dra ba kun te /
analyzed: de shes nas kyang lta ngan dra ba kun te /
translated: And having known that, one should cut the net of all bad views.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin dang log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i lta ba gang bden pa mthong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ngan pa ste de nyid dang des nye bar mtshon pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i phra rgyas ni dra ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir dra ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin dang log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i lta ba gang bden pa mthong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ngan pa ste de nyid dang des nye bar mtshon pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i phra rgyas ni dra ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir dra ba ste /
translated: Because they are bad because they are the root of samsara, they are like a net because they are like a net that binds.

original: @374a * // 'ching ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @374a * // 'ching ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis of bondage.üîΩBy stopping all of them without exception, by the path of seeing, one becomes free of them.

original: de kun ma lus pa ldog pa ste mthong ba'i lam gyis mi ldan par byas pa des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / rmongs pa dang / khong khro ba dang / des nye bar mtshon pa'i nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de kun ma lus pa ldog pa ste mthong ba'i lam gyis mi ldan par byas pa des 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / rmongs pa dang / khong khro ba dang / des nye bar mtshon pa'i nga rgyal spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: By that, one abandons attachment, ignorance and anger that are objects to be abandoned by the transcendent path of meditation and one abandons pride and so on that are illustrated by them.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spangs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis spangs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one obtains abandonment through the supramundane path of cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi dri ma'i gdon dang bral ba nyid kyis ma gos pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mtha' dag gi dri ma'i gdon dang bral ba nyid kyis ma gos pa yin la /
translated: It is unsoiled because it is free from the demon of the stain of all the afflictions.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nirvana is that which is called

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bos so sor rang gis rig bar bya'o /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i skye bos so sor rang gis rig bar bya'o /
translated: ‚Äúthat‚Äù by the noble beings who personally experience it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de thob pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de thob pa ste /
translated: One obtains that nirvana,

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba thob pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means that one obtains liberation from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir gang la dngos po pa nyid du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs ba'i rnam par mthong ba sdug bsngal zad par nus pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad bstan pa yin te / gang gi phyir gang la dngos po pa nyid du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs ba'i rnam par mthong ba sdug bsngal zad par nus pa yin na /
translated: This is what is taught by this verse.üîΩSince one sees dependent origination as impermanent, suffering, and so on, even in terms of its real nature, one is able to extinguish suffering.

original: dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang chos mthun par lta smos kyang cing gos /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang chos mthun par lta smos kyang cing gos /
translated: So what need is there to mention that one will be able to extinguish suffering by seeing dependent origination as similar to a magical illusion, a city of gandharvas, and so on?

original: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis kyang rgyal ba bskyed ma las nyan thos kyi byang chub la slob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'di nyid kyis kyang rgyal ba bskyed ma las nyan thos kyi byang chub la slob par 'dod pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And by this very intention, the Mother of Conquerors says, ‚ÄúEven one who wishes to train in the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas should train in this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na theg pa chen po 'di don chen po can yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //üîΩbskal pa mi nyung rab goms pa'i //
analyzed: de lta bas na theg pa chen po 'di don chen po can yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no // bskal pa mi nyung rab goms pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is established that this Great Vehicle has great meaning.üîΩThe great noble NƒÅgƒÅrjunaüîΩhas great merit and wisdom from long

analyzed: bsod nams ye shes blo che ba'i //
translated: familiarization over many eons.üîΩI have a mind that is directed

translated: toward his scriptures.

analyzed: de lta na yang gang gi phyir //

analyzed: 'bad byas med pa de yi phyir //

analyzed: slob dpon dam pa zla dpal zhabs //

original: bdag blo'i nus pa thob pa yis //
analyzed: bdag blo'i nus pa thob pa yis //

analyzed: bdag gi rmongs pa 'dir 'khrul gang //

original: cung zad byung ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: cung zad byung ba gang yin pa //

analyzed: khyed rnams kyis ni bzod byas te //
translated: is due to your forbearance,

original: gang phyir bdag 'dra kun mkhyen ming //
analyzed: gang phyir bdag 'dra kun mkhyen ming //

analyzed: de las kun da kha ba mu tig dang // zla 'dra'i bsod nams rgya chen gang byung des //

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni spros kun nyer zhi bas // rnam dag rang gi chos @374b nyid rtogs par shog / kha che'i yul gyi mkhas pa chen po slob dpon so ma shr'i'i zhal snga nas kyi zhabs kyi rdul la nye bar brten par mdzad pa'i slob dpon mkhas pa chen po dpal gzhan la phan pa'i zhal snga
